sentence: While my friend, George, was reading in bed, two thieves climbed into his kitchen.

sentence: George heard the noise and came downstairs quickly.

sentence: He turned on the light, but he couldn't see anyone.

sentence: The thieves had already gone.

sentence: But George's parrot, Henry, was still there.

sentence: 'Nothing, Henry,' George said and smiled.

sentence: --- lesson 141  Sally's first train ride
sentencecn: 萨莉第一交乘火车旅行

sentence: Last week, my four-year-old daughter, Sally, was invited to a children's party.
sentencecn: 上周，我4岁的女儿萨莉被邀请去参加一个儿童聚会。

sentence: I decided to take her by train.
sentencecn: 我决定带她乘火车去。

sentence: Sally was very excited because she had never travelled on a train before.
sentencecn: 萨莉非常激动，因为她从未乘过火车。

sentence: She sat near the window and asked questions about everything she saw.
sentencecn: 她靠车窗坐着，对她所看到的一切都要问个明白。

sentence: Suddenly, a middle-age lady got on the train and sat opposite Sally.
sentencecn: 突然，一个中年妇女上了火车，坐在萨莉的对面。

sentence: 'Hello, little girl,' she said.
sentencecn: “你好，小姑娘，”她说。

sentence: Sally did not answer, but looked at her curiously.
sentencecn: 萨莉没回答，却好奇地看着她。

sentence: The lady was dressed in a blue coat and a large, funny hat.
sentencecn: 那位妇女穿着一件蓝色的大衣，戴着一顶大而滑稽的帽子。

sentence: After the train had left the station, the lady opened her handbag and took out her powder compact.
sentencecn: 火车开出车站后，那位妇女找开了手提包，拿出了粉盒。

sentence: She then began to make up her face.
sentencecn: 然后她开始打扮起来。

sentence: 'Why are you doing that?' Sally asked.
sentencecn: “你为什么要那样做呢？”萨莉问。

sentence: 'To make myself beautiful,' the lady answered.
sentencecn: “为了把自己打扮漂亮啊，”那位妇女答道。

sentence: She put away her compact and smiled kindly.
sentencecn: 她放好了粉盒，慈祥地微笑着。

sentence: 'But you are still ugly,' Sally said.
sentencecn: “可是你仍然难看呀，”萨莉说。

sentence: Sally was amused, but I was very embarrassed!
sentencecn: 萨莉感到很有趣，而我却很尴尬。

sentence: --- Lesson 18  He often does this!

sentence: After I had had lunch at a village pub, I looked for my bag.
sentencecn: 我在一家乡村小酒店吃过午饭后，就找我的提包。

sentence: I had left it on a chair beside the door and now it wasn't there!
sentencecn: 我曾把它放在门边的椅子上，可这会儿不见了！

sentence: As I was looking for it, the landlord came in.
sentencecn: 当我正在寻找时，酒店老板走了进来。

sentence: 'Did you have a good meal?' he asked.
sentencecn: “您吃得好吗？”他问。

sentence: 'Yes, thank you,' I answered, 'but I can't pay the bill. I haven't got my bag.'
sentencecn: “很好，谢谢。”我回答，“但我付不了帐，我的提包没有了。”

sentence: The landlord smiled and immediately went out.
sentencecn: 酒店老板笑了笑，马上走了出去。

sentence: In a few minutes he returned with my bag and gave it back to me.
sentencecn: 一会儿工夫他拿着我的提包回来了，把它还给了我。

sentence: 'I'm very sorry,' he said. 'My dog had taken it into the garden. He often does this!'
sentencecn: “实在抱歉，”他说，“我的狗把它弄到花园里去了，他常干这种事！”

sentence: --- Lesson 24  It could be worse

sentence: I entered the hotel manager's office and sat down.
sentencecn: 我走进饭店经理的办公室，坐了下来。

sentence: I had just lost £50 and I felt very upset.

sentence: 'I left the money in my room,' I said, 'and it's not there now.'
sentencecn: “我把钱放在房间里，”我说，“可现在没有了。”

sentence: The manager was sympathetic, but he could do nothing.
sentencecn: 经理深表同情，但却无能为力。

sentence: 'Everyone's losing money these days,' he said.
sentencecn: “现在大家都在丢钱，”他说。

sentence: He started to complain about this wicked world but was interrupted by a knock at the door.
sentencecn: 他开始抱怨起这个邪恶的世道来，却被一阵敲门声打断了。

sentence: A girl came in and put an envelope on his desk.
sentencecn: 一个姑娘走了进来，把一个信封放在了他桌上。

sentence: It contained £50.
sentencecn: 它里面装着50英镑。

sentence: 'I found this outside this gentleman's room,' she said.
sentencecn: “这是我在这位先生的房门外捡到的，”她说。

sentence: 'Well,' I said to the manager, 'there is still some honesty in this world!'
sentencecn: “是啊，”我对那位经理说，“这世界上还是有诚实可言的！”

sentence: --- Lesson 33  Out of darkness
sentencecn: 冲出黑暗

sentence: Nearly a week passed before the girl was able to explain what had happened to her.
sentencecn: 几乎过了一个星期，那姑娘才能讲述自己的遭遇。

sentence: One afternoon she set out from the coast in a small boat and was caught in a storm.
sentencecn: 一天下午，她乘小船从海岸出发，遇上了风暴。

sentence: Towards evening, the boat struck a rock and the girl jumped into the sea.
sentencecn: 天将黑时，小船撞在了一块礁石上，姑娘跳进了海里。

sentence: Then she swam to the shore after spending the whole night in the water.
sentencecn: 她在海里游了整整一夜才游到岸边。

sentence: During that time she covered a distance of eight miles.
sentencecn: 在那段时间里，她游了8英里。

sentence: Early next morning, she saw a light ahead.
sentencecn: 第二天凌晨，她看到前方有灯光，

sentence: She knew she was near the shore because the light was high up on the cliffs.
sentencecn: 知道自己已经接近岸边了，因为那灯光是在高高的峭壁上。

sentence: On arriving at the shore, the girl struggled up the cliff towards the light she had seen.
sentencecn: 到达岸边后，姑娘朝着她看到的灯光方向挣扎着往峭壁上爬去。

sentence: That was all she remembered.
sentencecn: 她所记得的就是这些。

sentence: When she woke up a day later, she found herself in hospital.
sentencecn: 第二天她醒来时，发现自己躺在医院里。

sentence: --- Lesson 41  Do you call that a hat?
sentencecn: 你把那个叫帽子吗？

sentence: 'Do you call that a hat?' I said to my wife.
sentencecn: “你把那个叫帽子吗？”我对妻子说。

sentence: 'You needn't be so rude about it,' my wife answered as she looked at herself in the mirror.
sentencecn: “你说话没必要这样不客气，”我的妻子边回答边照着镜子。

sentence: I sat down on one of those modern chairs with holes in it and waited.
sentencecn: 我坐在一个新式的满是网眼儿的椅子上，等待着。

sentence: We had been in the hat shop for half an hour and my wife was still in front of the mirror.
sentencecn: 我们在这家帽店已经呆了半个小时了，而我的妻子仍在镜子面前。

sentence: 'We mustn't buy things we don't need,' I remarked suddenly. I regretted saying it almost at once.
sentencecn: “我们不应该买我们不需要的东西，”我突然发表意见说，但马上又后悔说了这话。

sentence: 'You needn't have said that,' my wife answered.
sentencecn: “你没必要这么说，”我妻子回答说，

sentence: 'I needn't remind you of that terrible tie you bought yesterday.'
sentencecn: “我也不必提醒你昨天买的那条糟糕透了的领带。”

sentence: 'I find it beautiful,' I said. 'A man can never have too many ties.'
sentencecn: “我觉得它好看，”我说，“男人有多少领带也不会嫌多。”

sentence: 'And a woman can't have too many hats,' she answered.
sentencecn: “女人有多少帽子也不嫌多。”她回答。

sentence: Ten minutes later we walked out of the shop together.
sentencecn: 10分钟以后，我们一道走出了商店。

sentence: My wife was wearing a hat that looked like a lighthouse!
sentencecn: 我妻子戴着一顶像灯塔一样的帽子。

sentence: --- Lesson 47  A thirsty ghost
sentencecn: 嗜酒的鬼魂

sentence: A public house which was recently bought by Mr.Ian Thompson is up for sale.
sentencecn: 伊恩.汤普森先生最近才买的一个小酒店现在又要卖出去。

sentence: Mr.Thompson is going to sell it because it is haunted.
sentencecn: 汤普森先生之所以想卖它，是因为那里常闹鬼。

sentence: He told me that he could not go to sleep one night because he heard a strange noise coming from the bar.
sentencecn: 他告诉我有天夜里他怎么也睡不着，因为他听到酒吧里传来一阵奇怪的响声。

sentence: The next morning, he found that the doors had been blocked by chairs and the furniture had been moved.
sentencecn: 第二天早上，他发现酒吧间的门被椅子堵上了，家具也被挪动过。

sentence: Though Mr.Thompson had turned the lights off before he went to bed, they were on in the morning.
sentencecn: 虽然汤普森临睡觉时把灯关了，但早晨灯却都亮着。

sentence: He also said that he had found five empty whisky bottles which the ghost must have drunk the night before.
sentencecn: 他还说他发现了5只空的威士忌酒瓶子，这肯定是鬼魂昨天晚上喝的。

sentence: When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head.
sentencecn: 当我暗示说一定是村里有些人来喝不花钱的酒时，汤普森先生摇了摇头。

sentence: The villagers have told him that they will not accept the pub even if he gives it away.
sentencecn: 村里的人已经告诉他，即使他把小酒店白送人，他们也不要。

sentence: --- Lesson 54  Sticky fingers
sentencecn: 粘糊的手指

sentence: After breakfast, I sent the children to school and then I went to the shops.
sentencecn: 早饭后，我送孩子们上学，然后就去了商店。

sentence: It was still early when I returned home.
sentencecn: 我回到家时，时间还早。

sentence: The children were at school, my husband was at work and the house was quiet.
sentencecn: 孩子们在上学，我丈夫在上班，家里清静得很。

sentence: So I decided to make some meat pies.
sentencecn: 于是我决定做些肉馅饼。

sentence: In a short time I was busy mixing butter and flour and my hands were soon covered with sticky pastry.
sentencecn: 不一会儿我就忙着调拌起了黄油和面粉，很快我的手上就沾满了粘粘的面糊。

sentence: At exactly that moment, the telephone rang.
sentencecn: 恰恰在此时，电话铃响了。

sentence: Nothing could have been more annoying.
sentencecn: 没有什么能比这更烦人了。

sentence: I picked up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice of Helen Bates.
sentencecn: 我用两个沾满面糊的手指捏起了话筒。当听出是海伦.贝茨的声音时，非常丧气。

sentence: It took me ten minutes to persuade her to ring back later.
sentencecn: 我用了10分钟的时间才说服她过会儿再来电话。

sentence: At last I hung up the receiver.
sentencecn: 我终于挂上了话筒。

sentence: What a mess! There was pastry on my fingers, on the telephone, and on the doorknobs.
sentencecn: 真是糟糕透了！我的手指上、电话机上以及门的把手上，都沾上了面糊。

sentence: I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud enough to wake the dead.
sentencecn: 我刚回到厨房，门铃又响了起来，响声足以把死人唤醒。

sentence: This time it was the postman and he wanted me to sign for a registered letter!
sentencecn: 这次是邮递员，他要我签收一封挂号信！

sentence: --- Lesson 58  A blessing in disguise?
sentencecn: 是因祸得福吗？

sentence: The tiny village of Frinley is said to possess a 'cursed tree'.
sentencecn: 据说弗林利这个小村里有一棵“该诅咒的树”。

sentence: Because the tree was mentioned in a newspaper, the number of visitors to Frinley has now increased.
sentencecn: 就因为报上提到过这棵树，所以现在来弗林利参观的人越来越多。

sentence: The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago,
sentencecn: 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，

sentence: but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation.
sentencecn: 但只是近几年才得到了一个坏名声。

sentence: It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he will have bad luck;
sentencecn: 据说，谁要是触摸了这棵树，谁就会交上恶运；

sentence: if he picks a leaf, he will die.
sentencecn: 如果谁摘了一片树叶，谁就会死去。

sentence: Many villagers believe that the tree has already claimed a number of victims.
sentencecn: 很多村民相信此树已经害了不少人。

sentence: The vicar has been asked to have the tree cut down, but so far he has refused.
sentencecn: 人们曾请求教区的牧师叫人把树砍掉，但他直到现在也没有同意。

sentence: He has pointed out that the tree is a useful source of income,as tourists have been coming from all parts of the country to see it.
sentencecn: 他指出，由于人们从全国各地纷纷前来参观这棵树，它成了一个有用的财源。

sentence: In spite of all that has been said, the tourists have been picking leaves and cutting their names on the tree-trunk.
sentencecn: 尽管有上述种种说法，但游客们还是照常摘树叶和把他们的名字刻在树干上。

sentence: So far, not one of them has been struck down by sudden death!
sentencecn: 然而到目前为止，还没有一个人暴死呢！

sentence: --- Lesson 66  Sweet as honey!
sentencecn: 像蜜一样甜！

sentence: In 1963 a Lancaster bomber crashed on Wallis Island, a remote place in the South Pacific, a long way west of Samoa.
sentencecn: 1963年，一架兰开斯特轰炸机在瓦立斯岛坠毁。那是南太平洋中一个很偏僻的小岛，位于萨摩亚群岛以西，距离群岛还有很长一段距离。

sentence: The plane wasn't too badly damaged, but over the years, the crash was forgotten and the wreck remained undisturbed.
sentencecn: 飞机损坏的程度并不严重，但是，多年来这起飞机失事已被遗忘，飞机残骸也没受到破坏。

sentence: Then in 1989, twenty-six years after the crash, the plane was accidentally rediscovered in an aerial survey of the island.
sentencecn: 于是，到了1989年，飞机失事26年后，在对小岛的一次航空勘查中那架飞机被意外地发现了。

sentence: By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing.
sentencecn: 到了那个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。

sentence: The French authorities had the plane packaged and moved in parts back to France.
sentencecn: 法国政府让人把飞机包装起来，一部分一部分地搬回法国。

sentence: Now a group of enthusiasts are going to have the plane restored.
sentencecn: 一群热心人计划修复这架飞机。

sentence: It has four Rolls-Royce Merlin engines, but the group will need to have only three of them rebuilt.
sentencecn: 该飞机装装配有4台罗尔斯-罗伊斯的默林发动机，但是他们只需要修复其中的3台。

sentence: Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey -- still in perfect condition.
sentencecn: 想一想他们所感受到的惊奇和兴奋 -- 当他们拆开包装箱时，他们发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 -- 发动机完好无损。

sentence: A colony of bees had turned the engine into a hive and it was totally preserved in beeswax!
sentencecn: 一群蜜蜂把发动机当作了蜂房，发动机在蜂蜡中被完整地保存了下来。

sentence: --- Lesson 74  Out of the limelight
sentencecn: 舞台之外

sentence: An ancient bus stopped by a dry river bed and a party of famous actors and actresses got off.
sentencecn: 一辆古旧的汽车停在一条干涸的河床边，一群著名男女演员下了车。

sentence: Dressed in dark glasses and old clothes, they had taken special precautions so that no one should recognize them.
sentencecn: 他们戴着墨镜，穿着旧衣裳，特别小心以防别人认出他们。

sentence: But as they soon discovered, disguises can sometimes be too perfect.
sentencecn: 但他们很快就发觉，化装的效果有时过分完美了。

sentence: 'This is a wonderful place for a picnic,' said Gloria Gleam.
sentencecn: “在这个地方野餐简直太妙了，”格格利亚.格利姆说。

sentence: 'It couldn't be better, Gloria,' Brinksley Meers agreed.
sentencecn: “是再好不过的了，格格利亚。”布林克斯利.米尔斯表示同意，

sentence: 'No newspaper men, no film fans! Why don't we come more often?'
sentencecn: “没有记者，没有影迷！我们为什么不经常来这里呢？”

sentence: Meanwhile, two other actors, Rockwall Slinger and Merlin Greeves, had carried two large food baskets to a shady spot under some trees.
sentencecn: 此时，另外两位演员，罗克沃尔.斯林格和默林.格里夫斯，已经把两个大食品篮子提到了一片树荫下。

sentence: When they had all made themselves comfortable, a stranger appeared.
sentencecn: 当他们都已安排舒适时，一个陌生人出现了。

sentence: He looked very angry.
sentencecn: 他看上去非常气愤。

sentence: 'Now you get out of here, all of you!' he shouted. 'I'm sheriff here. Do you See that notice? It says" No Camping"—in case you can't read!'
sentencecn: “你们都从这里走开，全都走开！”他大叫着，"我是这里的司法长官。你们看到那个公告牌了吗？上面写着‘禁止野营’——除非你们不识字！”

sentence: 'Look, sheriff,' said Rockwall, 'don't be too hard on us.
sentencecn: “好了，好了，司法官，”罗克沃尔说， “别使我们难堪。

sentence: I'm Rockwall Slinger and this is Merlin Greeves.'
sentencecn: 我是罗克沃尔·斯林格，这位是默林·格里夫斯。”

sentence: 'Oh, is it?' said the sheriff with a sneer.
sentencecn: “噢，是吗？”那位司法长官冷笑一声说道，

sentence: 'Well, I'm Brinksley Meers, and my other name is Gloria Gleam.
sentencecn: “好，我就是布林克斯利·米尔斯。我还有一个名字叫格格利亚·格利姆。

sentence: Now you get out of here fast!'
sentencecn: 现在你们赶快滚吧！”

sentence: --- Lesson 80  The Crystal Palace
sentencecn: 水晶宫

sentence: Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace,
sentencecn: 19世纪最不寻常的建筑也许要数水晶宫了，

sentence: which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851.
sentencecn: 它是为1851年的“世界博览会”而建在海德公园的。

sentence: The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass.
sentencecn: 这座水晶宫不同于世界上所有的其他建筑，因为它是用钢和玻璃建成的。

sentence: It was one of the biggest buildings of all time and a lot of people from many countries came to see it.
sentencecn: 它是有史以来最高大的建筑物之一，因此，人们从各个国家纷纷前来参观。

sentence: A great many goods were sent to the exhibition from various parts of the world.
sentencecn: 大量的商品从世界各地运送到了博览会，

sentence: There was also a great deal of machinery on display.
sentencecn: 参展的还有很多机器，

sentence: The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Nasmyth's steam hammer.
sentencecn: 其中最奇妙的是内史密斯的蒸汽锤。

sentence: Though in those days, travelling was not as easy as it is today, steam boats carried thousands of visitors across the Channel from Europe.
sentencecn: 尽管在当时旅行不像现在这么容易，但汽船还是把成千上万的参观者从欧洲大陆送过了英吉利海峡。

sentence: On arriving in England, they were taken to the Crystal Palace by train.
sentencecn: 一到英国，火车就把他们送到了水晶宫。

sentence: There were six million visitors in all, and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges.
sentencecn: 参观的人数总共是600万。博览会的赢利用来建造博物馆和高等学校。

sentence: Later, the Crystal Palace was moved to South London.
sentencecn: 后来，“水晶宫”被移到了伦敦南部。

sentence: It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936.
sentencecn: 在1936年被焚毁之前，它一直是世界上最著名的建筑物之一。

sentence: --- Lesson 87  A perfect alibi
sentencecn: 极好的不在犯罪现场的证据

sentence: 'At the time the murder was committed, I was travelling on the 8 o'clock train to London,' said the man.
sentencecn: “在凶杀发生的时候，我正坐在8点钟开往伦敦的火车上。”那人说。

sentence: 'Do you always catch such an early train?' asked the inspector.
sentencecn: “您总是赶这样早的火车？”探长问。

sentence: 'Of course I do,' answered the man. 'I must be at work at 10 o'clock. My employer will confirm that I was there on time.'
sentencecn: “当然是的，”那人回答。“我必须在10点钟上班，我的雇主会证明我是按时到了那儿的。”

sentence: 'Would a later train get you to work on time?' asked the inspector.
sentencecn: “晚一点儿的车也能送您按时上班吗？”

sentence: 'I suppose it would, but I never catch a later train.'
sentencecn: “我认为可以，但我从来不乘晚一点儿的车。”

sentence: 'At what time did you arrive at the station?'
sentencecn: “您几点钟到的火车站？”

sentence: 'At ten to eight. I bought a paper and waited for the train.'
sentencecn: “7点50分。我买了张报纸，等着车来。”

sentence: 'And you didn't notice anything unusual?'
sentencecn: “您没有注意到有什么异常情况发生吗？”

sentence: 'Of course not.'
sentencecn: “当然没有。”

sentence: 'I suggest,' said the inspector,
sentencecn: “我提醒您，”探长说，

sentence: 'that you are not telling the truth.
sentencecn: “您讲的不是实话。

sentence: I suggest that you did not catch the 8 o'clock train, but that you caught the 8.25 which would still get you to work on time.
sentencecn: 您乘的不是8点钟的火车，而是8点25分的，这次车同样能使您按时上班。

sentence: You see, on the morning of the murder, the 8 o'clock train did not run at all.
sentencecn: 您看，在凶杀发生的那天早晨，8点钟的那次车根本没有发。

sentence: It broke down at Ferngreen station and was taken off the line.'
sentencecn: 它在芬格林车站出了故障而被取消了。”

sentence: --- Lesson 94  Future champions
sentencecn: 未来的冠军

sentence: Experiments have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age.
sentencecn: 实验证明，儿童在很小的时候就可以开始学习游泳。

sentence: At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles,
sentencecn: 在洛杉矶的一个特设的游泳池里，

sentence: children become expert at holding their breath under water even before they can walk.
sentencecn: 孩子们甚至在还没有学会走路时就已经能熟练地在水下屏住呼吸了。

sentence: Babies of two months old do not appear to be reluctant to enter the water.
sentencecn: 两个月的婴儿并未显得不愿意入水。

sentence: It is not long before they are so accustomed to swimming that they can pick up weights from the floor of the pool.
sentencecn: 他们很快便适应了游泳，以致能捡起池底的物品。

sentence: A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race.
sentencecn: 这些幼小的游泳运动员非常喜爱的一种游戏是水下三轮车比赛。

sentence: Tricycles are lined up on the floor of the pool seven feet under water.
sentencecn: 三轮车并排放在7英尺深的游泳池底上。

sentence: The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool.
sentencecn: 孩子们比赛看谁先到达游泳池的另一端。

sentence: Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them.
sentencecn: 很多孩子用脚蹬车，但多数孩子更愿意推或是拉着三轮车。

sentence: Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once.
sentencecn: 有些孩子能够跑完游泳池的全长而不用露出水面换气。

sentence: Whether they will ever become future Olympic champions, only time will tell.
sentencecn: 他们将来是否能成为奥林匹克的冠军，这只能由时间来作出回答。

sentence: Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air.
sentencecn: 与此同时，他们对我们中的那些游不了5码就已喘不过气来的人应该是种鼓舞。

sentence: --- lesson 5  The facts
sentencecn: 确切数字

sentence: Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics.
sentencecn: 报刊杂志的编辑常常为了向读者提供成立一些关紧要的事实和统计数字而走向极端。

sentence: Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president's palace in a new African republic.
sentencecn: 去年，一位记者受一家有名的杂志的委托写一篇关于非洲某个新成立共和国总统府的文章。

sentence: When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it.
sentencecn: 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

sentence: The article began: 'Hundreds of steps lead to the high wall which surrounds the president's palace'.
sentencecn: 文章的开头是这样的：“几百级台阶通向环绕总统的高墙。”

sentence: The editor at once sent the journalist a fax instructing him to find out the exact number of steps and the height of the wall.
sentencecn: 编辑立即给那位记者发去传真，要求他核实一下台阶的确切数字和围墙的高度。

sentence: The journalist immediately set out to obtain these important facts,
sentencecn: 记者立即出发去核实这些重要的事实，

sentence: but he took a long time to send them. Meanwhile, the editor was getting impatient, for the magazine would soon go to press.
sentencecn: 但过了好长时间不见他把数字寄来，在此期间，编辑等得不耐烦了，因为杂志马上要付印。

sentence: He sent the journalist two more faxes, but received no reply.
sentencecn: 他给记者先后发去两份传真，但对方毫无反应。

sentence: He sent yet another fax informing the journalist that if he did not reply soon he would be fired.
sentencecn: 于是他又发了一份传真，通知那位记者说，若再不迅速答复，将被解雇。

sentence: When the journalist again failed to reply, the editor reluctantly published the article as it had originally been written.
sentencecn: 但记者还是没有回复。编辑无奈，勉强按原样发稿了。

sentence: A week later, the editor at last received a fax from the journalist.
sentencecn: 一周之后，编辑终于接到了记者的传真。

sentence: Not only had the poor man been arrested, but he had been sent to prison as well.
sentencecn: 那个可怜的记者不仅被捕了，而且还被送进了监狱。

sentence: However, he had at last been allowed to send a fax in which he informed the editor
sentencecn: 不过，他终于获准发回了一份传真。在传真中他告诉编辑，

sentence: that he had been arrested while counting the 1,084 steps leading to the fifteen-foot wall which surrounded the president's palace.
sentencecn: 就在他数通向15英尺高的总统府围墙的1，084级台阶时，被抓了起来。

sentence: --- lesson 11  Not guilty
sentencecn: 无罪

sentence: Customs Officers are quite tolerant these days,
sentencecn: 现在的海关官员往往相当宽容。

sentence: but they can still stop you when you are going through the Green Channel and have nothing to declare.
sentencecn: 但是，当你通过绿色通道，没有任何东西需要申报时，他们仍可以拦住你。

sentence: Even really honest people are often made to feel guilty.
sentencecn: 甚至是最诚实的人也常弄得觉得有罪似的，

sentence: The hardened professional smuggler, on the other hand, is never troubled by such feelings, even if he has five hundred gold watches hidden in his suitcase.
sentencecn: 而老练的职业走私犯却即使在手提箱里藏着500只金表，却也处之泰然。

sentence: When I returned from abroad recently, a particularly officious young Customs Officer clearly regarded me as a smuggler.
sentencecn: 最近一次，我也出国归来，碰上一位特别好管闲事的年轻海关官员，他显然把我当成了走私犯。

sentence: 'Have you anything to declare?' he asked, looking me in the eye.
sentencecn: “您有什么需要申报的吗?”他直盯着我的眼睛问。

sentence: 'No,' I answered confidently.
sentencecn: “没有。”我自信地回答说。

sentence: 'Would you mind unlocking this suitcase please?'
sentencecn: “请打开这只手提箱好吗?”

sentence: 'Not at all,' I answered.
sentencecn: “好的。”我回答说。

sentence: The Officer went through the case with great care.
sentencecn: 那位官员十分仔细地把箱子检查了一遍。

sentence: All the things I had packed so carefully were soon in a dreadful mess.
sentencecn: 所有细心包装好的东西一会儿工夫就乱成一团。

sentence: I felt sure I would never be able to close the case again.
sentencecn: 我相信那箱子再也关不上了。

sentence: Suddenly, I saw the Officer's face light up.
sentencecn: 突然，我看到官员脸上露出了得意的神色。

sentence: He had spotted a tiny bottle at the bottom of my case and he pounced on it with delight.
sentencecn: 他在我的箱底发现了一只小瓶，高兴地一把抓了起来。

sentence: 'Perfume, eh?' he asked sarcastically.
sentencecn: “香水，嗯?”他讥讽地说道，

sentence: 'You should have declared that. Perfume is not exempt from import duty.'
sentencecn: “你刚才应该申报，香水要上进口税的。”

sentence: 'But it isn't perfume,' I said.
sentencecn: “不，这不是香水，”我说，

sentence: 'It's hair gel.' Then I added with a smile,
sentencecn: “是发胶。”接着我脸带微笑补充说：

sentence: 'It's a strange mixture I make myself.'
sentencecn: “这是一种我自己配制的奇特的混合物。”

sentence: As I expected, he did not believe me.
sentencecn: 果不出所料，他并不相信我。

sentence: 'Try it!' I said encouragingly.
sentencecn: “你就闻一闻吧！”我催促说。

sentence: The officer unscrewed the cap and put the bottle to his nostrils.
sentencecn: 海关官员拧开瓶盖，把瓶子放到鼻子底下。

sentence: He was greeted by an unpleasant smell which convinced him that I was telling the truth.
sentencecn: 一股怪味袭来，使他相信了我说的真话。

sentence: A few minutes later, I was able to hurry away with precious chalk marks on my baggage.
sentencecn: 几分钟后，我终于被放行，手提划着宝贵的粉笔记号的行李，匆匆离去。

sentence: --- lesson 18  Electric currents in modern art
sentencecn: 现代艺术的电流

sentence: Modern sculpture rarely surprises us any more.
sentencecn: 现代雕塑不再使我们感到惊讶了。

sentence: The idea that modern art can only be seen in museums is mistaken.
sentencecn: 那种认为现代艺术只能在博物馆里才能看到的观点是错误的。

sentence: Even people who take no interest in art cannot have failed to notice examples of modern sculpture on display in public places.
sentencecn: 即使是对艺术不感兴趣的人也不会不注意到在公共场所展示的现代艺术品。

sentence: Strange forms stand in gardens, and outside buildings and shops.
sentencecn: 公园里、大楼和商店外竖立着的奇形怪状的雕塑，

sentence: We have got quite used to them.
sentencecn: 对这些，我们已经司空见惯了。

sentence: Some so-called 'modern' pieces have been on display for nearly eighty years.
sentencecn: 有些所谓的“现代”艺术品在那里已经陈列了近80年了。

sentence: In spite of this, some people -- including myself -- were surprised by a recent exhibition of modern sculpture.
sentencecn: 尽管如此，最近举办的一次现代雕塑展览还是使一些人（包括我在内）大吃了一惊。

sentence: The first thing I saw when I entered the art gallery was a notice which said: 'Do not touch the exhibits. Some of them are dangerous!'
sentencecn: 走进展厅首先看到的是一张告示，上面写着“切勿触摸展品，某些展品有危险！”

sentence: The objects on display were pieces of moving sculpture.
sentencecn: 展品都是些活动的雕塑。

sentence: Oddly shaped forms that are suspended from the ceiling and move in response to a gust of wind are quite familiar to everybody.
sentencecn: 人们所熟悉的是悬挂在天花板上、造型奇特、随风飘荡的雕塑品。

sentence: These objects, however, were different. Lined up against the wall, there were long thin wires attached to metal spheres.
sentencecn: 这些展品却使人大开眼界。靠墙排列着许多细长的电线，而电线又连着金属球。

sentence: The spheres had been magnetized and attracted or repelled each other all the time.
sentencecn: 金属球经过磁化，互相之间不停地相互吸引或相互排斥。

sentence: In the centre of the hall, there were a number of tall structures which contained coloured lights.
sentencecn: 展厅中央是装有彩色灯泡的许多高高的构件，灯泡一刻不停地闪烁着，就像失去了控制的红绿灯。

sentence: These lights flickered continuously like traffic lights which have gone mad.
sentencecn: 小黑盒子里迸出火花，

sentence: Sparks were emitted from small black boxes and red lamps flashed on and off angrily.
sentencecn: 红色灯泡发怒似地忽明忽暗。

sentence: It was rather like an exhibition of prehistoric electronic equipment.
sentencecn: 这儿倒像是在展览古老的电子设备。

sentence: These peculiar forms not only seemed designed to shock people emotionally,
sentencecn: 好像设计这些奇形怪状的展品不仅是为了给人感情上的强烈刺激，

sentence: but to give them electric shocks as well!
sentencecn: 而且还想给人以电击似的！

sentence: --- lesson 24  A skeleton in the cupboard
sentencecn: “家丑”

sentence: We often read in novels how a seemingly respectable person or family has some terrible secret which has been concealed from strangers for years.
sentencecn: 在小说中，我们经常读到一个表面上受人尊重的人物或家庭，却有着某种多年不为人所知的骇人听闻的秘密。

sentence: The English language possesses a vivid saying to describe this sort of situation.
sentencecn: 英语中有一个生动的说法来形容这种情况。

sentence: The terrible secret is called 'a skeleton in the cupboard'.
sentencecn: 惊人的秘密称作“柜中骷髅”。

sentence: At some dramatic moment in the story, the terrible secret becomes known and a reputation is ruined.
sentencecn: 在小说的某个戏剧性时刻，可怕的秘密泄漏出来，接着便是某人的声誉扫地。

sentence: The reader's hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands.
sentencecn: 当读者读到小说最后几页了解到书中女主人公，那位一向待大家很好的可爱的老妇人年轻时一连毒死了她的5个丈夫时，不禁会毛骨悚然。

sentence: It is all very well for such things to occur in fiction.
sentencecn: 这种事发生在小说中是无可非议的。

sentence: To varying degrees, we all have secrets which we do not want even our closest friends to learn, but few of us have skeletons in the cupboard.
sentencecn: 尽管我们人人都有各种大小秘密。连最亲密的朋友都不愿让他们知道，但我们当中极少有人有柜中骷髅。

sentence: The only person I know who has a skeleton in the cupboard is George Carlton, and he is very proud of the fact.
sentencecn: 我所认识的唯一的在柜中藏骷嵝的人便是乔治.卡尔顿，他甚至引以为自豪。

sentence: George studied medicine in his youth. Instead of becoming a doctor, however, he became a successful writer of detective stories.
sentencecn: 乔治年轻时学过医，然而，他后来没当上医生，却成了一位成功的侦探小说作家。

sentence: I once spent an uncomfortable weekend which I shall never forget at his house.
sentencecn: 有一次，我在他家里度周末，过得很不愉快。这事我永远不会忘记。

sentence: George showed me to the guestroom which, he said, was rarely used.
sentencecn: 乔治把我领进客房，说这间很少使用。

sentence: He told me to unpack my things and then come down to dinner.
sentencecn: 他让我打开行装后下楼吃饭。

sentence: After I had stacked my shirts and underclothes in two empty drawers,
sentencecn: 我将衬衫、内衣放进两个空抽屉里，

sentence: I decided to hang one of the two suits I had brought with me in the cupboard.
sentencecn: 然后我想把随身带来的两套西服中的一套挂到大衣柜里去。

sentence: I opened the cupboard door and then stood in front of it petrified.
sentencecn: 我打开柜门，站在柜门前一下子惊呆了。

sentence: A skeleton was dangling before my eyes.
sentencecn: 一具骷髅悬挂在眼前，

sentence: The sudden movement of the door made it sway slightly and it gave me the impression that it was about to leap out at me.
sentencecn: 由于柜门突然打开，它也随之轻微摇晃起来，让我觉得它好像马上要跳出柜门朝我扑过来似的。

sentence: Dropping my suit, I dashed downstairs to tell George.
sentencecn: 我扔下西服冲下楼去告诉乔治。

sentence: This was worse than 'a terrible secret'; this was a real skeleton!
sentencecn: 这是比“骇人听闻的秘密”更加惊人的东西，这是一具真正的骷髅啊！

sentence: But George was unsympathetic. 'Oh, that,' he said with a smile as if he were talking about an old friend.
sentencecn: 但乔治却无动于衷。“噢，是它呀！他笑着说道，俨然在谈论一位老朋友。

sentence: 'That's Sebastian. You forget that I was a medical student once upon a time.'
sentencecn: “那是塞巴斯蒂安。你忘了我以前是学医的了。”

sentence: --- lesson 29  Funny or not?
sentencecn: 是否可笑?

sentence: Whether we find a joke funny or not largely depends on where we have been brought up.
sentencecn: 我们觉得一则笑话是否好笑，很大程度取决于我们是在哪儿长大的。

sentence: The sense of humour is mysteriously bound up with national characteristics.
sentencecn: 幽默感与民族有着神秘莫测的联系。

sentence: A Frenchman, for instance, might find it hard to laugh at a Russian joke.
sentencecn: 譬如，法国人听完一则俄国笑话可能很难发笑。

sentence: In the same way, a Russian might fail to see anything amusing in a joke which would make an Englishman laugh to tears.
sentencecn: 同样的道理，一则可以令英国人笑出泪来的笑话，俄国人听了可能觉得没有什么可笑之处。

sentence: Most funny stories are based on comic situations.
sentencecn: 大部分令人发笑的故事都是根据喜剧情节编写的。

sentence: In spite of national differences, certain funny situations have a universal appeal.
sentencecn: 尽管民族不同，有些滑稽情节却能产生普遍的效果。

sentence: No matter where you live, you would find it difficult not to laugh at, say, Charlie Chaplin's early films.
sentencecn: 比如说，不管你生活在哪里，你看查理.卓别林的早期电影很难不发笑。

sentence: However, a new type of humour, which stems largely from the U.S., has recently come into fashion.
sentencecn: 然而，近来一种新式幽默流行了起来，这种幽默主要来自美国。

sentence: It is called 'sick humour'.
sentencecn: 它被叫作“病态幽默”。

sentence: Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents.
sentencecn: 喜剧演员根据悲剧情节诸如暴死，重大事故等来编造笑话。

sentence: Many people find this sort of joke distasteful. The following example of 'sick humour' will enable you to judge for yourself.
sentencecn: 许多人认为这种笑话是低级庸俗的。下面是个“病态幽默”的实例，你可以据此自己作出判断。

sentence: A man who had broken his right leg was taken to hospital a few weeks before Christmas.
sentencecn: 圣诞节前几周，某人摔断了右腿被送进医院。

sentence: From the moment he arrived there, he kept on pestering his doctor to tell him when he would be able to go home.
sentencecn: 从他进医院那一刻时，他就缠住医生，让医生告诉他什么时候能回家。

sentence: He dreaded having to spend Christmas in hospital.
sentencecn: 他十分害怕在医院过圣诞。

sentence: Though the doctors did his best, the patient's recovery was slow.
sentencecn: 尽管医生竭力医治，但病人恢复缓慢。

sentence: On Christmas Day, the man still had his right leg in plaster.
sentencecn: 圣诞节那天，他的右腿还上着石膏，

sentence: He spent a miserable day in bed thinking of all the fun he was missing.
sentencecn: 他在床上郁郁不乐地躺了一天，想着他错过的种种欢乐。

sentence: The following day, however, the doctor consoled him by telling him that his chances of being able to leave hospital in time for New Year celebrations were good.
sentencecn: 然而，第二天，医生安慰他说，出院欢度新年的可能性还是很大的，

sentence: The man took heart and, sure enough, on New Years' Eve he was able to hobble along to a party.
sentencecn: 那人听后振作了精神。果然，除夕时他可以一瘸一拐地去参加晚会了。

sentence: To compensate for his unpleasant experiences in hospital, the man drank a little more than was good for him.
sentencecn: 为了补偿住院这一段不愉快的经历，那人喝得稍许多了一点。

sentence: In the process, he enjoyed himself thoroughly and kept telling everybody how much he hated hospitals.
sentencecn: 在晚会上他尽情娱乐，一再告诉大家他是多么讨厌医院。

sentence: He was still mumbling something about hospitals at the end of the party when he slipped on a piece of ice and broke his left leg.
sentencecn: 晚会结束时，他嘴里还在嘟哝着医院的事，突然踩到一块冰上滑倒了，摔断了左腿。

sentence: --- lesson 36  A chance in a million
sentencecn: 百万分之一的机遇

sentence: We are less credulous than we used to be.
sentencecn: 我们不再像以往那样轻易相信别人了。

sentence: In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences -- most of them wildly improbable.
sentencecn: 在19世纪，小说家常在小说结尾处给读者准备一系列的巧合--大部分是牵强附会，极不可能的。

sentence: Readers happily accepted the fact that an obscure maidservant was really the hero's mother.
sentencecn: 当时的读者却愉快地接受这样一些事实：一个低贱的女佣实际上是主人公的母亲；

sentence: A long-lost brother, who was presumed dead, was really alive all the time and wickedly plotting to bring about the hero's downfall. And so on.
sentencecn: 主人公一位长期失散的兄弟，大家都以为死了，实际上一直活着，并且正在策划暗算主人公；如此等等，

sentence: Modern readers would find such naive solutions totally unacceptable.
sentencecn: 现代读者会觉得这种天真的结局完全无法接受。

sentence: Yet, in real life, circumstances do sometimes conspire to bring about coincidences which anyone but a nineteenth century novelist would find incredible.
sentencecn: 不过，在现实生活中，有时确实会出现一些巧合，这些巧合除了19世纪小说家外谁也不会相信。

sentence: When I was a boy, my grandfather told me how a German taxi driver,
sentencecn: 当我是个孩子的时候，我祖父给我讲了一位德国出租汽车司机

sentence: Franz Bussman, found a brother who was thought to have been killed twenty years before.
sentencecn: 弗朗兹.巴斯曼如何找到了据信已在20年前死去的兄弟的事。

sentence: While on a walking tour with his wife, he stopped to talk to a workman.
sentencecn: 一次，他与妻子徒步旅行。途中，停下来与一个工人交谈，

sentence: After they had gone on, Mrs. Bussman commented on the workman's close resemblance to her husband and even suggested that he might be his brother.
sentencecn: 接着他们继续往前走去。巴斯曼夫人说那工人与她丈夫相貌很像，甚至猜测他可能就是她丈夫的兄弟。

sentence: Franz poured scorn on the idea, pointing out that his brother had been killed in action during the war.
sentencecn: 弗朗兹对此不屑一顾，指出他兄弟已经在战争中阵亡了。

sentence: Though Mrs. Busssman was fully acquainted with this story, she thought that there was a chance in a million that she might be right.
sentencecn: 尽管巴斯曼夫人熟知这个情况，但她仍然认为自己的想法仍有百万分之一的可能性。

sentence: A few days later, she sent a boy to the workman to ask him if his name was Hans Bussman.
sentencecn: 几天后，她派了一个男孩去问那人是否叫汉斯.巴斯曼。

sentence: Needless to say, the man's name was Hans Bussman and he really was Franz's long-lost brother.
sentencecn: 不出巴斯曼夫人所料，那人的名字真是汉斯.巴斯曼，他确实是弗朗兹失散了多年的兄弟。

sentence: When the brothers were reunited, Hans explained how it was that he was still alive.
sentencecn: 兄弟俩团聚之时，汉斯说明了他活下来的经过，

sentence: After having been wounded towards the end of the war, he had been sent to hospital and was separated from his unit.
sentencecn: 战争即将结束时，他负伤被送进医院，并与部队失去联系。

sentence: The hospital had been bombed and Hans had made his way back into Western Germany on foot.
sentencecn: 医院遭到轰炸，汉斯步行回到了西德。

sentence: Meanwhile, his unit was lost and all records of him had been destroyed.
sentencecn: 与此同时，他所在的部队被击溃，他的所有档案材料全部毁于战火。

sentence: Hans returned to his family home, but the house had been bombed and no one in the neighbourhood knew what had become of the inhabitants.
sentencecn: 汉斯重返故里，但他的家已被炸毁，左邻右舍谁也不知原住户的下落，

sentence: Assuming that his family had been killed during an air raid, Hans settled down in a village fifty miles away where he had remained ever since.
sentencecn: 汉斯以为全家人都在空袭中遇难，于是便在距此50英里外的一座村子里定居下来，直至当日。

sentence: --- lesson 41  Illusions of pastoral peace
sentencecn: 宁静田园生活的遐想

sentence: The quiet life of the country has never appealed to me.
sentencecn: 宁静的乡村生活从来没有吸引过我。

sentence: City born and city bred,
sentencecn: 我生在城市，长在城市，

sentence: I have always regarded the country as something you look at through a train window, or something you occasionally visit during the weekend.
sentencecn: 总认为乡村是透过火车车窗看到的那个样了，或偶尔周末去游玩一下的景象。

sentence: Most of my friends live in the city, yet they always go into raptures at the mere mention of the country.
sentencecn: 我的许多朋友都住在城市，但他们只要一提起乡村，马上就会变得欣喜若狂。

sentence: Though they extol the virtues of the peaceful life,
sentencecn: 尽管他们都交口称赞宁静的乡村生活的种种优点，

sentence: only one of them has ever gone to live in the country and he was back in town within six months.
sentencecn: 但其中只有一个人真去农村住过，而且不足6个月就回来了。

sentence: Even he still lives under the illusion that country life is somehow superior to town life.
sentencecn: 即使他也仍存有幻觉，好像乡村生活就是比城市生活优越。

sentence: He is forever talking about the friendly people, the clean atmosphere, the closeness to nature and the gentle pace of living.
sentencecn: 他滔滔不绝地大谈友好的农民，洁净的空气，贴近大自然的环境和悠闲的生活节奏。

sentence: Nothing can be compared, he maintains, with the first cockcrow, the twittering of birds at dawn, the sight of the rising sun glinting on the trees and pastures.
sentencecn: 他坚持认为，凌晨雄鸡第一声啼叫，黎明时分小鸟吱喳欢叫，冉冉升起的朝阳染红树木、牧场，此番美景无与伦比。

sentence: This idyllic pastoral scene is only part of the picture.
sentencecn: 但这种田园诗般的乡村风光仅仅是一个侧面。

sentence: My friend fails to mention the long and friendless winter evenings in front of the TV -- virtually the only form of entertainment.
sentencecn: 我的朋友没有提到在电视机前度过的漫长寂寞的冬夜--电视是唯一的娱乐形式。

sentence: He says nothing about the poor selection of goods in the shops, or about those unfortunate people who have to travel from the country to the city every day to get to work.
sentencecn: 他也不说商店货物品种单调，以及那些每天不得不从乡下赶到城里工作的不幸的人们。

sentence: Why people are prepared to tolerate a four-hour journey each day for the dubious privilege of living in the country is beyond me.
sentencecn: 人们为什么情愿每天在路上奔波4个小时去换取值得怀疑的乡间的优点，我是无法理解的。

sentence: They could be saved so much misery and expense if they chose to live in the city where they rightly belong.
sentencecn: 要是他们愿意住在本来属于他们的城市，则可以让他们省去诸多不便与节约大量开支。

sentence: If you can do without the few pastoral pleasures of the country,
sentencecn: 如果你愿舍弃乡下生活那一点点乐趣的话，

sentence: you will find the city can provide you with the best that life can offer.
sentencecn: 那么你会发出城市可以为你提供生活最美好的东西。

sentence: You never have to travel miles to see your friends.
sentencecn: 你去看朋友根本不用跋涉好几英里，

sentence: They invariably live nearby and are always available for an informal chat or an evening's entertainment.
sentencecn: 因为他们都住在附近，你随时可以同他们聊天或在晚上一起娱乐。

sentence: Some of my acquaintances in the country come up to town once or twice a year to visit the theatre as a special treat.
sentencecn: 我在乡村有一些熟人，他们每年进城来看一回或几回戏，并把此看作一种特殊的享受。

sentence: For them this is a major operation which involves considerable planning.
sentencecn: 看戏在（对）他们是件大事，需要精心计划。

sentence: As the play draws to its close, they wonder whether they will ever catch that last train home.
sentencecn: 当戏快演完时，他们又为是否能赶上末班火车回家而犯愁。

sentence: The city dweller never experiences anxieties of this sort.
sentencecn: 这种焦虑，城里人是从未体验过的。

sentence: The latest exhibitions, films, or plays are only a short bus ride away.
sentencecn: 坐公共汽车几站路，就可看到最新的展览、电影、戏剧。

sentence: Shopping, too, is always a pleasure.
sentencecn: 买东西也是一种乐趣。

sentence: There is so much variety that you never have to make do with second best.
sentencecn: 物品品种繁多，从来不必用二等品来凑合。

sentence: Country people run wild when they go shopping in the city and stagger home loaded with as many of the exotic items as they can carry.
sentencecn: 乡里人进城采购欣喜若狂，每次回家时都买足了外来商品，直到拿不动方才罢休，连走路都摇摇晃晃的。

sentence: Nor is the city without its moments of beauty.
sentencecn: 城市也并非没有良辰美景。

sentence: There is something comforting about the warm glow shed by advertisements on cold wet winter nights.
sentencecn: 寒冷潮湿的冬夜里，广告灯箱发出的暖光，会给人某种安慰。

sentence: Few things could be more impressive than the peace that descends on deserted city streets at weekends
sentencecn: 周末，空旷的街市笼罩着一种宁静的气氛，没有什么能比此时的宁静更令人难忘了。

sentence: when the thousands that travel to work every day are tucked away in their homes in the country.
sentencecn: 当成千上万进城上班的人回到了他们的乡间寓所之后，

sentence: It has always been a mystery to me why city dwellers, who appreciate all these things,
sentencecn: 城里人对这一切心里很明白，

sentence: obstinately pretend that they would prefer to live in the country.
sentencecn: 却偏要执拗地装出他们喜欢住在乡村的样子，这对我来说一直是个谜。

sentence: --- lesson 42  Modern caveman
sentencecn: 现代洞穴人

sentence: Cave exploration, or pot-holing, as it has come to be known, is a relatively new sport.
sentencecn: 洞穴勘查--或洞穴勘探--是一项比较新的体育活动。

sentence: Perhaps it is the desire for solitude or the chance of making an unexpected discovery that lures people down to the depths of the earth.
sentencecn: 寻求独居独处的愿望或寻求意外发现机会的欲望吸引人们来到地下深处。

sentence: It is impossible to give a satisfactory explanation for a pot-holer's motives.
sentencecn: 要想对洞穴探险者的动机作出满意的解释是不可能的。

sentence: For him, caves have the same peculiar fascination which high mountains have for the climber.
sentencecn: 对洞穴探险者来说，洞穴有一种特殊的魅力，就像高山对登山者有特殊的魅力一样。

sentence: They arouse instincts which can only be dimly understood.
sentencecn: 为什么洞空能引发人的那种探险本能，人们对此只能有一种模模糊糊的理解。

sentence: Exploring really deep caves is not a task for the Sunday afternoon rambler.
sentencecn: 探测非常深的洞穴不是那些在星期日下午漫步的人所能胜任的。

sentence: Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations.
sentencecn: 这种活动需要有军事行动般的周密布署和预见能力。

sentence: It can take as long as eight days to rig up rope ladders and to establish supply bases before a descent can be made into a very deep cave.
sentencecn: 有时需要花费整整8天时间来搭起绳梯，建立供应基地，然后才能下到一个很深的洞穴里。

sentence: Precautions of this sort are necessary,
sentencecn: 作出这样的准备是必要的，

sentence: for it is impossible to foretell the exact nature of the difficulties which will confront the pot-holer.
sentencecn: 因为无法预见到洞穴探险者究竟会遇到什么性质的困难。

sentence: The deepest known cave in the world is the Gouffre Berger near Grenoble.
sentencecn: 世界上最深的洞穴是格里诺布尔附近的高弗.伯杰洞，

sentence: It extends to a depth of 3,723 feet.
sentencecn: 深达3,723英尺。

sentence: This immense chasm has been formed by an underground stream which has tunnelled a course through a flaw in the rocks.
sentencecn: 这个深邃的洞穴是由一条地下暗泉冲刷岩石中的缝隙并使之慢慢变大而形成的。

sentence: The entrance to the cave is on a plateau in the Dauphine Alps.
sentencecn: 此洞的洞口在丹芬阿尔卑斯山的高原上，

sentence: As it is only six feet across, it is barely noticeable.
sentencecn: 仅6英尺宽，很难被人发现。

sentence: The cave might never have been discovered has not the entrance been spotted by the distinguished French pot-holer, Berger.
sentencecn: 若不是法国著名洞穴探险家伯杰由于偶然的机会发现了这个洞口的话，这个洞也许不会为人所知。

sentence: Since its discovery, it has become a sort of potholers' Everest.
sentencecn: 自从被发现以后，这个洞成了洞穴探险者的珠穆朗玛峰，

sentence: Though a number of descents have been made, much of it still remains to be explored.
sentencecn: 人们多次进入洞内探险，但至今尚有不少东西有待勘探。

sentence: A team of pot-holers recently went down the Gouffre Berger.
sentencecn: 最近，一队洞穴探险者下到了高弗.伯杰洞里。

sentence: After entering the narrow gap on the plateau, they climbed down the steep sides of the cave until they came to a narrow corridor.
sentencecn: 他们从高原上的窄缝进去，顺着笔直陡峭的洞壁往下爬。

sentence: They had to edge their way along this, sometimes wading across shallow streams, or swimming across deep pools.
sentencecn: 来到一条狭窄的走廊上。他们不得不侧着身子往前走，有时过浅溪，有时游过深潭。

sentence: Suddenly they came to a waterfall which dropped into an underground lake at the bottom of the cave.
sentencecn: 突然，他们来到一道瀑布前，那瀑布奔泻而下，注入洞底一处地下湖里。

sentence: They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side.
sentencecn: 他们跳入湖中，把各种器具装上一只充气的橡皮艇，听任水流将他们带往对岸。

sentence: To protect themselves from the icy water, they had to wear special rubber suits.
sentencecn: 湖水冰冷刺骨，他们必须穿上一种特制的橡皮服以保护自己。

sentence: At the far end of the lake, they came to huge piles of rubble which had been washed up by the water.
sentencecn: 在湖的尽头，他们见到一大堆一大堆由湖水冲刷上岸的碎石。

sentence: In this part of the cave, they could hear an insistent booming sound
sentencecn: 在这儿，他们可以听见一种连续不断的轰鸣声。

sentence: which they found was caused by a small waterspout shooting down into a pool from the roof of the cave.
sentencecn: 后来他们发现这是由山洞顶部的一个小孔里喷出的水柱跌落到水潭中发出的声音。

sentence: Squeezing through a cleft in the rocks, the pot-holers arrived at an enormous cavern, the size of a huge concert hall.
sentencecn: 洞穴探险者从岩石缝里挤身过去，来到一个巨大的洞里，其大小相当于一个音乐厅。

sentence: After switching on powerful arc lights, they saw great stalagmites -- some of them over forty feet high -- rising up like tree-trunks to meet the stalactites suspended from the roof.
sentencecn: 他们打开强力弧光灯，看见一株株巨大的石笋，有的高达40英尺，象树干似的向上长着，与洞顶悬挂下来的钟乳石相接。

sentence: Round about, piles of limestone glistened in all the colours of the rainbow.
sentencecn: 周围是一堆堆石灰石，像彩虹一样闪闪发光。

sentence: In the eerie silence of the cavern,
sentencecn: 洞里有一种可怕的寂静，

sentence: the only sound that could be heard was made by water which dripped continuously from the high dome above them.
sentencecn: 唯一可以听见的声响是高高的圆顶上不间断地滴水的嘀嗒声。

sentence: --- lesson 43  Fully insured
sentencecn: 全保险

sentence: Insurance companies are normally willing to insure anything.
sentencecn: 保险公司一般说来愿意承保一切东西。

sentence: Insuring public or private property is a standard practice in most countries in the world.
sentencecn: 承办公共财产或私人财产保险是世界上大部分国家的正常业务。

sentence: If, however, you were holding an open air garden party or a fete it would be equally possible to insure yourself in the event of bad weather.
sentencecn: 如果你要举办一次露天游园会或盛宴，为避免碰上不好的天气而遭受损失也同样可以保险，

sentence: Needless to say, the bigger the risk an insurance company takes, the higher the premium you will have to pay.
sentencecn: 不用说，保险公司承担风险越大，你付的保险费也就越高。

sentence: It is not uncommon to hear that a shipping company has made a claim for the cost of salvaging a sunken ship.
sentencecn: 航运公司为打捞沉船而提出索赔，这是常有的事，

sentence: But the claim made by a local authority to recover the cost of salvaging a sunken pie dish must surely be unique.
sentencecn: 但某地当局为打捞一只焙制馅饼的盘子提出索赔，倒是件新鲜事儿。

sentence: Admittedly it was an unusual pie dish, for it was eighteen feet long and six feet wide.
sentencecn: 这个馅饼盘子确实少见，有18英尺长，6英尺宽。

sentence: It had been purchased by a local authority so that an enormous pie could be baked for an annual fair.
sentencecn: 某地方当局买下它用来焙制一个巨大的馅饼为一年一度交易会助兴。

sentence: The pie committee decided that the best way to transport the dish would be by canal, so they insured it for the trip.
sentencecn: 馅饼委员会确认运输这只盘子的最佳方案是通过运河水运。于是，他们对这只盘子的运输安全投了保。

sentence: Shortly after it was launched, the pie committee went to a local inn to celebrate.
sentencecn: 盘子下水后不久，馅饼委员会成员们来到当地一家小酒店庆贺。

sentence: At the same time, a number of teenagers climbed on to the dish and held a little party of their own.
sentencecn: 就在这个时候，许多十几岁的孩子爬盘子举行他们自己的集会。

sentence: Dancing proved to be more than the dish could bear, for during the party it capsized and sank in seven feet of water.
sentencecn: 他们跳起了舞，盘子难以承受。舞会进行过程中，盘子倾覆，沉入了7英尺深的水中。

sentence: The pie committee telephoned a local garage owner who arrived in a recovery truck to salvage the pie dish.
sentencecn: 馅饼委员会给当地汽车修理库老板打电话，他闻讯后开着一辆急修车前来打捞盘子。

sentence: Shivering in their wet clothes, the teenagers looked on while three men dived repeatedly into the water to locate the dish.
sentencecn: 那些孩子们穿着湿衣服哆嗦，看着3个工人轮潜入水中以确定盘子的位置。

sentence: They had little difficulty in finding it, but hauling it out of the water proved to be a serious problem.
sentencecn: 他们没费多大事儿就找到了盘子。可是把盘子捞出却是一个很大的难题。

sentence: The sides of the dish were so smooth that it was almost impossible to attach hawsers and chains to the rim without damaging it.
sentencecn: 盘子四边十分光滑，要在盘边拴上绳索或链条而同时又不损坏它是很难办到的。

sentence: Eventually chains were fixed to one end of the dish and a powerful winch was put into operation.
sentencecn: 不过，他们终于将链条固定在盘子的一端，一台大功率的绞车开动起来。

sentence: The dish rose to the surface and was gently drawn towards the canal bank.
sentencecn: 盘子慢慢浮出水面，被轻轻地拽向运河岸边。

sentence: For one agonizing moment, the dish was perched precariously on the bank of the canal,
sentencecn: 在令人忐忑不安的瞬间，盘子晃晃悠悠地上了岸，

sentence: but it suddenly overbalanced and slid back into the water.
sentencecn: 但它突然失去了平衡，又跌回水中。

sentence: The men were now obliged to try once more.
sentencecn: 工人们只得再来一次。

sentence: This time they fixed heavy metal clamps to both sides of the dish so that they could fasten the chains.
sentencecn: 这次，他们用沉重的金属夹子把盘子夹住，以便往盘子上安装铁链。

sentence: The dish now had to be lifted vertically because one edge was resting against the side of the canal.
sentencecn: 这次，盘子必须垂直吊出水面，因为盘子的一边紧靠着运河河岸。

sentence: The winch was again put into operation and one of the men started up the truck.
sentencecn: 绞盘机再次启动，一位工人发动了急修车的引擎。

sentence: Several minutes later, the dish was successfully hauled above the surface of the water.
sentencecn: 几分钟后，盘子被成功地拽出了水面。

sentence: Water streamed in torrents over its sides with such force that it set up a huge wave in the canal.
sentencecn: 波浪从盘子两侧急涌而出，在运河里掀起一股大浪。

sentence: There was a danger that the wave would rebound off the other side of the bank and send the dish plunging into the water again.
sentencecn: 但是当波浪从河对岸折回来时，就有再次把盘子拖进水里的危险。

sentence: By working at tremendous speed, the men managed to get the dish on to dry land before the wave returned.
sentencecn: 工人们动作迅速，终于赶在那股大浪返回之前把盘子拽到了岸上。

sentence: --- lesson 44  Speed and comfort
sentencecn: 又快捷又舒适

sentence: People travelling long distances frequently have to decide whether they would prefer to go by land, sea, or air.
sentencecn: 出远门的人常常需要决定是走旱路、水路，还是坐飞机。

sentence: Hardly anyone can positively enjoy sitting in a train for more than a few hours.
sentencecn: 很少有人能够真正喜欢坐几个小时以上的火车。

sentence: Train compartments soon get cramped and stuffy.
sentencecn: 车厢很快就变得拥挤、闷热，

sentence: It is almost impossible to take your mind off the journey.
sentencecn: 想摆脱开旅途的困扰是很难的。

sentence: Reading is only a partial solution, for the monotonous rhythm of the wheels clicking on the rails soon lulls you to sleep.
sentencecn: 看书只能解决部分问题。车轮与铁轨间单调的嘎喳声很快就会送你进入梦乡。

sentence: During the day, sleep comes in snatches.
sentencecn: 白天是忽睡忽醒，

sentence: At night, when you really wish to go to sleep, you rarely manage to do so.
sentencecn: 到了夜晚，你真想睡了，却很难入睡。

sentence: If you are lucky enough to get a sleeper, you spend half the night staring at the small blue light in the ceiling,
sentencecn: 即使你走运弄到一个卧铺，夜间有一半时间你会盯着车顶那盏小蓝灯而睡不着觉；

sentence: or fumbling to find your ticket for inspection.
sentencecn: 要不然就为查票摸索你的车票。

sentence: Inevitably you arrive at your destination almost exhausted.
sentencecn: 一旦抵达目的地，你总是疲惫不堪。

sentence: Long car journeys are even less pleasant, for it is quite impossible even to read.
sentencecn: 乘汽车作长途旅行则更加不舒服，因为连看书都几乎不可能。

sentence: On motorways you can, at least, travel fairly safely at high speeds,
sentencecn: 在公路上还好，你至少能以相当快的速度安全地向前行。

sentence: but more often than not, the greater part of the journey is spent on roads with few service stations and too much traffic.
sentencecn: 但旅行的大部分时间都花在路上，而且只有很少的服务设施，交通也很拥挤。

sentence: By comparison, ferry trips or cruises offer a great variety of civilized comforts.
sentencecn: 相比之下，坐船旅行或环游可以得到文明世界的各种享受。

sentence: You can stretch your legs on the spacious decks, play games, meet interesting people and enjoy good food -- always assuming,of course, that the sea is calm.
sentencecn: 你可以在甲板上伸展四肢、做游戏，还能见到各种有趣的人，能享用各种美味佳肴-当然，这一切只有在大海风平浪静的情况下才有可能。

sentence: If it is not, and you are likely to get seasick, no form of transport could be worse.
sentencecn: 如果大海肆虐起来，你就可能晕船，那种难受劲儿是任何一种别的旅行的方式都不会带来的。

sentence: Even if you travel in ideal weather, sea journeys take a long time.
sentencecn: 即使风平浪静，坐船旅行也要占用很长时间。

sentence: Relatively few people are prepared to sacrifice holiday time for the pleasure of travlling by sea.
sentencecn: 没有多少人会为享受坐船旅行的乐趣而牺牲假期的时间。

sentence: Aeroplanes have the reputation of being dangerous and even hardened travellers are intimidated by them.
sentencecn: 飞机以危险而著称，连老资格的旅行者也怕飞机。

sentence: They also have the disadvantage of being an expensive form of transport.
sentencecn: 飞机的另一个缺点是昂贵。

sentence: But nothing can match them for speed and comfort.
sentencecn: 但就速度与舒适而言，飞机是无与伦比的。

sentence: Travelling at a height of 30,000 feet, far above the clouds, and at over 500 miles an hour is an exhilarating experience.
sentencecn: 腾云驾雾，在30，000 英尺高空以500英里的时速旅行，这种经历令人心旷神怡。

sentence: You do not have to devise ways of taking your mind off the journey, for an aeroplane gets you to your destination rapidly.
sentencecn: 你不必想办法去摆脱旅途的困扰，因为飞机会迅速地把你送到目的地。

sentence: For a few hours, you settle back in a deep armchair to enjoy the flight.
sentencecn: 几小时之内，你躺在扶手椅上，享受着旅途的欢乐。

sentence: The real escapist can watch a film and sip champagne on some services.
sentencecn: 真正会享受的人还可以在某些航班上看一场电影和喝香槟。

sentence: But even when such refinements are not available, there is plenty to keep you occupied.
sentencecn: 即使没有这些消遣条件，也总是有事可做。

sentence: An aeroplane offers you an unusual and breathtaking view of the world.
sentencecn: 飞机上，你可以观察世界上非同寻常的奇妙的美景。

sentence: You soar effortlessly over high mountains and deep valleys.
sentencecn: 你毫不费劲地飞越高山幽谷，

sentence: You really see the shape of the land.
sentencecn: 你确能饱览大地的风貌。

sentence: If the landscape is hidden from view,
sentencecn: 如果这种景色被遮住了，

sentence: you can enjoy the extraordinary sight of unbroken cloud plains that stretch out for miles before you, while the sun shines brilliantly in a clear sky.
sentencecn: 你便可以观赏一下展现在你面前的、一望数英里的、连绵不断的云海，同时阳光灿烂，天空清澈明朗。

sentence: The journey is so smooth that there is nothing to prevent you from reading or sleeping.
sentencecn: 旅途平稳，丝毫不妨碍你阅读或睡眠。

sentence: However you decide to spend your time, one thing is certain: you will arrive at your destination fresh and uncrumpled.
sentencecn: 不管你打算如何消磨时间，有件事是可以肯定的，即当你抵达目的地时，你感到精神焕发，毫无倦意，

sentence: You will not have to spend the next few days recovering from a long and arduous journey.
sentencecn: 用不着因为漫长旅途的辛苦而花几天时间休息来恢复精神。

sentence: --- lesson 45  The power of the press
sentencecn: 新闻报道的威力

sentence: In democratic countries any efforts to restrict the freedom of the press are rightly condemned.
sentencecn: 在民主国家里，任何限制新闻自由的企图都理所当然地受到谴责。

sentence: However, this freedom can easily be abused.
sentencecn: 然而，这种自由很容易被滥用。

sentence: Stories about people often attract far more public attention than political events.
sentencecn: 常人轶事往往比政治事件更能引起公众注意。

sentence: Though we may enjoy reading about the lives of others, it is extremely doubtful whether we would equally enjoy reading about ourselves.
sentencecn: 我们都喜欢看关于别人生活的报道，但是否同样喜欢看关于自己生活的报道，就很难说了。

sentence: Acting on the contention that facts are sacred,
sentencecn: 记者按事实至上的论点行事，

sentence: reporters can cause untold suffering to individuals by publishing details about their private lives.
sentencecn: 发表有关别人生活的细节，有时会给当事人造成极大的痛苦。

sentence: Newspapers exert such tremendous influence that they can not only bring about major changes to the lives of ordinary people but can even overthrow a government.
sentencecn: 新闻具有巨大的威力。它们不仅可以给寻常人家的生活带来重大的变化，甚至还能推翻一个政府。

sentence: The story of a poor family that acquired fame and fortune overnight, dramatically illustrates the power of the press.
sentencecn: 下面这户穷人一夜之间出名发财的故事戏剧性地说明了新闻报道的威力。

sentence: The family lived in Aberdeen, a small town of 23,000 inhabitants in South Dakota.
sentencecn: 这户人家住在南达科他州一个人口为23，000 的小镇上，镇名为阿拜丁。

sentence: As the parents had five children, life was a perpetual struggle against poverty.
sentencecn: 家里已有5个孩子，全家人常年在贫困中挣扎。

sentence: They were expecting their sixth child and were faced with even more pressing economic problems.
sentencecn: 第6个孩子即将问世，他们面临着更为严峻的经济问题。

sentence: If they had only had one more child, the fact would have passed unnoticed.
sentencecn: 如果他们只添了1个孩子，这件事本来就不会引起任何人的注意。

sentence: They would have continued to struggle against economic odds and would have lived in obscurity.
sentencecn: 这家人会继续为克服经济上的拮据而奋斗，并默默无闻地活下去。

sentence: But they suddenly became the parents of quintuplets, four girl and a boy, an event which radically changed their lives.
sentencecn: 但是他们出人意料地生了个五胞胎，4女1男。这事使他们的生活发生了根本的变化。

sentence: The day after the birth of the five children, an aeroplane arrived in Aberdeen bringing sixty reporters and photographers.
sentencecn: 五胞胎降生第二天，一架飞机飞抵阿拜丁，随机带来60名记者与摄影师。

sentence: The rise to fame was swift.
sentencecn: 这一家迅速出了名。

sentence: Television cameras and newspapers carried the news to everyone in the country.
sentencecn: 电视摄像机和报纸把消息传送到全国。

sentence: Newspapers and magazines offered the family huge sums for the exclusive rights to publish stories and photographs.
sentencecn: 报纸、杂志出高价向他们购买文字、图片的独家报道权。

sentence: Gifts poured in not only from unknown people, but from baby food and soap manufacturers who wished to advertise their products.
sentencecn: 不但素昧平生的人寄来了大量的礼物，而且婴儿食品、婴儿肥皂制造厂商为了替自己产品做广告也寄来了大量的礼物。

sentence: The old farmhouse the family lived in was to be replaced by a new $500,000 home.
sentencecn: 这家人住的旧农舍将由一座价值50万美元的新住宅所取代。

sentence: Reporters kept pressing for interviews so lawyers had to be employed to act as spokesmen for the family at press conferences.
sentencecn: 由于记者纷纷要求会见，他们不得不请了律师充当他们家的发言人举行记者招待会。

sentence: While the five babies were still quietly sleeping in oxygen tents in a hospital nursery,
sentencecn: 眼下，五胞胎还静静地躺在医院婴儿室的氧气帐里，

sentence: their parents were paying the price for fame.
sentencecn: 他们的父母却为这名声付出了代价，

sentence: It would never again be possible for them to lead normal lives.
sentencecn: 他们再也无法过正常的生活。

sentence: They had become the victims of commercialization, for their names had acquired a market value.
sentencecn: 他们成了商业化的受害者，因为他们的名字具有了市场价值。

sentence: Instead of being five new family members, these children had immediately become a commodity.
sentencecn: 这些孩子立即成了商品，而不是5个新的家庭成员。

sentence: --- lesson 46  Do it yourself
sentencecn: 自己动手

sentence: So great is our passion for doing things for ourselves, that we are becoming increasingly less dependent on specialized labour.
sentencecn: 现在我们自己动手做事的热情很高，结果对于专业工人的依赖越来越少了。

sentence: No one can plead ignorance of a subject any longer, for there are countless do-it-yourself publications.
sentencecn: 由于出版了不计其数的教人自己动手做事的书报杂志，没有人再能说对某事一无所知。

sentence: Armed with the right tools and materials, newlyweds gaily embark on the task of decorating their own homes.
sentencecn: 新婚夫妇找来合适的工具和材料，喜气洋洋地开始布置新房。

sentence: Men, particularly, spend hours of their leisure time installing their own fireplaces, laying out their own gardens;
sentencecn: 特别是男人，常利用空闲时间安装壁炉、布置花园、建造车库、制作家具。

sentence: building garages and making furniture. Some really keen enthusiasts go so far as to build their own computers.
sentencecn: 有些热衷于自己动手的人甚至自己组装电脑。

sentence: Shops cater for the do-it-yourself craze not only by running special advisory services for novices,
sentencecn: 为了满足自己动手热的需要，商店不仅为初学者提供专门的咨询服务，

sentence: but by offering consumers bits and pieces which they can assemble at home.
sentencecn: 而且为顾客准备了各种零件，供他们买回家去安装。

sentence: Such things provide an excellent outlet for pent up creative energy, but unfortunately not all of us are born handymen.
sentencecn: 这些东西为人们潜在的创造力提供了一个绝妙的用武之地。但不幸的是，我们并非人人都是能工巧匠。

sentence: Some wives tend to believe that their husbands are infinitely resourceful and can fix anything.
sentencecn: 妻子常常认为她们的丈夫无比聪明能干。

sentence: Even men who can hardly drive a nail in straight are supposed to be born electricians, carpenters, plumbers and mechanics.
sentencecn: 甚至那些连一枚钉子都钉不直的男人都被认为是天生的电工、木匠、水管工和机械师。

sentence: When lights fuse, furniture gets rickety, pipes get clogged, or vacuum cleaners fail to operate,
sentencecn: 每当电灯保险丝烧断、家具榫头松动、管道堵塞、吸尘器不动时，

sentence: some woman assume that their husbands will somehow put things right.
sentencecn: 有些妻子认为丈夫总有办法。

sentence: The worst thing about the do-it-yourself game is that sometimes even men live under the delusion that they can do anything, even when they have repeatedly been proved wrong.
sentencecn: 自己动手的例子中最糟糕的是，有时甚至是男人尽管接连失败却还误以为自己什么都行，

sentence: It is a question of pride as much as anything else.
sentencecn: 原因就是要面子。

sentence: Last spring my wife suggested that I call in a man to look at our lawn mower.
sentencecn: 今年春天，妻子让我请人检查一下我家的割草机。

sentence: It had broken down the previous summer, and though I promised to repair it, I had never got round to it.
sentencecn: 那台割草机去年夏天就坏了，尽管我答应修，但一直没抽出时间，

sentence: I would not hear of the suggestion and said that I would fix it myself.
sentencecn: 我不愿听妻子的建议，说我自己会修。

sentence: One Saturday afternoon, I hauled the machine into the garden and had a close look at it.
sentencecn: 一个星期六的下午，我把割草机拉到了花园里，仔细检查了一番。

sentence: As far as I could see, it needed only a minor adjustment:
sentencecn: 在我看来，只需稍加调整即可。

sentence: a turn of a screw here, a little tightening up there, a drop of oil and it would be as good as new.
sentencecn: 这儿紧紧螺丝，那儿固定一下，再加几滴油，就会像新的一样了。

sentence: Inevitably the repair job was not quite so simple.
sentencecn: 事实上，修理工作远不是那么简单。

sentence: The mower firmly refused to mow, so I decided to dismantle it.
sentencecn: 修完后割草机还是纹丝不动。于是，我决定把它拆开。

sentence: The garden was soon littered with chunks of metal which had once made up a lawn mower.
sentencecn: 一会儿工夫，割草机便被拆成一个个金属零件，乱七八糟地堆在花园里。

sentence: But I was extremely pleased with myself.
sentencecn: 但我却非常高兴，

sentence: I had traced the cause of the trouble.
sentencecn: 因为我找到了毛病所在。

sentence: One of the links in the chain that drives the wheels had snapped.
sentencecn: 驱动轮子的链条断了一节。

sentence: After buying a new chain I was faced with the insurmountable task of putting the confusing jigsaw puzzle together again.
sentencecn: 我买来一根新链条后，面临的就是如何把这些令人眼花缭乱的拼板重新组装起来。

sentence: I was not surprised to find that the machine still refused to work after I had reassembled it,
sentencecn: 等我装完后，那台割草机仍然一动不动，对此我倒并不感到吃惊。

sentence: for the simple reason that I was left with several curiously shaped bits of metal which did not seem to fit anywhere.
sentencecn: 原因很简单，因为还剩下几个形状奇特的零件似乎哪里也装不上去。

sentence: I gave up in despair.
sentencecn: 我无可奈何，只好罢休。

sentence: The weeks passed and the grass grew.
sentencecn: 几个星期过去了，草长了起来。

sentence: When my wife nagged me to do something about it, I told her that either I would have to buy a new mower or let the grass grow.
sentencecn: 妻子喋喋不休让我想点办法。我告诉她，要么买一台新割草机，要么让草长下去。

sentence: Needless to say our house is now surrounded by a jungle.
sentencecn: 不用说，我家现在已被丛林包围。

sentence: Buried somewhere in deep grass there is a rusting lawn mower which I have promised to repair one day.
sentencecn: 深草丛中的某个地方有一台正在生锈的割草机，那就是我曾答应某日要修理的割草机。

sentence: --- lesson 47  Too high a price?
sentencecn: 代价太高?

sentence: Pollution is the price we pay for an overpopulated, over-industrialized planet.
sentencecn: 污染就是我们为这个人口过密，过度工业化的星球所付出的代价。

sentence: When you come to think about it, there are only four ways you can deal with rubbish:
sentencecn: 当我们开始考虑垃圾问题时，我们只有4种对付垃圾的方法：

sentence: dump it, burn it, turn it into something you can use again, attempt to produce less of it.
sentencecn: 倾倒、焚烧、把垃圾变成再生材料或试图少产生一些垃圾。

sentence: We keep trying all four methods, but he sheer volume of rubbish we produce worldwide threatens to overwhelm us.
sentencecn: 我们一直在试这4种方式，但是，我们在世界范围内仅产生的垃圾的量就有把我们覆盖的危险。

sentence: Rubbish, however, is only part of the problem of polluting our planet.
sentencecn: 然而，垃圾只是我们这个星球的污染问题的一个方面。

sentence: The need to produce ever-increasing quantities of cheap food leads to a different kind of pollution.
sentencecn: 日益增长的对廉价食物的需求导致了另一种形式的污染。

sentence: Industrialized farming methods produce cheap meat products: beef, pork and chicken.
sentencecn: 工业化的农作方式生产出廉价的肉类制品--牛肉、猪肉和鸡肉。

sentence: The use of pesticides and fertilizers produces cheap grain and vegetables.
sentencecn: 使用杀虫剂和化肥生产出了廉价的谷物和蔬菜。

sentence: The price we pay for cheap food may be already too high:
sentencecn: 为了廉价食物我们付出的代价已经太高了：

sentence: Mad Cow Disease (BSE) in cattle, salmonella in chicken and eggs, and listeria in dairy products.
sentencecn: 牛肉中的疯牛病，鸡肉和鸡蛋中的沙门氏菌，奶制品中的利斯特杆菌。

sentence: And if you think you'll abandon meat and become a vegetarian,
sentencecn: 如果你想放弃肉类而变成一位素食者，

sentence: you have the choice of very expensive organically-grown vegetables
sentencecn: 那么你可以两者择一：或是选用价格昂贵、有机培植的蔬菜，

sentence: or a steady diet of pesticides every time you think you're eating fresh salads and vegetables, or just having an innocent glass of water!
sentencecn: 或是当你认为在享用新鲜色拉和新鲜蔬菜或饮用一杯无害的水的时候，实际上每次都不断吃进杀虫剂。

sentence: However, there is an even more insidious kind of pollution that particularly affects urban areas and invades our daily lives, and that is noise.
sentencecn: 但是，还有一种更加隐蔽有害的污染，它专门影响城镇地区，侵袭我们的日常生活，那就是噪音。

sentence: Burglar alarms going off at any time of the day or night serve only to annoy passers-by and actually assist burglars to burgle.
sentencecn: 防盗警报器在白天和黑夜的任何时候都会响起来，它的作用只是骚扰过路行人，而实际上却帮助窃贼入室行窃。

sentence: Car alarms constantly scream at us in the street and are a source of profound irritation.
sentencecn: 在街上，汽车的防盗警报不断对我们吼叫，这是人们极度烦燥的一个原因，

sentence: A recent survey of the effects of noise revealed (surprisingly) that dogs barking incessantly in the night rated the highest form of noise pollution on a scale ranging from 1 to 7.
sentencecn: 最近一个有关噪音的作用的调查（令人吃惊地）指出，夜间连续不断的狗叫声，在一个从1级至7级刻度表上应列为最严重的噪间污染。

sentence: The survey revealed a large number of sources of noise that we really dislike. Lawn mowers whining on a summer's day,late-night parties in apartment blocks,
sentencecn: 这个调查揭示了我们所不喜欢的大量的噪间的来源：夏天呜呜作响的割草机，公寓楼里深夜聚会的喧哗声，

sentence: noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds,especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead,
sentencecn: 大声吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是穿越寂静的村庄的集装箱卡车，从头顶飞过的飞机和直升机，

sentence: large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume.
sentencecn: 被带到公共场所、音量开到最大的大功率收音机。

sentence: New technology has also made its own contribution to noise.
sentencecn: 新技术也为噪音作了它的贡献。

sentence: A lot of people object to mobile phones, especially when they are used in public places like restaurants or on public transport.
sentencecn: 许多人都反对移动式电话，特别是在如饭店，公共交通车等公共场所使用移动电话。

sentence: Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat.
sentencecn: 用移动电话大声交谈干扰我们的思路，破坏我们和朋友在一起轻声聊天所得到的乐趣。

sentence: The noise pollution survey revealed a rather surprising and possibly amusing old fashioned source of noise.
sentencecn: 这个有关噪音的污染调查还揭示了一种出人意外同时可能会引人发笑的老式噪音源。

sentence: It turned out to be snoring!
sentencecn: 它竟然是鼾声。

sentence: Men were found to be the worst offenders.
sentencecn: 人类是这方面的罪魁祸首。

sentence: It was revealed that 20% of men in their mid-thirties snore.
sentencecn: 调查指出，20%的35岁左右的男人打鼾；

sentence: This figure rises to a staggering 60% of men in their sixties.
sentencecn: 而到60岁这个年龄段，这个数字上升到令人惊愕的60%。

sentence: Against these figures, it was found that only 5% of women snore regularly,
sentencecn: 与这些数字相比，只有5% 的女性经常打鼾，

sentence: while the rest are constantly woken or kept awake by their trumpeting partners.
sentencecn: 而其余的则经常被与她们同睡、像吹号似地打着呼噜的男人吵醒或弄得睡不着。

sentence: Whatever the source of noise, one thing is certain: silence, it seems, has become a golden memory.
sentencecn: 不管噪声来自何方，有一点是肯定的：看来寂静已变成一种珍贵的回忆。

sentence: --- lesson 48  The silent village
sentencecn: 沉默的村庄

sentence: In this much-travelled world, there are still thousands of places which are inaccessible to tourists.
sentencecn: 在这个旅游频繁的世界上，仍有成千上万个游人足迹未至的地方。

sentence: We always assume that villagers in remote places are friendly and hospitable.
sentencecn: 人们总是以为偏僻的地方的村民们热情好客。

sentence: But people who are cut off not only from foreign tourists, but even from their own countrymen can be hostile to travellers.
sentencecn: 但是，那些不但与外国旅游者隔绝，而且与本国同胞隔绝的人们有可能对游客抱有敌意。

sentence: Visits to really remote villages are seldom enjoyable -- as my wife and I discovered during a tour through the Balkans.
sentencecn: 到真正偏僻的村庄去旅游并不是一件愉快的事情。我与妻子在一次周游巴尔干半岛时对此深有体会。

sentence: We had spent several days in a small town and visited a number of old churches in the vicinity.
sentencecn: 我们在一座小镇上逗留了几天，参观了附近的许多古老的教堂。

sentence: These attracted many visitors, for they were not only of great architectural interest,
sentencecn: 这些教堂吸引了大量游客，不仅是因为建筑风格奇特，

sentence: but contained a large number of beautifully preserved frescoes as well.
sentencecn: 而且还存有大量保存完好的壁画。

sentence: On the day before our departure, several bus loads of tourists descended on the town.
sentencecn: 我们离开小镇的前一天，镇上来了几辆满载游客的公共汽车。

sentence: This was more than we could bear, so we decided to spend our last day exploring the countryside.
sentencecn: 人多得使我们难以忍受，于是我们决定利用最后一天去乡间一游。

sentence: Taking a path which led out of the town, we crossed a few fields until we came to a dense wood.
sentencecn: 我们走上了一条出镇的小路，穿过几块农田，来到一片茂密的树林。

sentence: We expected the path to end abruptly, but we found that it traced its way through the trees.
sentencecn: 我们原以为小路会到此突然终止，没想到它到树林中继续向前延伸。

sentence: We tramped through the wood for over two hours until we arrived at a deep stream.
sentencecn: 我们在树林中跋涉了两个多小时，到了一条深溪边。

sentence: We could see that the path continued on the other side, but we had no idea how we could get across the stream.
sentencecn: 我们可以看到小路在深溪对岸继续向前伸展，但却不知如何越过这道深溪。

sentence: Suddenly my wife spotted a boat moored to the bank.
sentencecn: 突然，妻子发现岸边泊着一条小船，

sentence: In it there was a boatman fast asleep.
sentencecn: 船上有一船夫在呼呼大睡。

sentence: We gently woke him up and asked him to ferry us to the other side.
sentencecn: 我们轻轻地把他唤醒，请他把我们摆渡过溪。

sentence: Though he was reluctant to do so at first, we eventually persuaded him to take us.
sentencecn: 一开始，他很不愿意，但经劝说，终于同意了。

sentence: The path led to a tiny village perched on the steep sides of a mountain.
sentencecn: 顺着小路，我们来到一个座落在陡峭山坡上的小村庄。

sentence: The place consisted of a straggling unmade road which was lined on either side by small houses.
sentencecn: 这儿有一条未经修筑的弯弯曲曲的道路，路两边排列着一些矮小的农舍。

sentence: Even under a clear blue sky, the village looked forbidding, as all the houses were built of grey mud bricks.
sentencecn: 农舍全用灰色的土坯建成，因此，即使在晴朗的蓝天底下，村庄看上去也会令人感到难以亲近。

sentence: The village seemed deserted, the only sign of life being an ugly-looking black goat on a short length of rope tied to a tree in a field nearby.
sentencecn: 村里似乎无人居住，唯一的生命迹象是附近田里一只面目可憎的黑山羊，用一截短绳拴在一棵树上。

sentence: Sitting down on a dilapidated wooden fence near the field, we opened a couple of tins of sardines and had a picnic lunch.
sentencecn: 我们在田边一堵东倒西歪的篱笆墙上坐下来，打开几听沙丁鱼罐头，吃了一顿野外午餐。

sentence: All at once, I noticed that my wife seemed to be filled with alarm.
sentencecn: 突然，我注意到妻子十分惊恐。

sentence: Looking up I saw that we were surrounded by children in rags who were looking at us silently as we ate.
sentencecn: 我抬头一看，发现我们被一群衣衫褴褛的小孩团团围住了，他们在默不作声地看着我们吃饭。

sentence: We offered them food and spoke to them kindly, but they remained motionless.
sentencecn: 我们给他们东西吃，客客气气地同他们交谈，但他们却一动也不动。

sentence: I concluded that they were simply shy of strangers.
sentencecn: 我认为这不过是他们在陌生人面前表现出的害羞。

sentence: When we later walked down the main street of the village, we were followed by a silent procession of children.
sentencecn: 后来，我们在村里的主要街道上行走的时候，一队默不作声的孩子跟在我们后头。

sentence: The village which had seemed deserted, immediately came to life.
sentencecn: 刚才还似乎空荡荡的村庄一下子活跃了起来，

sentence: Faces appeared at windows.
sentencecn: 窗口露出了一张张面孔，

sentence: Men in shirt sleeves stood outside their houses and glared at us.
sentencecn: 只穿着衬衣的男人们站在屋子外面凶狠地盯着我们，

sentence: Old women in black shawls peered at us from doorways.
sentencecn: 披黑纱巾的老妇人站在门口偷偷地瞅着我们。

sentence: The most frightening thing of all was that not a sound could be heard.
sentencecn: 最令人害怕的是到处没有一点声音。

sentence: There was no doubt that we were unwelcome visitors.
sentencecn: 毫无疑问，我们的来访是不受欢迎的。

sentence: We needed no further warning.
sentencecn: 我们不需要进一步的警告了。

sentence: Turning back down the main street, we quickened our pace and made our way rapidly towards the stream where we hoped the boatman was waiting.
sentencecn: 便掉转身子，沿着那条主要街道加快步伐，快速地朝深溪边走去，希望船夫还在那儿等着我们。

sentence: --- lesson 49  The ideal servant
sentencecn: 理想的仆人

sentence: It is a good thing my aunt Harriet died years ago.
sentencecn: 我的姑妈哈丽特好多年前就去世了，这倒是件好事。

sentence: If she were alive today she would not be able to air her views on her favourite topic of conversation: domestic servants.
sentencecn: 如果她活到今天，她将不能就她热衷的话题“佣人”发表意见了。

sentence: Aunt Harriet lived in that leisurely age when servants were employed to do housework.
sentencecn: 哈丽特生活在一个悠闲的年代，家务事都由雇来的佣人代劳。

sentence: She had a huge, rambling country house called 'The Gables'.
sentencecn: 她在乡下有一幢巨大杂乱的房子，叫作“山墙庄园”。

sentence: She was sentimentally attached to this house, for even though it was far too big for her needs,
sentencecn: 她对这幢房子在感情上难舍难分。房子实在太大了，

sentence: she persisted in living there long after her husband's death.
sentencecn: 但在丈夫去世多年后，她仍然执意长年住在那儿。

sentence: Before she grew old, Aunt Harriet used to entertain lavishly.
sentencecn: 哈丽特姑妈年轻时，喜欢大摆宴席，招待宾客。

sentence: I often visited The Gables when I was boy.
sentencecn: 我小时候常去“山墙庄园”作客。

sentence: No matter how many guests were present, the great house was always immaculate.
sentencecn: 不管去多少宾客，大房子里总是收拾得干干净净。

sentence: The parquet floors shone like mirrors;
sentencecn: 镶木地板洁如明镜，

sentence: highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets;
sentencecn: 擦得发亮的银器陈列在明亮的玻璃柜里，

sentence: even my uncle's huge collection of books was kept miraculously free from dust.
sentencecn: 连姑夫的大量藏书也保存得很好，奇迹般地一尘不染。

sentence: Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished.
sentencecn: 哈丽特姑妈统率着一支看不见的佣人大军，他们不停地擦拭、清扫、刷洗。

sentence: She always referred to them as 'the shifting population',
sentencecn: 她称这些佣人叫“流动人口”，

sentence: for they came and went with such frequency that I never even got a chance to learn their names.
sentencecn: 因为他们来去匆匆，所以我甚至都没有机会知道他们的姓名。

sentence: Though my aunt pursued what was, in those days, an enlightened policy, in that she never allowed her domestic staff to work more than eight hours a day, she was extremely difficult to please.
sentencecn: 姑妈待佣人在当时算是开明的，从来不让佣人每天工作超过8小时，但他们很难使她称心如意。

sentence: While she always criticized the fickleness of human nature,
sentencecn: 她一方面总是批评人的本性朝三暮四，

sentence: she carried on an unrelenting search for the ideal servant to the end of her days,even after she had been sadly disillusioned by Bessie.
sentencecn: 另一方面她又持之以恒地寻找一个理想的佣人。即使在贝西大大地伤她的心之后，她还在找，一直到她死去。

sentence: Bessie worked for Aunt Harriet for three years.
sentencecn: 贝西在哈丽特家干了3年。

sentence: During that time she so gained my aunt's confidence, that she was put in charge of the domestic staff.
sentencecn: 在此期间，她赢得了姑母的赏识，甚至当上了大管家。

sentence: Aunt Harriet could not find words to praise Bessie's industriousness and efficiency.
sentencecn: 哈丽特不知该用什么言辞来赞扬贝西的勤奋与高效。

sentence: In addition to all her other qualifications, Bessie was an expert cook.
sentencecn: 贝西除了有各种本领以外，还是一个烹饪大师。

sentence: She acted the role of the perfect servant for three years before Aunt Harriet discovered her 'little weakness'.
sentencecn: 她担任“理想仆人”角色3年之后，哈丽特终于发现她有“小小的弱点”。

sentence: After being absent from The Gables for a week,
sentencecn: 一次，姑妈有一个星期没在“山墙庄园”住。

sentence: my aunt unexpectedly returned one afternoon with a party of guests and instructed Bessie to prepare dinner.
sentencecn: 一天下午，她出其不意地回来了，带来一大批客人，吩咐贝西准备晚饭。

sentence: Not only was the meal well below the usual standard, but Bessie seemed unable to walk steadily.
sentencecn: 结果，不仅饭菜远不如平时做得好，而且贝西走起路来似乎东倒西歪。

sentence: She bumped into the furniture and kept mumbling about the guests.
sentencecn: 她撞到了家具上，嘴里还不断咕咕哝哝议论客人。

sentence: When she came in with the last course -- a huge pudding -- she tripped on the carpet
sentencecn: 当她端着最后一道菜--一大盘布丁--走进屋来时，在地毯上绊了一跤。

sentence: and the pudding went flying through the air, narrowly missed my aunt, and crashed on the dining table with considerable force.
sentencecn: 布丁飞到半空，从姑母身边擦过，然后狠狠地砸在餐桌上。

sentence: Though this caused great mirth among the guests, Aunt Harriet was horrified.
sentencecn: 这件事引起了客人们的欢笑，但哈丽特却着实吓了一跳。

sentence: She reluctantly came to the conclusion that Bessie was drunk.
sentencecn: 她不得不认定贝西是喝醉了。

sentence: The guests had, of course, realized this from the moment Bessie opened the door for them and,long before the final catastrophe, had had a difficult time trying to conceal their amusement.
sentencecn: 客人们自然从贝西为他们开门那一刻起就看出来了，在好长一段时间里，即最后这个乱子发生前，他们努力克制才没笑出声来。

sentence: The poor girl was dismissed instantly.
sentencecn: 贝西当即被解雇了。

sentence: After her departure, Aunt Harriet discovered that there were piles of empty wine bottles of all shapes and sizes neatly stacked in what had once been Bessie's wardrobe.
sentencecn: 贝西走后，哈丽特姑妈发现在贝西以前用过的衣柜里整整齐齐地放着一堆堆形状各异、大小不一的酒瓶子。

sentence: They had mysteriously found their way there from the wine cellar!
sentencecn: 这些酒瓶神不知鬼不觉地从酒窖来到了这里。

sentence: --- lesson 50  New Year resolutions
sentencecn: 新年的决心

sentence: The New Year is a time for resolutions.
sentencecn: 新年是下决心的时候，

sentence: Mentally, at least, most of us could compile formidable lists of 'dos' and 'don'ts'.
sentencecn: 至少在大多数人的心里会编排出一份“应做什么”和“不应做什么”的令人生畏的单子。

sentence: The same old favorites recur year in year out with monotonous regularity.
sentencecn: 相同的决心以单调的规律年复一年地出现。

sentence: We resolve to get up earlier each morning, eat less,
sentencecn: 我们决心每天早晨起得早些；吃得少些；

sentence: find more time to play with the children, do a thousand and one jobs about the house,
sentencecn: 多花点时间与孩子们一起做游戏；做大量的家务；

sentence: be nice to people we don't like, drive carefully, and take the dog for a walk every day.
sentencecn: 对不喜欢的人友善一些；小心驾车；每天都要带着狗散步；等等。

sentence: Past experience has taught us that certain accomplishments are beyond attainment.
sentencecn: 以往的经验告诉我们有些事是办不到的。

sentence: If we remain inveterate smokers, it is only because we have so often experienced the frustration that results from failure.
sentencecn: 如果我们烟瘾大，戒不掉，那是因为屡戒屡败，失去了信心。

sentence: Most of us fail in our efforts at self-improvement because our schemes are too ambitious and we never have time to carry them out.
sentencecn: 我们大多数人想自我完善却遭到失败，这是因为我们的规划过于宏大，而又根本没有时间去实施。

sentence: We also make the fundamental error of announcing our resolutions to everybody
sentencecn: 我们还犯有一个根本性的错误，即把我们的决心向大家宣布。

sentence: so that we look even more foolish when we slip back into our bad old ways.
sentencecn: 这样一旦滑回到那些老习惯上去，我们在别人的眼里会显得更加难堪。

sentence: Aware of these pitfalls, this year I attempted to keep my resolutions to myself.
sentencecn: 我深知这些问题，于是，今年我对自己的计划要严加保密，

sentence: I limited myself to two modest ambitions: to do physical exercise every morning and to read more of an evening.
sentencecn: 只给自己定下两项适中的任务；每天早上锻炼身体，每天晚上多看点书。

sentence: An all-night party on New Year's Eve provided me with a good excuse for not carrying out either of these new resolutions on the first day of the year,
sentencecn: 新年除夕举办的一次通宵晚会，使我理直气壮地在新年头一天免去了这两项任务。

sentence: but on the second, I applied myself assiduously to the task.
sentencecn: 不过，新年第二天，我全力以赴地照着去做了。

sentence: The daily exercises lasted only eleven minutes and I proposed to do them early in the morning before anyone had got up.
sentencecn: 早锻炼一共只有11分钟，我打算在别人起床之前进行。

sentence: The self-discipline required to drag myself out of bed eleven minutes earlier than usual was considerable.
sentencecn: 这就要求我比平时早11分钟把自己从床上拽起来，这种自我约束是很艰苦的。

sentence: Nevertheless, I managed to creep down into the living room for two days before anyone found me out.
sentencecn: 不过开头两天我还是成功地蹑手蹑脚地来到楼下起居室，被谁也没发现。

sentence: After jumping about on the carpet and twisting the human frame into uncomfortable positions,
sentencecn: 我在地毯上跳过来蹦过去，扭曲身子，摆出各种姿势，弄得浑身不舒服，

sentence: I sat down at the breakfast table in an exhausted condition.
sentencecn: 然后坐到桌边吃早饭，一副筋疲力尽的样子。

sentence: It was this that betrayed me.
sentencecn: 正是这副模样泄露了我的秘密。

sentence: The next morning the whole family trooped in to watch the performance.
sentencecn: 第二天早晨全家人结队来到起居室看我表演。

sentence: That was really unsettling, but I fended off the taunts and jibes of the family good-humouredly and soon everybody got used to the idea.
sentencecn: 这真叫人不好意思，但我心平气和地顶住了全家人的嘲笑和奚落。不久，大家对我习以为常了，

sentence: However, my enthusiasm waned.
sentencecn: 而这时我的热情却减退了。

sentence: The time I spent at exercises gradually diminished.
sentencecn: 我花在锻炼上的时间逐渐减少，

sentence: Little by little the eleven minutes fell to zero.
sentencecn: 慢慢地从11分钟减到了零。
