sentence: By January 10th, I was back to where I had started from.
sentencecn: 到了1月10日，我恢复了原来的作息时间。

sentence: I argued that if I spent less time exhausting myself at exercises in the morning, I would keep my mind fresh for reading when I got home from work.
sentencecn: 我辩解说，早晨少耗费精力锻炼，晚上下班回家看书时头脑更清醒些。

sentence: Resisting the hypnotizing effect of television, I sat in my room for a few evenings with my eyes glued to a book.
sentencecn: 有几天晚上，我极力摆脱了电视的诱惑，坐在自己的房间里，两眼盯在书上。

sentence: One night, however, feeling cold and lonely, I went downstairs and sat in front of the television pretending to read.
sentencecn: 可是，有一天夜里，我感到又冷又孤单，便来到楼下坐在电视机前假装看书。

sentence: That proved to be my undoing, for I soon got back to my old bad habit of dozing off in front of the screen.
sentencecn: 这下我可完了，因为不一会儿，我就恢复了以前的坏习惯，在屏幕前打起瞌睡来。

sentence: I still haven't given up my resolution to do more reading.
sentencecn: 但我还没有放弃多看些书的决心。

sentence: In fact, I have just bought a book entitled How to Read a Thousand Words a Minute.
sentencecn: 事实上，我刚买来一本叫《一分钟读一千字的诀窍》的书。

sentence: Perhaps it will solve my problem, but I just haven't had time to read it!
sentencecn: 也许这本书能解决我的问题，但我一直还没时间去看这本书！

sentence: --- lesson 55  From the earth: Greetings
sentencecn: 来自地球的问候

sentence: Recent developments in astronomy have made it possible to detect planets in our own Milky Way and in other galaxies.
sentencecn: 天文学方面最新发展使得我们能够在银河系和其他星系发现行星。

sentence: This is a major achievement because, in relative terms, planets are very small and do not emit light.
sentencecn: 这是一个重要的成就，因为相对来说，行星很小，而且也不发光。

sentence: Finding planets is proving hard enough, but finding life on them will prove infinitely more difficult.
sentencecn: 寻找行星证明相当困难，但是要在行星上发现生命会变得无比艰难。

sentence: The first question to answer is whether a planet can actually support life.
sentencecn: 第一个需要解答的问题是一颗行星是否有能够维持生命的条件。

sentence: In our own solar system, for example, Venus is far too hot and Mars is far too cold to support life.
sentencecn: 举例来说，在我们的太阳系里，对于生命来说，金星的温度太高，而火星的温度则太低。

sentence: Only the Earth provides ideal conditions, and even here it has taken more than four billion years for plant and animal life to evolve.
sentencecn: 只有地球提供了理想的条件，而即使在这里，植物和动物的进化也用了40亿年的时间。

sentence: Whether a planet can support life depends on the size and brightness of its star, that is its 'sun'.
sentencecn: 一颗行星是否能够维持生命取决于它的恒星--即它的“太阳”--的大小和亮度。

sentence: Imagine a star up to twenty times larger, brighter and hotter than our own sun.
sentencecn: 设想一下，一颗恒星比我们的太阳还要大，还要亮，还要热20倍，

sentence: A planet would have to be a very long way from it to be capable of supporting life.
sentencecn: 那么一颗行星为了维持生命就要离它的恒星非常远。

sentence: Alternatively, if the star were small, the life-supporting planet would have to have a close orbit round it and also provide the perfect conditions for life forms to develop.
sentencecn: 反之，如果恒星很小，维持生命的行星就要在离恒星很近的轨道上运行，而且要有极好的条件才能使生命得以发展。

sentence: But how would we find such a planet?
sentencecn: 但是，我们如何才能找到这样一颗行星呢?

sentence: At present, there is no telescope in existence that is capable of detecting the presence of life.
sentencecn: 现在，没有一台现存的望远镜可以发现生命的存在。

sentence: The development of such a telescope will be one of the great astronomical projects of the twenty-first century.
sentencecn: 而开发这样一台望远镜将会是21世纪天文学的一个重要的研究课题。

sentence: It is impossible to look for life on another planet using earth-based telescopes.
sentencecn: 使用放置在地球上的望远镜是无法观察到其他行星上的生命的。

sentence: Our own warm atmosphere and the heat generated by the telescope would make it impossible to detect objects as small as planets.
sentencecn: 地球周围温暖的大气层和望远镜散出的热量使得我们根本不可能找到比行星更小的物体。

sentence: Even a telescope in orbit round the earth, like the very successful Hubble telescope, would not be suitable because of the dust particles in our solar system.
sentencecn: 即使是一台放置在围绕地球的轨道上的望远镜--如非常成功的哈勃望远镜--也因为太阳系中的尘埃微粒而无法胜任。

sentence: A telescope would have to be as far away as the planet Jupiter to look for life in outer space,
sentencecn: 望远镜要放置在木星那样遥远的行星上才有可能在外层空间搜寻生命，

sentence: because the dust becomes thinner the further we travel towards the outer edges of our own solar system.
sentencecn: 因为我们越是接近太阳系的边缘，尘埃就越稀薄。

sentence: Once we detected a planet, we would have to find a way of blotting out the light from its star,
sentencecn: 一旦我们找到这样一颗行星，我们就要想办法将它的恒星射过来的光线遮暗，

sentence: so that we would be able to 'see' the planet properly and analyse its atmosphere.
sentencecn: 这样我们就能彻底“看见”这颗行星，并分析它的大气层。

sentence: In the first instance, we would be looking for plant life, rather than 'little green men'.
sentencecn: 首先我们要寻找植物，而不是那种“小绿人”。

sentence: The life forms most likely to develop on a planet would be bacteria.
sentencecn: 行星上最容易生存下来的是细菌。

sentence: It is bacteria that have generated the oxygen we breathe on earth.
sentencecn: 正是细菌生产出我们在地球上呼吸的氧气。

sentence: For most of the earth's history they have been the only form of life on our planet.
sentencecn: 在地球上发展的大部分进程中，细菌是地球上唯一的生命形式。

sentence: As Earth-dwellers, we always cherish the hope that we will be visited by little green men and that we will be able to communicate with them.
sentencecn: 作为地球上的居民，我们总存有这样的希望：小绿人来拜访我们，而我们可以和他们交流。

sentence: But this hope is always in the realms of science fiction.
sentencecn: 但是，这种希望总是只在科幻小说中存在。

sentence: If we were able to discover lowly forms of life like bacteria on another planet, it would completely change our view of ourselves.
sentencecn: 如果我们能够在另一颗行星上找到诸如细菌那种低等生命，那么这个发现将彻底改变我们对我们自己的看法。

sentence: As Daniel Goldin of NASA observed, 'Finding life elsewhere would change everything.
sentencecn: 正如美国国家航空和宇宙航空局的丹尼尔.戈尔丁指出的“在其他地方发现生命会改变一切。

sentence: No human endeavour or thought would be unchanged by it.'
sentencecn: 任何人类的努力和想法都会发生变化。”

sentence: --- lesson 60   Too early and too late
sentencecn: 太早和太晚

sentence: Punctuality is a necessary habit in all public affairs in civilized society.
sentencecn: 准时是文明社会中进行一切社交活动时必须养成的习惯。

sentence: Without it, nothing could ever be brought to a conclusion; everything would be in a state of chaos.
sentencecn: 不准时将一事无成，事事都会陷入混乱不堪的境地。

sentence: Only in a sparsely-populated rural community is it possible to disregard it.
sentencecn: 只有在人口稀少的农村，才可以忽视准时的习惯。

sentence: In ordinary living, there can be some tolerance of unpunctuality.
sentencecn: 在日常生活中人们可以容忍一定程度的不准时。

sentence: The intellectual, who is working on some abstruse problem, has everything coordinated and organized for the matter in hand.
sentencecn: 一个专心钻研某个复杂问题的知识分子，为了搞好手头的研究，要把一切都协调一致，组织周密。

sentence: He is therefore forgiven if late for a dinner party.
sentencecn: 因此，他要是赴宴迟到了会得到谅解。

sentence: But people are often reproached for unpunctuality when their only fault is cutting things fine.
sentencecn: 但有些人不准时常常因为掐钟点所致，他们常常受到责备，

sentence: It is hard for energetic, quick-minded people to waste time,
sentencecn: 精力充沛、头脑敏捷的人极不愿意浪费时间，

sentence: so they are often tempted to finish a job before setting out to keep an appointment.
sentencecn: 因此他们常想做完一件事后再去赴约。

sentence: If no accidents occur on the way, like punctured tyres, diversions of traffic, sudden descent of fog, they will be on time.
sentencecn: 要是路上没有发生如爆胎、改道、突然起雾等意外事故，他们决不会迟到的。

sentence: They are often more industrious, useful citizens than those who are never late.
sentencecn: 他们与那些从不迟到的人相比，常常是更勤奋有用的公民。

sentence: The over-punctual can be as much a trial to others as the unpunctual.
sentencecn: 早到的人同迟到的人一样令人讨厌。

sentence: The guest who arrives half an hour too soon is the greatest nuisance.
sentencecn: 客人提前半小时到达是令人讨厌的。

sentence: Some friends of my family had this irritating habit.
sentencecn: 我家有几个朋友就有这有令人恼火的习惯。

sentence: The only thing to do was ask them to come half an hour later than the other guests.
sentencecn: 唯一的办法就是请他们比别的客人晚来半小时。

sentence: Then they arrived just when we wanted them.
sentencecn: 这样，他们可以恰好在我们要求的时间到达。

sentence: If you are catching a train, it is always better to be comfortably early than even a fraction of a minute too late.
sentencecn: 如果赶火车，早到总比晚到好，哪怕早到一会儿也好。

sentence: Although being early may mean wasting a little time,
sentencecn: 虽然早到可能意味着浪费一点时间，

sentence: this will be less than if you miss the train and have to wait an hour or more for the next one;
sentencecn: 但这比误了火车等上一个多小时坐下一班车浪费的时间要少，

sentence: and you avoid the frustration of arriving at the very moment when the train is drawing out of the station and being unable to get on it.
sentencecn: 而且可以避免那种正好在火车驶出站时赶到车站，因上不去车而感到的沮丧。

sentence: An even harder situation is to be on the platform in good time for a train and still to see it go off without you.
sentencecn: 更难堪的情况是虽然及时赶到站台上，却眼睁睁地看着那趟火车启动，把你抛下。

sentence: Such an experience befell a certain young girl the first time she was travelling alone.
sentencecn: 一个小姑娘第一次单独出门就碰到了这种情况。

sentence: She entered the station twenty minutes before the train was due,
sentencecn: 在火车进站20分钟前她就进了车站。

sentence: since her parents had impressed upon her that it would be unforgivable to miss it and cause the friends with whom she was going to stay to make two journeys to meet her.
sentencecn: 因为她的父母再三跟她说，如果误了这趟车，她的东道主朋友就得接她两趟，这是不应该的。

sentence: She gave her luggage to a porter and showed him her ticket.
sentencecn: 她把行李交给搬运工并给他看了车票。

sentence: To her horror he said that she was two hours too soon.
sentencecn: 搬运工说她早到了两个小时，她听后大吃一惊。

sentence: She felt in her handbag for the piece of paper on which her father had written down all the details of the journey and gave it to the porter.
sentencecn: 她从钱包里摸出一张纸条，那上面有她父亲对这次旅行的详细说明，她把这张纸条交给了搬运工。

sentence: He agreed that a train did come into the station at the time on the paper and that it did stop,
sentencecn: 搬运工说，正如纸条所说，确有一趟火车在那个时刻到站，

sentence: but only to take on mail, not passengers.
sentencecn: 但它只停站装邮件，不载旅客。

sentence: The girl asked to see a timetable, feeling sure that her father could not have made such a mistake.
sentencecn: 姑娘要求看时刻表，因为她相信父亲不能把这么大的事给弄错。

sentence: The porter went to fetch one and arrived back with the station master,
sentencecn: 搬运工跑回去取时刻表，同时请来了站长。

sentence: who produced it with a flourish and pointed out a microscopic 'o' beside the time of the arrival of the train at his station;
sentencecn: 站长拿着时刻表一挥手，指着那趟列车到站时刻旁边一个很小的圆圈标记。

sentence: this little 'o' indicated that the train only stopped for mail.
sentencecn: 这个标记表示列车是为装邮件而停车。

sentence: Just as that moment the train came into the station.
sentencecn: 正在这时，火车进站了。

sentence: The girl, tears streaming down her face, begged to be allowed to slip into the guard's van.
sentencecn: 女孩泪流满面，央求让她不声不响地到押车员车厢里去算了。

sentence: But the station master was adamant:
sentencecn: 但站长态度坚决，

sentence: rules could not be broken. And she had to watch that train disappear towards her destination while she was left behind.
sentencecn: 规章制度不能破坏，姑娘只得眼看着那趟火车消逝在她要去的方向而撇下了她。

sentence: --- Lesson 3 Matterhorn man
sentencecn: 课文3  马特霍恩山区人

sentence: What was the main objective of early mountain climbers?
sentencecn: 早期登山运动员的主要目标是什么?

sentence: Modern alpinists try to climb mountains by a route which will give them good sport,
sentencecn: 现代登山运动员总想找一条能够给他们带来运动乐趣的路线来攀登山峰。

sentence: and the more difficult it is, the more highly it is regarded.
sentencecn: 他们认为， 道路愈艰险愈带劲儿。

sentence: In the pioneering days however, this was not the case at all.
sentencecn: 然而，在登山运动的初期，全然不是这种情况。

sentence: The early climbers were looking for the easiest way to the top because the summit was the prize they sought,
sentencecn: 早期登山者所寻找的是通往山顶的最方便的途径，因为顶峰才是他们寻求的目标。

sentence: especially if it had never been attained before.
sentencecn: 特别是前人未曾到过的顶峰。

sentence: It is true that during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature,
sentencecn: 确实，在探险中他们经常遇到惊心动魄的困难和危险，

sentence: equipped in a manner which would make a modern climber shudder at the thought,
sentencecn: 而他们装备之简陋足以使现代登山者一想起来就胆战心惊。

sentence: but they did not go out of their way to court such excitement.
sentencecn: 但是，他们并非故意寻求这种刺激，

sentence: They had a single aim, a solitary goal -- the top!
sentencecn: 他们只有一个目标，唯一的目标 -- 顶峰！

sentence: It is hard for us to realize nowadays how difficult it was for the pioneers.
sentencecn: 我们今天很难想像昔日的登山先驱们是多么艰苦。

sentence: Except for one or two places such as Zermatt and Chamonix, which had rapidly become popular.
sentencecn: 除了泽曼特和夏蒙尼等一两个很快出了名的地方外，

sentence: Alpine villages tended to be impoverished settlements cut off from civilization by the high mountains.
sentencecn: 阿尔卑斯山山区的小村几乎全是高山环抱、与世隔绝的穷乡僻壤。

sentence: Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden;
sentencecn: 那里的小客栈一般都很肮脏，而且跳蚤猖獗。

sentence: the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old,
sentencecn: 食物是当地的干酪和通常存放了一年之久的面包，

sentence: all washed down with coarse wine.
sentencecn: 人们就着劣酒吞下这种食物。

sentence: Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could --
sentencecn: 山谷里常常没有小客栈，登山者只好随遇而安。

sentence: sometimes with the local priest (who was usually as poor as his parishioners),
sentencecn: 有时同当地牧师 （他通常和他的教民一样穷）住在一起，

sentence: sometimes with shepherds or cheese-makers.
sentencecn: 有时同牧羊人或制乳酪的人住在一起。

sentence: Invariably the background was the same:dirt and poverty, and very uncomfortable.
sentencecn: 无论住在哪儿，情况都一样：肮脏、贫穷，极其不舒适。

sentence: For men accustomed to eating seven-course dinners and sleeping between fine linen sheets at home,
sentencecn: 对于过惯了一顿饭吃7道菜、睡亚麻细布床单的人来说，

sentence: the change to the Alps must have been very hard indeed.
sentencecn: 变换一下生活环境来到阿尔卑斯山山区，那一定是很艰难的。

sentence: --- Lesson 9 Royal espionage
sentencecn: 课文9  谍报活动

sentence: What important thing did King Alfred learn when he penetrated the Danish camp of Guthrum?
sentencecn: 当阿尔弗雷德国王深入丹麦古瑟鲁姆的营地时，他学到了什么重要的东西?

sentence: Alfred the Great acted as his own spy, visiting Danish camps disguised as a minstrel.
sentencecn: 阿尔弗雷德大帝曾亲自充当间谍。他扮作吟游歌手到丹麦军队的营地里侦察。

sentence: In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere.
sentencecn: 当时，浪迹天涯的吟游歌手到处受欢迎，

sentence: They were not fighting men, and their harp was their passport.
sentencecn: 他们不是作战人员，竖琴就是他们的通行证。

sentence: Alfred had learned many of their ballads in his youth and could vary his programme with acrobatic tricks and simple conjuring.
sentencecn: 阿尔弗德年轻时学过许多民歌，并能穿插演一些杂技和小魔术使自己的节目多样化。

sentence: While Alfred's little army slowly began to gather at Athelney, the king himself set out to penetrate the camp of Guthrum, the commander of the Danish invaders.
sentencecn: 阿尔弗雷德人数不多的军队开始在阿塞尔纳慢慢集结时，他亲自潜入丹麦入侵司令官古瑟罗姆的营地。

sentence: These had settled down for the winter at Chippenham: thither Alfred went.
sentencecn: 丹麦军已在切本哈姆扎下营准备过冬，阿尔弗雷便来到此地。

sentence: He noticed at once that discipline was slack: the Danes had the self-confidence of conquerors, and their security precautions were casual.
sentencecn: 他马上发现丹麦军纪律松弛，他们以征服者自居，安全措施马马虎虎。

sentence: They lived well, on the proceeds of raids on neighbouring regions.
sentencecn: 他们靠掠夺附近的地区的财物过着舒适的生活。

sentence: There they collected women as well as food and drink, and a life of ease had made them soft.
sentencecn: 他们不仅搜刮吃的喝的，而且抢掠妇女，安逸的生活已使丹麦军队变得软弱无力。

sentence: Alfred stayed in the camp a week before he returned to Athelney.
sentencecn: 阿尔弗雷德在敌营呆了一个星期后，回到了阿塞尔纳。

sentence: The force there assembled was trivial compared with the Danish horde.
sentencecn: 他集结在那里的军队和丹麦大军相比是微不足道的，

sentence: But Alfred had deduced that the Danes were no longer fit for prolonged battle: and that their commissariat had no organization, but depended on irregular raids.
sentencecn: 然而，阿尔弗雷德断定，丹麦人已不再适应持久的战争，他们的军需供应处于无组织状态，只是靠临时抢夺来维持。

sentence: So, faced with the Danish advance, Alfred did not risk open battle but harried the enemy.
sentencecn: 因此，面对丹麦人的进攻，阿尔弗雷德没有贸然同敌人作战，而是采用骚扰敌人的战术。

sentence: He was constantly on the move, drawing the Danes after him.
sentencecn: 他的部队不停地移动，牵着敌人的鼻子，让他们跟着跑。

sentence: His patrols halted the raiding parties: hunger assailed the Danish army.
sentencecn: 他派出巡逻队阻止敌人抢劫，因而饥饿威胁着丹麦军队。

sentence: Now Alfred began a long series of skirmishes -- and within a month the Danes had surrendered.
sentencecn: 这时，阿尔弗雷德发起一连串小规模的进攻，结果不出一个月，丹麦人就投降了。

sentence: The episode could reasonably serve as a unique epic of royal espionage!
sentencecn: 这一幕历史可以说是王室谍报活动中最精彩的篇章。

sentence: --- Lesson 14 The Butterfly Effect
sentencecn: 课文14  蝴蝶效应

sentence: Why do small errors make it impossible to predict the weather system with a high degree of accuracy?
sentencecn: 为什么小的误差就不能准确地预测天气系统?

sentence: Beyond two or three days, the world's best weather forecasts are speculative,
sentencecn: 世界上最好的两三天以上的天气预报具有很强的猜测性，

sentence: and beyond six or seven they are worthless.
sentencecn: 如果超过六七天，天气预报就没有了任何价值。

sentence: The Butterfly Effect is the reason.
sentencecn: 原因是蝴蝶效应。

sentence: For small pieces of weather--
sentencecn: 对于小片的恶劣天气，

sentence: and to a global forecaster, small can mean thunderstorms and blizzards--
sentencecn: 对一个全球性的气象预报员来说，“小”可以意味着雷暴雨和暴风雪。

sentence: any prediction deteriorates rapidly.
sentencecn: 任何预测的质量会很快下降。

sentence: Errors and uncertainties multiply, cascading upward through a chain of turbulent features,
sentencecn: 错误和不可靠性上升，接踵而来的是一系列湍流的徵状，

sentence: from dust devils and squalls up to continent-size eddies that only satellites can see.
sentencecn: 从小尘暴和暴风发展到只有卫星上可以看到的席卷整块大陆的旋涡。

sentence: The modern weather models work with a grid of points of the order of sixty miles apart,
sentencecn: 现代气象模型以一个坐标图来显示，图中每个点大约是间隔60英里。

sentence: and even so, some starting data has to be guessed,
sentencecn: 既使是这样，有些开始时的资料也不得不依靠推测，

sentence: since ground stations and satellites cannot see everywhere.
sentencecn: 因为地面工作站和卫星不可能看到地球上的每一个地方。

sentence: But suppose the earth could be covered with sensors spaced one foot apart,
sentencecn: 假设地球上可以布满传感器，

sentence: rising at one-foot intervals all the way to the top of the atmosphere.
sentencecn: 每个相隔1英尺，并按1英尺的间隔从地面一直排列到大气层的顶端。

sentence: Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature,
sentencecn: 再假定每个传感器都极极端准确地读出了温度、

sentence: pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want.
sentencecn: 气压、温度和气象学家需要的任何其他数据。

sentence: Precisely at noon an infinitely powerful computer takes all the data and calculates what will happen at each point
sentencecn: 在正午时分，一个功能巨大的计算机搜集了所有的资料，并算出在每一个点

sentence: The computer will still be unable to predict whether Princeton, New Jersey, will have sun or rain on a day one month away.
sentencecn: 计算机无法推断出1个月以后的某一天，新泽西州的普林斯顿究竟是晴天还是雨天。

sentence: At noon the spaces between the sensors will hide fluctuations that the computer will not know about,
sentencecn: 正午时分，传感器之间的距离会掩盖计算机无法知道的波动，

sentence: tiny deviations from the average.
sentencecn: 任何偏平均值的变化。

sentence: By 12.01, those fluctuations will already have created small errors one foot away.
sentencecn: 到12：01时，那些波动就已经会在1英尺远的地方造成偏差。

sentence: Soon the errors will have multiplied to the ten-foot scale, and so on up to the size of the globe.
sentencecn: 很快这种偏差会增加到尺10英的范围，如此等等，一直到全球的范围。

sentence: --- Lesson 20 Snake poison
sentencecn: 课文20  蛇毒

sentence: What are the two different ways in which snake poison acts?
sentencecn: 蛇毒有两种不同的作用方式?

sentence: How in came about that snakes manufactured poison is a mystery.
sentencecn: 蛇是怎样产生毒液的，这是一个谜。

sentence: Over the periods their saliva, a mild, digestive juice like our own, was converted into a poison that defies analysis even today.
sentencecn: 蛇的唾液本来和我们人的消化液一样柔和，但经过漫长的时间，演变成了今天仍无法分析清楚的毒液。

sentence: It was not forced upon them by the survival competition;
sentencecn: 毒液不是生存竞争强加给它们的，

sentence: they could have caught and lived on prey without using poison, just as the thousands of non-poisonous snakes still do.
sentencecn: 它们也可以不用毒液捕捉动物而生存，就像今天成千上万的无毒蛇那样。

sentence: Poison to a snake is merely a luxury;
sentencecn: 毒液对毒蛇来说只不过是一种舒适生存的优越手段，

sentence: it enables it to get its food with very little effort, no more effort than one bite.
sentencecn: 它使蛇不用费多大力气就能捕获到食物，轻咬一口即可。

sentence: And why only snakes?
sentencecn: 为什么只有蛇才有毒液呢？

sentence: Cats, for instance, would be greatly helped;
sentencecn: 譬如说，如果猫有毒液，那对猫会大有帮助，

sentence: no running fights with large, fierce rats or tussles with grown rabbits -- just a bite and no more effort needed.
sentencecn: 它就不必再和又大又凶的老鼠边跑边博斗了，也不必再和大兔子扭斗了，只需要咬一口就可以了。

sentence: In fact, it would be an assistance to all carnivores though it would be a two-edged weapon when they fought each other.
sentencecn: 因此，任何食肉动物有了毒液，都能从中获益。不过，当它们相互撕打时，毒液就成了利弊参半的武器，可以杀死对方，也可以被对方的毒液杀死。

sentence: But, of the vertebrates unpredictable Nature selected only snakes (and one lizard).
sentencecn: 然而，在脊椎动物中，大自然神秘模测地只选择了蛇（还有一种蜥蜴），

sentence: One wonders also why Nature, with some snakes concocted poison of such extreme potency.
sentencecn: 人们弄不清楚大自然为什么在某些蛇的身上调制出如此高效的毒液来。

sentence: In the conversion of saliva into poison, one might suppose that a fixed process took place. It did not;
sentencecn: 人们可能认为，唾液转变成毒液，其中有固定的程序。其实没有。

sentence: some snakes manufactured a poison different in every respect from that of others,
sentencecn: 有些蛇产生的毒液也在各方面与另外一些毒蛇产生的毒液不同，

sentence: as different as arsenic is from strychnine, and having different effects.
sentencecn: 就像砒霜不同于马钱子碱一样，不同毒蛇产生的毒液产生的效果不同。

sentence: One poison acts on the nerves, the other on the blood.
sentencecn: 一种毒液作用于神经，另一种毒液作用于血液。

sentence: The makers of the nerve poison include the mambas and the cobras and their venom is called neurotoxic.
sentencecn: 产生神经毒液的蛇有一种非洲树眼镜蛇和眼镜蛇，它们的毒液称为神经毒素。

sentence: Vipers (adders) and rattlesnakes manufacture the blood poison, which is known as haemolytic.
sentencecn: 蝰蛇（蝮蛇）和响尾蛇产生血液毒素，称为溶血性毒液。

sentence: Both poisons are unpleasant, but by far the more unpleasant is the blood poison.
sentencecn: 这两种毒液都很可怕，但溶血性毒液尤其厉害。

sentence: It is said that the nerve poison is the more primitive of the two, that the blood poison is, so to speak, a newer product from an improved formula.
sentencecn: 据说，神经毒液在两种毒液中是较为原始的一种，而溶血性毒液，打个比方说，是根据改良配方生产的一种较新的产品。

sentence: Be that as it may, the nerve poison does its business with man far more quickly than the blood poison.
sentencecn: 不过，神经毒辣液比溶血性毒液在人身上起作用快得多。

sentence: This, however, means nothing.
sentencecn: 但是，这没有什么关系，

sentence: Snakes did not acquire their poison for use against man but for use against prey such as rats and mice,
sentencecn: 因为蛇有毒液不是用来对付人的，而是对付它的猎物，诸如鼠类，

sentence: and the effects on these of viperine poison is almost immediate.
sentencecn: 毒液对这些猎物会立刻起作用。

sentence: --- Lesson 26 The past life of the earth
sentencecn: 课文26  地球上的昔日生命

sentence: What is the main condition for the preservation of the remains of any living creature?
sentencecn: 保存任何生物遗体的主要条件是什么?

sentence: It is animals and plants which lived in or near water whose remains are most likely to be preserved,
sentencecn: 只有生活在水中或水边的动植物尸体最有可能被保存下来，

sentence: for one of the necessary conditions of preservation is quick burial,
sentencecn: 因为保存的必要条件之一是迅速掩埋，

sentence: and it is only in the seas and rivers, and sometimes lakes,
sentencecn: 所以只有在海洋和江河里，有时在湖泊里，

sentence: where mud and silt have been continuously deposited,
sentencecn: 泥沙不停淤积，

sentence: that bodies and the like can be rapidly covered over and preserved.
sentencecn: 尸体之类的东西才能被迅速地覆盖而保存下来。

sentence: But even in the most favourable circumstances
sentencecn: 即使是在最有利的环境中，

sentence: only a small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way
sentencecn: 死去的生物中也只有一小部分

sentence: before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them.
sentencecn: 能在开始腐烂前，或更可能在被食腐动物吃掉之前，被这样保存下来。

sentence: After all, all living creatures live by feeding on something else,
sentencecn: 因为一切生物都是靠吃别的东西来活命的，

sentence: whether it be plant or animal, dead or alive,
sentencecn: 不管这种东西是植物还是动物，死的还是活的，

sentence: and it is only by chance that such a fate is avoided.
sentencecn: 因此，生物偶尔才能避免被吃掉的命运。

sentence: The remains of plants and animals that lived on land are much more rarely preserved,
sentencecn: 曾在陆地上生活过的动植物的遗体被保存下来的更为罕见，

sentence: for there is seldom anything to cover them over.
sentencecn: 因为陆地上几乎没有什么东西覆盖它们。

sentence: When you think of the innumerable birds that one sees flying about,
sentencecn: 你可以想象出天上有看得见的飞来飞去、数不清的鸟，

sentence: not to mention the equally numerous small animals like field mice and voles which you do not see,
sentencecn: 地上有不显眼的无数的老鼠和田鼠之类的小动物，

sentence: it is very rarely that one comes across a dead body, except, of course, on the roads.
sentencecn: 但是，除非在路上，很少有人遇到这些动物的尸体，

sentence: They decompose and are quickly destroyed by the weather or eaten by some other creature.
sentencecn: 因为它们腐败之后很快就被风化掉，或被别的动物吃掉了。

sentence: It is almost always due to some very special circumstances that traces of land animals survive,
sentencecn: 几乎总是由于某些特殊的条件，陆地动物的遗体才被存下来，

sentence: as by falling into inaccessible caves, or into an ice crevasse,
sentencecn: 如掉进难以到达的洞穴，或掉进冰河裂缝里，

sentence: like the Siberian mammoths,
sentencecn: 或者像西伯利亚长毛象那样掉进冰窟中，

sentence: when the whole animal is sometimes preserved, as in a refrigerator.
sentencecn: 有时整个动物像被放在冰箱里一样被保存下来，

sentence: This is what happened to the famous Beresovka mammoth which was found preserved and in good condition.
sentencecn: 著名的那林索夫卡长毛象就是这样被保存下来的，而且保存得很好。

sentence: In his mouth were the remains of fir trees -- the last meal that he had before he fell into the crevasse and broke his back.
sentencecn: 它嘴里还留着冷杉 -- 它掉进冰河裂隙折断脊椎柱之前的最后一顿饭。

sentence: The mammoth has now been restored in the Palaeontological Museum in St.Petersburg.
sentencecn: 这头长毛象已被修复，现存于圣彼得堡古生物学博物馆。

sentence: Other animals were trapped in tar pits, like the elephants, sabre-toothed cats,
sentencecn: 有的动物掉进天然沥清坑里被保存下来，如在兰桥.拉.布里发现的大象、剑齿虎

sentence: and numerous other creatures that are found at Rancho la Brea, which is now just a suburb of Los Angeles.
sentencecn: 和许多其他动物，现在那里是洛杉矶的郊区。

sentence: Apparently what happened was that water collected on these tar pits
sentencecn: 显然，事情的经过是这样：沥青坑里积存了水，

sentence: and the bigger animals like the elephants ventured out on to the apparently firm surface to drink,
sentencecn: 大象那样的大动物冒险到似乎坚固的水面上去饮水，

sentence: and were promptly bogged in the tar.
sentencecn: 立即掉进了沥青坑。

sentence: And then, when they were dead, the carnivores,
sentencecn: 大象死后，一些食肉动物，

sentence: like the sabretoothed cats and the giant wolves,
sentencecn: 如剑齿虎和大灰狼

sentence: came out to feed and suffered exactly the same fate.
sentencecn: 就来吃大象，结果遭到了同样的命运。

sentence: There are also endless numbers of birds in the tar as well.
sentencecn: 沥青坑里还有无数只鸟的尸体。

sentence: --- Lesson 27 The 'Vasa'
sentencecn: 课文27  “瓦萨”号

sentence: What happened to the 'Vasa' almost immediately after she was launched?
sentencecn: “瓦萨”号下水后几乎立即发生了什么?

sentence: From the seventeenth-century empire of Sweden,
the story of a galleon that sank at the start of her maiden voyage in 1628 must be one of the strangest tales of the sea.
sentencecn: 一艘大帆船在处女航时就沉没了，这个从容不迫7世纪瑞典帝国流传至今的故事无疑是航海史上最离奇的事件之一。

sentence: For nearly three and a half centuries she lay at the bottom of Stockholm harbour until her discovery in 1956.
sentencecn: 这艘大船在斯德哥尔摩港口的海底躺了将近几年来个世纪之后，直到1956年才被发现。

sentence: This was the Vasa, royal flagship of the great imperial fleet.
sentencecn: 这就是“瓦萨”号，帝国大舰的皇家旗舰。

sentence: King Gustavus Adolphus 'The Northern Hurricane',
sentencecn: 当时号称“北方飓风”的国王古斯夫斯.阿道尔弗

sentence: then at the height of his military success in the 'Thirty Years' War,
sentencecn: 正处在“三十年战争”的军事鼎盛阶段，

sentence: had dictated her measurements and armament.
sentencecn: 他亲自规定了这艘船的规模和武器配备。

sentence: Triple gun-decks mounted sixty-four bronze cannon.
sentencecn: 3层的火炮甲板上装着眼点4门青铜加农炮，

sentence: She was intended to play a leading role in the growing might of Sweden.
sentencecn: 目的就是要在不断增长的瑞典势力中起主导作用。

sentence: As she was prepared for her maiden voyage on August 10, 1628, Stockholm was in a ferment.
sentencecn: 1628年8月10日，“瓦萨”号准备首航时，斯德哥尔摩一片欢腾。

sentence: From the Skeppsbron and surrounding islands
sentencecn: 从斯开波斯布朗和周围的岛屿

sentence: the people watched this thing of beauty begin to spread her sails and catch the wind.
sentencecn: 前来的人们观看着这艘美丽的战船扬帆起航，乘风前进。

sentence: They had laboured for three years to produce this floating work of art;
sentencecn: 瑞典人辛辛苦苦干了3年才建成这件水上艺术品，

sentence: she was more richly carved and ornamented than any previous ship.
sentencecn: 它比以往任何船只雕刻得都更加精美，装饰得都更加华丽。

sentence: The high stern castle was a riot of carved gods, demons, knights, kings, warriors,
sentencecn: 高耸的船楼上雕刻了令人眼花缭乱的神仙、妖魔、骑士、国王、武士、

sentence: mermaids, cherubs; and zoomorphic animal shapes ablaze with red and gold and blue,
sentencecn: 美人鱼和小天使，还有用红色、金黄色、蓝色绘制的光彩夺目的兽形图案，

sentence: symbols of courage, power, and cruelty,
sentencecn: 象征着勇敢、力量和残暴，

sentence: were portrayed to stir the imaginations of the superstitious sailors of the day.
sentencecn: 以激起汉时崇尚迷信的水手们的想像。

sentence: Then the cannons of the anchored warships thundered a salute to which the Vasa fired in reply.
sentencecn: 这时，停泊在港口的其他战船向“瓦萨”号鸣炮致礼，“瓦萨”号也鸣炮回礼。

sentence: As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow,
sentencecn: 当“瓦萨”号从弥漫的礼炮烟云中出现时，船头下浪花加溅，

sentence: her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze,
sentencecn: 舰旗迎风招展，三角旗随风飘动，微风鼓起风帆，

sentence: and the red and gold or her superstructure ablaze with colour,
sentencecn: 金碧辉煌的船楼闪耀着灿烂的色彩。

sentence: she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before.
sentencecn: “瓦萨”号展现的壮观景象是斯德哥尔摩人从未见过的。

sentence: All gun-ports were open and the muzzles peeped wickedly from them.
sentencecn: 船上的炮眼开着，炮口虎视眈眈地向外窥视着。

sentence: As the wind freshened there came a sudden squall and the ship made a strange movement, listing to port.
sentencecn: 当风力增强时，突然刮来一阵大风，“瓦萨”号奇怪地摇晃了一下，便向左舷倾斜。

sentence: The Ordnance officer ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard
sentencecn: 炮长命令把左舷上所有大炮搬到右舷上来

sentence: to counteract the list but the steepening angle of the decks increased.
sentencecn: 以抵消船的倾斜，但甲板的倾斜度仍在增加。

sentence: Then the sound of rumbling thunder reached the watchers on the shore,
sentencecn: 岸上的观众听到了雷鸣般的轰响，

sentence: as cargo, ballast, ammunition and 400 people went sliding and crashing down to the port side of the steeply listing ship.
sentencecn: 此时物口、压舱物、弹药和400个人轰地一声滑向陡斜的左舷时。

sentence: The lower gun-ports were now below water and the inrush sealed the ship's fate.
sentencecn: 下层炮眼已淹没在水里，涌进船舱的水给“瓦萨”号带来了难以逃脱的厄运。

sentence: In that first glorious hour, the mighty Vasa, which was intended to rule the Baltic,
sentencecn: 就这样，想要统治波罗的海的大型战舰“瓦萨”号，

sentence: sank with all flags flying -- in the harbour of her birth.
sentencecn: 在它壮丽的起航时刻，带着全身飘扬的彩旗，沉没在了它诞生的港口。

sentence: --- Lesson 33 Education
sentencecn: 课文33  教育

sentence: Why is education democratic in bookless tribal societies?
sentencecn: 为什么教育在没有书籍的部落社会是民主的?

sentence: Education is one of the key words of our time.
sentencecn: 教育是我们这个时代的关键词之一。

sentence: A man without an education, many of us believe,
sentencecn: 我们许多人都相信，一个没有受过教育的人，

sentence: is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances, deprived of one of the greatest twentieth-century opportunities.
sentencecn: 是逆境的牺牲品，被剥夺了20世纪的最优越的机会之一。

sentence: Convinced of the importance of education, modern states 'invest' in institutions of learning to get back 'interest'
sentencecn: 现代国家深深懂得教育的重要性，对教育机构投资，收回的‘利息’

sentence: in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders.
sentencecn: 便是培养出大批有知识的男女青年，这些人可能成为未来的栋梁。

sentence: Education, with its cycles of instruction so carefully worked out,
sentencecn: 教育，以其教学周期如此精心地安排，

sentence: punctuated by textbooks -- those purchasable wells of wisdom -- what would civilization be like without its benefits?
sentencecn: 并以教科书 -- 那些可以买到的智慧源泉 -- 予以强化，如果不受其惠，文明将会是个什么样子呢？

sentence: So much is certain: that we would have doctors and preachers,
sentencecn: 至少，这些是可以肯定的：虽然我们还会有医生和牧师、

sentence: lawyers and defendants marriages and births -- but our spiritual outlook would be different.
sentencecn: 律师和被告、婚姻和生育，但人们的精神面貌将是另一个样子。

sentence: We would lay less stress on 'facts and figures' and more on a good memory,
sentencecn: 人们不会重视‘资料和数据’，而靠好记性、

sentence: on applied psychology, and on the capacity of a man to get along with his fellow-citizens.
sentencecn: 实用心理学与同伴相处的能力。

sentence: If our educational system were fashioned after its bookless past we would have the most democratic form of 'college' imaginable.
sentencecn: 如果我们的教育制度仿效没有书籍的古代教育，我们的学院将具有可以想象得出的最民主的形式了。

sentence: Among tribal people all knowledge inherited by tradition is shared by all;
sentencecn: 在部落中，通过传统继承的知识为所有人共享，并传授给部落中的每一个成员。

sentence: it is taught to every member of the tribe so that in this respect everybody is equally equipped for life.
sentencecn: 从这个意义上讲，人人受到的有关生活本领的教育是相等的。

sentence: It is the ideal condition of the 'equal start' which only our most progressive forms of modern education try to regain.
sentencecn: 这就是我们最进步的现代教育试图恢复的“平等起步”的理想状况。

sentence: In primitive cultures the obligation to seek and to receive the traditional instruction is binding to all.
sentencecn: 在原始文化中，寻求和接受传统教育的义务对全民都有约束力。

sentence: There are no'illiterates' -- if the term can be applied to peoples without a script -- while our own compulsory school attendance became law in Germany in 1642,
sentencecn: 因而没有“文盲”（如果这个字眼儿可以用于没有文字的民族的话）。而我们的义务教育成为法律在德国是在1642年，

sentence: in France in 1806, and in England in 1876 and is still nonexistent in a number of 'civilized' nations.
sentencecn: 在法国是在1806年，在英国是在1876年。

sentence: This shows how long it was before we deemed it necessary to make sure
sentencecn: 这说明，经过了多么漫长的时间之后，我们才认识到，有必要确保

sentence: that all our children could share in the knowledge accumulated by the 'happy few' during the past centuries.
sentencecn: 我们的孩子享有多少个世纪以来由‘少数幸运者’所积累起来的知识。

sentence: Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means.
sentencecn: 荒凉地区的教育不是钱的问题，

sentence: All are entitled to an equal start.
sentencecn: 所有的人都享有平等起步的权利。

sentence: There is none of the hurry which, in our society, often hampers the full development of a growing personality.
sentencecn: 那里没有我们今天社会中的匆忙生活，而匆忙的生活常常妨碍个性的全面发展。

sentence: There, a child grows up under the everpresent attention of his parents;
sentencecn: 荒凉地区的孩子无时无刻不在父母关怀下成长。

sentence: therefore the jungles and the savannahs know of no 'juvenile delinquency'.
sentencecn: 因此，丛林和荒凉地区不知道什么叫“青少年犯罪”。

sentence: No necessity of making a living away from home results in neglect of children, and no father is confronted with his inability to 'buy' an education for his child.
sentencecn: 人们没有必要离家谋生，所以不会产生孩子无人管的问题，也不存在父亲无力为孩子支付教育费用而犯难的问题。

sentence: --- Lesson 39 What every writer wants
sentencecn: 课文39  作家之所需

sentence: How do professional writers ignore what they were taught at school about writing?
sentencecn: 职业作家是如何忽视他们在学校所学的写作知识的?

sentence: I have known very few writers,
sentencecn: 我的认识的作家寥寥无几，

sentence: but those I have known and whom I respect, confess at once that they have little idea where they are going when they first set pen to paper.
sentencecn: 然而凡是我所认识和尊敬的作家，都立即承认在他们动笔时，不清楚要写什么，怎么写。

sentence: They have a character, perhaps two;
sentencecn: 他们心中只在一个或两个角色。

sentence: they are in that condition of eager discomfort which passes for inspiration all admit radical changes of destination once the journey has begun;
sentencecn: 他们处于急切不安的状态，而被当作是灵感。他们无不承认，一旦“旅程”开始，“目的地”常有急剧的变化。

sentence: one, to my certain knowledge, spent nine months on a novel about Kashmir,
sentencecn: 据我所知，有位作家花了9个月的时间写了一部关克什米尔的小说，

sentence: then reset the whole thing in the Scottish Highlands.
sentencecn: 后来却把整个故事背景换成了苏格兰高地。

sentence: I never heard of anyone making a 'skeleton', as we were taught at school.
sentencecn: 我从未听说过任何一位作家像我们在学校那样，

sentence: In the breaking and remaking, in the timing interweaving, beginning afresh,
sentencecn: 在剪裁修改、构思时间、穿插情节、以至从头重写的过程中，

sentence: the writer comes to discern things in his material which were not consciously in his mind when he began.
sentencecn: 作家会领悟到素材中很多东西是他刚动笔时所未意识到的。

sentence: This organic process, often leading to moments of extraordinary self-discovery, is of an indescribable fascination.
sentencecn: 这种有机的加工过程往往达到不寻常自我发现的境界，具有难以言表的构思魅力。

sentence: A blurred image appears; he adds a brushstroke and another and it is gone
sentencecn: 一个朦胧的形象出现在作家的脑海里，他左添一笔，右添一笔，形象反而消逝了；

sentence: but something was there, and he will not rest till he has captured it.
sentencecn: 可是，好像还有什么东西存在着，不把它捕捉到，作家是不会罢休的。

sentence: Sometimes the yeast within a writer outlives a book he has written.
sentencecn: 有时，一个作家一本书写完了，但兴奋仍不消散。

sentence: I have heard of writers who read nothing but their own books;
sentencecn: 我听说一些作家，除了自己的书外，别的书一概不读，

sentence: like adolescents they stand before the mirror,
sentencecn: 犹如希腊神话中那位漂亮的少年，站在镜前，

sentence: and still cannot fathom the exact outline of the vision before them.
sentencecn: 不能辨认自身的真面目。

sentence: For the same reason, writers talk interminably about their own books,
sentencecn: 由于这个原因，作家喋喋不休地谈论自己的书，

sentence: winkling out hidden meanings, super-imposing new ones,
sentencecn: 挖掘其隐晦的含义，

sentence: begging response from those around them.
sentencecn: 询问周围人的反应。

sentence: Of course a writer doing this is misunderstood: he might as well try to explain a crime or a love affair.
sentencecn: 作家如此行事当然被人误解。他还不如给人讲一个犯罪案件或一个恋爱故事。

sentence: He is also, incidentally, an unforgivable bore.
sentencecn: 顺便说一句，他也是个不可饶恕的令人厌烦的人。

sentence: This temptation to cover the distance between himself and the reader,
sentencecn: 这种企图消除自己和读者之间距离的作法，

sentence: to study his image in the sight of those who do not know him, can be his undoing: he has begun to write to please.
sentencecn: 企图用不了解自己的人的观点来研究自己塑造的形象的作法，会导致作家的毁灭，因为他已经开始为取悦他人而写作了。

sentence: A young English writer made the pertinent observation a year or two back
sentencecn: 一两年前，一位年轻的英国作家发表了中肯的看法。

sentence: that the talent goes into the first draft, and the art into the drafts that follow.
sentencecn: 他说，初稿是才华，以后各稿是艺术。

sentence: For this reason also the writer, like any other artist,
sentencecn: 也是由于这个原因，作家同任何艺术家一样，

sentence: has no resting place, no crowd or movement in which he may take comfort,
sentencecn: 找不到可休息的场所，找不到伙伴和活动使自己得到安逸。

sentence: no judgment from outside which can replace the judgment from within.
sentencecn: 任何局外人的判断也比不上他内心的正确判断。

sentence: A writer makes order out of the anarchy of his heart;
sentencecn: 一旦作家从内心的紊乱中理出头绪，

sentence: he submits himself to a more ruthless discipline than any critic dreamed of,
sentencecn: 就应该按任何评论家想像不到的无情规范约束自己写作；

sentence: and when he flirts with fame, he is taking time off from living with himself,
sentencecn: 当他沽名钓誉时，他就脱离了自我生活，

sentence: from the search for what his world contains at its inmost point.
sentencecn: 脱离了对自己灵魂最深处世界的探索。

sentence: --- Lesson 43 Are there strangers in space?
sentencecn: 课文43  宇宙中有外星人吗？

sentence: What does the 'uniquely rational way' for us to communicate with other intelligent beings in space depend on?
sentencecn: 我们与太空中其他智能生物交流的“唯一理性方式”依赖于什么?

sentence: We must conclude from the work of those who have studied the origin of life,
sentencecn: 根据研究生命起源的人们所作的工作，我们必然会得出这样的结论：

sentence: that given a planet only approximately like our own, life is almost certain to start.
sentencecn: 如果设想有一颗行星和我们地球的情况基本相似，那几乎肯定会产生生命。

sentence: Of all the planets in our solar system, we are now pretty certain the Earth is the only one on which life can survive.
sentencecn: 我们目前可以肯定的是，在我们太阳系的所有行星中，地球是生命能存在的唯一行星。

sentence: Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen, Venus far too hot, and so is Mercury,
sentencecn: 火星太干燥又缺氧，金星太热，水星也一样。

sentence: and the outer planets have temperatures near absolute zero and hydrogen-dominated atmospheres.
sentencecn: 除此之外，太阳系的其他行星的温度都接近绝对零度，并围绕着以氢气为主的大气层。

sentence: But other suns, start as the astronomers call them, are bound to have planets like our own, and as is the number of stars in the universe is so vast,
sentencecn: 但是，其他的太阳，既天文学家所说的恒星，肯定会有像我们地球一样的行星。因为宇宙中恒星的数目极其庞大，

sentence: this possibility becomes virtual certainty.
sentencecn: 所以存在着产生生命星球的这种可能性是肯定无疑的。

sentence: There are one hundred thousand million starts in our own Milky Way alone,
sentencecn: 仅我们的银河系就有1000亿颗星，

sentence: and then there are three thousand million other milky ways or galaxies, in the universe.
sentencecn: 况且在宇宙中还有30亿个天河，即银河系。

sentence: so the number of stars that we know exist is now estimated at about 300 million million million.
sentencecn: 因此，我们所知道的现有恒星数目估计约有30亿X1000亿颗。

sentence: Although perhaps only 1 percent of the life that has started somewhere will develop into highly complex and intelligent patterns,
sentencecn: 虽然在已经产生生命的某个地方，可能只有1%会发展成高度复杂有智力的生命形态，

sentence: so vast is the number of planets, that intelligent life is bound to be a natural part of the universe.
sentencecn: 但是行星的数目是那么庞大，有智力的生命必然是宇宙的自然组成道听部分。

sentence: If then we are so certain that other intelligent life exists in the universe, why have we had no visitors from outer space yet?
sentencecn: 既然我们如此坚信宇宙中存在着其他有智力的生命，那么我们为什么还未见到外层空间来访的客人呢？

sentence: First of all, they may have come to this planet of ours thousands or millions of years ago,
sentencecn: 首先，他们可能在几千年前或几百年前已来过我们地球，

sentence: and found our then prevailing primitive state completely uninteresting to their own advanced knowledge.
sentencecn: 并且发现我们地球汉时普遍存在着的原始状态同他们的先进的知识相比是索然无味的。

sentence: Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer,
sentencecn: 美国一位重要的射电天文学家罗纳德.布雷斯韦尔教授

sentence: argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system,
sentencecn: 在《自然》杂志上提出了这样的观点：假如有如此高级文明生命访问了我们的太阳系，

sentence: may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization.
sentencecn: 很可能会在离开太阳系时留下自动化信号装置，等待先进文明的觉醒。

sentence: Such a messenger, receiving our radio and television signals,
sentencecn: 这种自动化信息装置，在接收到我们的无线电和电视信号后，

sentence: might well re-transmit them back to its home-planet,
sentencecn: 完全有可能把这些信号发回到原来的行星。

sentence: although what impression any other civilization would thus get from us is best left unsaid.
sentencecn: 至于其他文明行星对我们地球会有什么印象，还是不说为好。

sentence: But here we come up against the most difficult of all obstacles to contact with people on other planets
sentencecn: 然而，在和外星人联系中我们遇到的最大困难

sentence: -- the astronomical distances which separate us.
sentencecn: 是分隔我们的天文距离。

sentence: As a reasonable guess, they might, on an average, be 100 light years away.
sentencecn: 据合理推算，外星人离我们平均距离也有100光年之远

sentence: (A light year is the distance which light travels at 186,000 miles per second in one year, namely 6 million million miles.)
sentencecn: （1光年是光以每秒186,000英里的速度在一年内走的距离，即6万亿英里）。

sentence: Radio waves also travel at the speed of light,
sentencecn: 无线电波也是以光速传播的。

sentence: and assuming such an automatic messenger picked up our first broadcasts of the 1920's,
sentencecn: 假定外星人的这种自动化信息装置接收了我们二十世纪二十年代的第一次广播信号，

sentence: the message to its home planet is barely halfway there.
sentencecn: 那么这个信号在发回到原来的行星途中刚刚走了一半路程。

sentence: Similarly, our own present primitive chemical rockets,
sentencecn: 同样，我们目前使用的原始化学火箭，

sentence: though good enough to orbit men, have no chance of transporting us to the nearest other star,
sentencecn: 虽然把人送入轨道，但尚不能把我们送到离我们最近、

sentence: four light years away, let alone distances of tens or hundreds of light years.
sentencecn: 相距4光年的其他星球上去，更不用说几十光年或几百光年远的地方了。

sentence: Fortunately, there is a 'uniquely rational way' for us to communicate with other intelligent beings,
sentencecn: 幸运的是，有一种我们可以和其他智力生命通迅联系的“唯一合理的方法”，

sentence: as Walter Sullivan has put it in his excellent book,
sentencecn: 正如活尔特.沙利方在其杰作中阐述的，

sentence: We Are not Alone.
sentencecn: 《我们并不孤独》。

sentence: This depends on the precise radio frequency of the 21-cm wavelength, or 1420 megacycles per second.
sentencecn: 这种通迅联系要靠21厘料波段，即每秒1420兆周的精确无线电频率。

sentence: It is the natural frequency of emission of the hydrogen atoms in space and was discovered by us in 1951;
sentencecn: 这个频率是空间氢原子释放的自然频率，是在1951年被人类发现的。

sentence: it must be known to any kind of radio astronomer in the universe.
sentencecn: 这个频率是宇宙中任何射电天文学家都应该熟悉的。

sentence: Once the existence of this wave-length had been discovered,
sentencecn: 一旦这种波长的实际存在被发现，

sentence: it was not long before its use as the uniquely recognizable broadcasting frequency for interstellar communication was suggested.
sentencecn: 提出把它作为星际间唯一可辨认的广播频率就为期不远了。

sentence: Without something of this kind,
sentencecn: 没有这手段，

sentence: searching for intelligences on other planets would be like trying to meet a friend in London without a pre-arranged rendezvous
sentencecn: 要想寻觅其他星球上的智力生命，就如同去伦敦见一位朋友，事先未约定地点，

sentence: and absurdly wandering the streets in the hope of a chance encounter.
sentencecn: 而荒唐地在街上游逛，以期待碰巧遇上一样。

sentence: --- Lesson 45 Of men and galaxies
sentencecn: 课文45  人和星系

sentence: What is the most influential factor in any human society?
sentencecn: 人类社会中最具影响力的因素是什么?

sentence: In man's early days, competition with other creatures must have been critical.
sentencecn: 在人类早期，人类与其他生物的竞争一定是必不可少的。

sentence: But this phase of our development is now finished.
sentencecn: 但这个发展阶段已经结束。

sentence: Indeed, we lack practice and experience nowadays in dealing with primitive conditions.
sentencecn: 确实，我们今天缺乏对付原始环境的实践和经验。

sentence: I am sure that, without modern weapons,
sentencecn: 我断定，如果没有现代化的武器，

sentence: I would make a very poor show of disputing the ownership of a cave with a bear, and in this I do not think that I stand alone.
sentencecn: 要我和一只熊去争洞穴，我会出洋相的；我也相信，出洋相者并非我一人。

sentence: The last creature to compete with man was the mosquito.
sentencecn: 能与竞争的生物最后只有蚊子，

sentence: But even the mosquito has been subdued by attention to drainage and by chemical sprays.
sentencecn: 然而即使蚊子，也由于我们注意清理污水和喷洒化学药品就被制服了。

sentence: Competition between ourselves, person against person,
sentencecn: 然而人类之间的战争，人与人，

sentence: community against community, still persists, however; and it is as fierce as it ever was.
sentencecn: 团体与团体，依然在进行着，而且和以前一样激烈。

sentence: But the competition of man against man is not the simple process envisioned in biology.
sentencecn: 但是，人与人的竞争并不像生物生物学中想像的那样是一个简单过程。

sentence: It is not a simple competition for a fixed amount of food determined by the physical environment,
sentencecn: 它已不是为了争得物质环境所决定的有限食物而进行的简单竞争了，

sentence: because the environment that determines our evolution is no longer essentially physical.
sentencecn: 因为决定我们进化环境的主要方面已不再是物质。

sentence: Our environment is chiefly conditoned by the things we believe.
sentencecn: 我们的环境主要是由我们所相信的东西所决定。

sentence: Morocco and California are bits of the Earth in very similar latitudes,
sentencecn: 摩洛哥和加利福尼亚是地球上纬度极其相似的两个地方，

sentence: both on the west coasts of continents with similar climates, and probably with rather similar natural resources.
sentencecn: 都在各自大陆的西海岸，气候相似，自然资源也可能相似。

sentence: Yet their present development is wholly different,
sentencecn: 但是，这两个地方目前的发展程度完全不一样。

sentence: not so much because of different people even,
sentencecn: 这倒不是因为人民不同，

sentence: but because of the different thoughts that exist in the minds of their inhabitants.
sentencecn: 而是由于居民头脑中的思想不同。

sentence: This is the point I wish to emphasize.
sentencecn: 这是我要强调的论点。

sentence: The most important factor in our environment is the state of our own minds.
sentencecn: 我们环境中最重要的因素就是我们的思想状况。

sentence: It is well known that where the white man has invaded a primitive culture,
sentencecn: 众所周知，凡是白人侵入原始文化的地方，

sentence: the most destructive effects have come not from physical weapons but from ideas.
sentencecn: 破坏作用最大的不是杀人的武器，而是思想。

sentence: Ideas are dangerous.
sentencecn: 思想是危险的。

sentence: The Holy Office knew this full well when it caused heretics to be burned in days gone by.
sentencecn: 宗教法庭对此是非常清楚的，因此从前它总是把异教徒烧死。

sentence: Indeed, the concept of free speech only exists in our modern society because when you are inside a community,
sentencecn: 的确，言论自由的概念只存在于我们现代社会中，因为当你生活在一个社团中时，

sentence: you are conditioned by the conventions of the community to such a degree that it is very difficult to conceive of anything really destructive.
sentencecn: 社团的风俗习惯会严格地制约你，使你很难有破坏性的想法。

sentence: It is only someone looking on from outside that can inject the dangerous thoughts.
sentencecn: 只有外部的旁观者才能灌输危险的思想。

sentence: I do not doubt that it would be possible to inject ideas into the modern world that would utterly destroy us.
sentencecn: 向现代世界灌输一种思想以便摧毁我们人类是可能的事，对此我并不怀疑。

sentence: I would like to give you an example, but fortunately I cannot do so.
sentencecn: 我愿为你举个例子，但幸亏我举不出。

sentence: Perhaps it will suffice to mention the nuclear bomb.
sentencecn: 也许提一下核弹就足以证明了。

sentence: Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society,
sentencecn: 对一个沿未拥有核弹、但科技相当发达的社会，

sentence: one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying suffcient details to enable the thing to be constructed.
sentencecn: 如果告诉它制造核弹的可能性，而且向它提供制造核弹的细节，那么可以设想，这将对这个社会产生何等的影响。

sentence: 20 or 30 pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925,
sentencecn: 如果把二三十页的情报交给1952年前后的任何一个世界强国，

sentence: would have been sufficient to change the course of world history.
sentencecn: 就足以改变世界历史的进程。

sentence: It is a strange thought, but I believe a correct one,
sentencecn: 这是个离奇的想法。不过我认为这个想法是正确的。

sentence: that twenty or thirty pages of ideas and information would be capable of turning the present-day world upside down, or even destroying it.
sentencecn: 二三十页材料中的思想和情报会便当今的世界翻天覆地，甚至毁灭这个世界。

sentence: I have often tried to conceive of what those pages might contain,
sentencecn: 我常常试图想像这些纸上所写的东西，

sentence: but of course I cannot do so because I am a prisoner of the present-day world, just as all of you are.
sentencecn: 不过我是做不到的，因为我和你们大家一样，是当今世界上的凡人。

sentence: We cannot think outside the particular patterns that our brains are conditioned to, or,
sentencecn: 我们不能脱离我们大脑所限定的模式去问题，

sentence: to be more accurate we can think only a very little way outside and then only if we are very original.
sentencecn: 我们只能稍微离开一点儿，就这也需要我们独创的思想。

sentence: --- lesson 119 A true story
sentencecn: 一个真实的故事

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer this question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Who called out to the thieves in the dark?
sentencecn: 谁在暗处对窃贼喊了一声？

sentence: Do you like stories?
sentencecn: 你喜欢听故事吗？

sentence: I want to tell you a true story.
sentencecn: 我要告诉你一个真实的故事。

sentence: It happened to a friend of mine a year ago.
sentencecn: 这是一年前发生在我的一个朋友身上的故事。

sentence: While my friend, George, was reading in bed, two thieves climbed into his kitchen.
sentencecn: 当我的朋友乔治在床上看书时，两个小偷爬进了他的厨房。

sentence: After they had entered the house, they went into the dining room.
sentencecn: 他们进到屋里后，走进了饭厅。

sentence: It was very dark, so they turned on a torch.
sentencecn: 饭厅里很暗，于是他们打开了手电筒。

sentence: Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them.
sentencecn: 突然他们听到身后有声音。

sentence: What's up? What's up?' someone called.
sentencecn: “什么事？什么事？”有人叫着。

sentence: The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could.
sentencecn: 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

sentence: George heard the noise and came downstairs quickly.
sentencecn: 乔治听到了响声，迅速地下了楼。

sentence: He turned on the light, but he couldn't see anyone.
sentencecn: 他开了灯，但不见一个人。

sentence: The thieves had already gone.
sentencecn: 小偷逃走了。

sentence: But George's parrot, Henry, was still there.
sentencecn: 但是乔治的鹦鹉亨利仍在那里。

sentence: What's up, George?' he called.
sentencecn: “什么事，乔治？”它叫着。

sentence: Nothing, Henry,' George said and smiled.
sentencecn: “没事，亨利。” 乔治笑着说，

sentence: Go back to sleep.
sentencecn: “接着睡觉吧。”

sentence: Isn't this the test?
sentencecn: 这不是那个测试吗？

sentence: Didn't you speak to me about it?
sentencecn: 你不是对我说过它吗？

sentence: Yes, this is the test I spoke to you about.
sentencecn: 是的，这是我和你谈论的那个测试。

sentence: Isn't that the person?
sentencecn: 他不是那个人吗?

sentence: Didn't you speak to him?
sentencecn: 你不是与他说过话吗？

sentence: Yes, that's the person I spoke to.
sentencecn: 是的，那是和我说话的那个人。

sentence: Isn't she the girl?

sentence: Didn't you ask me about her?
sentencecn: 你不是向我问过她吗？

sentence: Yes, she's the girl I asked you about.

sentencecn: 它们不是那些照片吗？

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.

sentence: Why did the writer complain to the people behind him?

sentence: I had a very good seat.

sentence: The play was very interesting.

sentence: A young man and a young woman were sitting behind me. They were talking loudly.
sentencecn: 一青年男子与一青年女子坐在我的身后，大声地说着话。

sentence: I got very angry.

sentence: I could not hear the actors.
sentencecn: 因为我听不见演员在说什么。

sentence: I turned round. I looked at the man and the woman angrily.
sentencecn: 我回过头去怒视着那一男一女，

sentence: They did not pay any attention.

sentence: In the end, I could not bear it.

sentence: I can't hear a word!' I said angrily.

sentence: --- Lesson 7 Too late
sentencecn: 为时太晚

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: Did the detectives save the diamonds?
sentencecn: 侦探们救下了所有的钻石吗？

sentence: The plane was late and detectives were waiting at the airport all morning.
sentencecn: 飞机误点了，侦探们在机场等了整整一上午。

sentence: They were expecting a valuable parcel of diamonds from South Africa.
sentencecn: 他们正期待从南非来的一个装着钻石的贵重包裹。

sentence: A few hours earlier, someone had told the police that thieves would try to steal the diamonds.
sentencecn: 数小时以前，有人向警方报告，说有人企图偷走这些钻石。

sentence: When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield.
sentencecn: 当飞机到达时，一些侦探等候在主楼内，另一些侦探则守候在停机坪上。

sentence: Two men took the parcel off the plane and carried it into the Customs House.
sentencecn: 有两个人把包裹拿下飞机，进了海关。

sentence: While two detectives were keeping guard at the door, two others opened the parcel.
sentencecn: 这时两个侦探把住门口，另外两个侦探打开了包裹。

sentence: To their surprise, the precious parcel was full of stones and sand!
sentencecn: 令他们吃惊的是，那珍贵的包裹里面装的全是石头和沙子！

sentence: --- Lesson 13 The Greenwood Boys
sentencecn: 绿林少年

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: Why will the police have a difficult time?
sentencecn: 为什么警察的日子会不好过?

sentence: The Greenwood Boys are a group of pop singers.
sentencecn: “绿林少年”是一个流行歌曲演唱团。

sentence: At present, they are visiting all parts of the country.
sentencecn: 目前他们正在全国各地巡回演出，

sentence: They will be arriving here tomorrow.
sentencecn: 明天就要到达此地。

sentence: They will be coming by train and most of the young people in the town will be meeting them at the station.
sentencecn: 他们将乘火车来，镇上的大部分青年人将到车站迎接他们。

sentence: Tomorrow evening they will be singing at the Workers' Club.
sentencecn: 明晚他们将在工人俱乐部演出。

sentence: The Greenwood Boys will be staying for five days.
sentencecn: “绿林少年”准备在此逗留5天。

sentence: During this time, they will give five performances.
sentencecn: 在此期间，他们将演出5场。

sentence: As usual, the police will have a difficult time.
sentencecn: 同往常一样，警察的日子将不好过，

sentence: They will be trying to keep order.
sentencecn: 他们将设法维持秩序。

sentence: It is always the same on these occasions.
sentencecn: 每逢这种场合，情况都是这样。

sentence: --- Lesson 21 Mad or not?
sentencecn: 是不是疯了？

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.

sentence: Why do people think the writer is mad?
sentencecn: 为什么人们认为作者疯了？

sentence: Aeroplanes are slowly driving me mad.
sentencecn: 飞机正在逐渐把我逼疯。

sentence: I live near an airport and passing planes can be heard night and day.
sentencecn: 我住在一个机场附近，过往飞机日夜不绝于耳。

sentence: The airport was built years ago, but for some reason it could not be used then.
sentencecn: 机场是许多年前建的，但由于某种原因当时未能启用。

sentence: Last year, however, it came into use.
sentencecn: 然而去年机场开始使用了。

sentence: Over a hundred people must have been driven away from their homes by the noise.
sentencecn: 有100多人肯定是被噪音逼得已经弃家远去，

sentence: I am one of the few people left.
sentencecn: 我是少数留下来的人中的一个。

sentence: Sometimes I think this house will be knocked down by a passing plane.
sentencecn: 有时我觉得这房子就要被一架飞过的飞机撞倒。

sentence: I have been offered a large sum of money to go away, but I am determined to stay here.
sentencecn: 他们曾向我提供一大笔钱让我搬走，但我决定留在这儿。

sentence: Everybody says I must be mad and they are probably right.
sentencecn: 大家都说我肯定是疯了，也许他们说的是对的。

sentence: --- Lesson 28 No parking

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.

sentence: What is Jasper White's problem?

sentence: Jasper White is one of those rare people who believes in ancient myths.
sentencecn: 贾斯珀.怀特是少有的相信古代神话的人之一。

sentence: he has just bought a new house in the city,
sentencecn: 他刚在城里买下一所新房子，

sentence: but ever since he moved in, he has had trouble with cars and their owners.
sentencecn: 但自从搬进去后，就和汽车及车主们发生了摩擦。

sentence: When he returns home at night, he always finds that someone has parked a car outside his gate.

sentence: Because of this, he has not been able to get his own car into his garage even once.

sentence: Jasper has put up 'No Parking' signs outside his gate, but these have not had any effect.
sentencecn: 贾斯珀曾把几块“禁止停车”的牌子挂在大门外边，但没有任何效果。

sentence: Now he has put an ugly stone head over the gate.
sentencecn: 现在他把一个丑陋的石雕头像放在了大门上边，

sentence: It is one of the ugliest faces I have ever seen.
sentencecn: 这是我见过的最丑陋的头像之一。

sentence: I asked him what it was and he told me that it was Medusa, the Gorgon.
sentencecn: 我问他那是什么？他告诉我那是蛇发女怪美杜莎。

sentence: jasper hopes that she will turn cars and their owners to stone.
sentencecn: 贾斯珀希望她把汽车和车主们都变成石头。

sentence: But none of them has been turned to stone yet!
sentencecn: 但到目前为止还没有一个变成石头呢！

sentence: --- Lesson 36 Across the Channel
sentencecn: 横渡海峡

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What is Debbie going to try to do?
sentencecn: 黛比准备做什么?

sentence: Debbie Hart is going to swim across the English Channel tomorrow.
sentencecn: 黛比.哈特准备明天横渡英吉利海峡。

sentence: She is going to set out from the French coast at five o'clock in the morning.
sentencecn: 她打算早上5点钟从法国海岸出发。

sentence: Debbie is only eleven years old and she hopes to set up a new world record.
sentencecn: 黛比只有11岁，她希望创一项新的世界纪录。

sentence: She is a strong swimmer and many people feel that she is sure to succeed.
sentencecn: 她是一个游泳能手，很多人认为她一定能成功。

sentence: Debbie's father will set out with her in a small boat.
sentencecn: 黛比的父亲将乘一条小船同她一道出发。

sentence: Mr.Hart has trained his daughter for years.
sentencecn: 哈特先生训练她的女儿已经多年了，

sentence: Tomorrow he will be watching her anxiously as she swims the long distance to England.
sentencecn: 明天他将焦急地注视着女儿游过这段漫长的距离到达英国。

sentence: Debbie intends to take short rests every two hours.
sentencecn: 黛比计划每两小时休息一下。

sentence: She will have something to drink but she will not eat any solid food.
sentencecn: 她将喝些饮料，但不吃固体食物。

sentence: Most of Debbie's school friends will be waiting for her on the English coast.
sentencecn: 黛比的大部分同学将在英国海岸等候她。

sentence: Among them will be Debbie's mother, who swam the Channel herself when she was a girl.
sentencecn: 他们当中还会有黛比的母亲，她本人还是个姑娘时，也曾横渡过英吉利海峡！

sentence: --- Lesson 42 Not very musical

sentence: What happened when the snake charmer began to play jazz?
sentencecn: 当耍蛇人开始玩爵士时发生了什么?

sentence: As we had had a long walk through one of the markets of old Delhi, we stopped at a square to have a rest.
sentencecn: 当我们穿过旧德里的市场时走了很长一段路，我们在一个广场上停下来休息。

sentence: After a time, we noticed a snake charmer with two large baskets at the other side of the square, so we went to have a look at him.
sentencecn: 过了一会儿，我们注意到广场的那一边有一个带着两个大筐的耍蛇人，于是就走过去看看。

sentence: As soon as he saw us, he picked up a long pipe which was covered with coins and opened one of the baskets.
sentencecn: 他一见我们，就拿起了一个长长的上面镶有硬币的管乐器，并掀开了一个筐的盖子。

sentence: When he began to play a tune, we had our first glimpse of the snake.
sentencecn: 当他开始吹奏一支曲子时，我们才第一次看到那条蛇。

sentence: It rose out of the basket and began to follow the movements of the pipe.
sentencecn: 它从筐里探出身子，随着乐器的摆动而扭动。

sentence: We were very much surprised when the snake charmer suddenly began to play jazz and modern pop songs.
sentencecn: 当耍蛇人突然又吹奏起爵士乐和现代流行乐曲时，

sentence: The snake, however, continued to 'dance' slowly.
sentencecn: 我们感到非常惊奇。然而那蛇却还是缓慢地“舞动”着。

sentence: It obviously could not tell the difference between Indian music and jazz!
sentencecn: 显然，它分辨不出印度音乐和爵士乐！

sentence: --- Lesson 52 A pretty carpet
sentencecn: 漂亮的地毯

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What is the writer's carpet made of?
sentencecn: 作者的地毯是用什么制成的？

sentence: We have just moved into a new house and I have been working hard all morning.
sentencecn: 我们刚刚搬进一所新房子，我辛辛苦苦地干了整整一个上午。

sentence: I have been trying to get my new room in order.
sentencecn: 我试图把我的新房间收拾整齐，

sentence: This has not been easy because I own over a thousand books.
sentencecn: 但这并不容易，因为我有1,000多本书。

sentence: To make matters worse, the room is rather small, so I have temporarily put my books on the floor.
sentencecn: 更糟糕的是房间还非常小，所以我暂时把书放在了地板上。

sentence: At the moment, they cover every inch of floor space and I actually have to walk on them to get in or out of the room.
sentencecn: 这会儿，书把地板的每一点空隙都占据了，我实际上是踩着这些书进出房间的。

sentence: A short while ago, my sister helped me to carry one of my old bookcases up the stairs.
sentencecn: 几分钟前，我妹妹帮我把一个旧书橱抬上了楼。

sentence: She went into my room and got a big surprise when she saw all those books on the floor.
sentencecn: 她走进我的房间，当她看到地板上的那些书时，大吃一惊。“

sentence: This is the prettiest carpet I have ever seen,' she said.
sentencecn: 这是我见过的最漂亮的地毯，”她说。

sentence: She gazed at it for some time then added,
sentencecn: 她盯着“地毯”看了一会儿，又说：

sentence: You don't need bookcases at all. You can sit here in your spare time and read the carpet!
sentencecn: “你根本用不着书橱，空闲时你可以坐在这儿读地毯！”

sentence: --- Lesson 59 In or out?
sentencecn: 进来还是出去？

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: Why did Rex run away?
sentencecn: 为什么雷克斯跑开了？

sentence: Our dog, Rex, used to sit outside our front gate and bark.
sentencecn: 我家的狗雷克斯，过去常坐在大门外面叫。

sentence: Every time he wanted to come into the garden he would bark until someone opened the gate.
sentencecn: 每当它想到花园里来时，便汪汪叫个不停，直到有人把门打开。

sentence: As the neighbours complained of the noise,
sentencecn: 由于邻居们对狗叫很有意见，

sentence: my husband spent weeks training him to press his paw on the latch to let himself in.
sentencecn: 所以我丈夫花了几个星期的时间训练它用脚爪按住门闩把自己放进来。

sentence: Rex soon became an expert at opening the gate.
sentencecn: 雷克斯很快成了开门的专家。

sentence: However, when I was going out shopping last week, I noticed him in the garden near the gate.
sentencecn: 然而上星期我正要出去买东西时，发现它正呆在花园里边靠门的地方。

sentence: This time he was barking so that someone would let him out!
sentencecn: 这次它叫着让人把它放出去！

sentence: Since then, he has developed another bad habit.
sentencecn: 从那以后，它养成了另外一种坏习惯。

sentence: As soon as he opens the gate from the outside, he comes into the garden and waits until the gate shuts.
sentencecn: 它从外面把门一打开，就走进花园，等着门自动关上。

sentence: Then he sits and barks until someone lets him out.
sentencecn: 这之后他就坐下汪汪叫起来，直到有人来把它放出去。

sentence: After this he immediately lets himself in and begins barking again.
sentencecn: 出去之后，它又马上把自己放进来，接着再开始叫。

sentence: Yesterday my husband removed the gate and Rex got so annoyed we have not seen him since.
sentencecn: 昨天，我丈夫把大门卸了下来，雷克斯很生气，此后我们便再也没有见到它。

sentence: --- Lesson 68 Persistent
sentencecn: 纠缠不休

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: Why did Elizabeth tell Nigel that she was going to the dentist?
sentencecn: 伊丽莎白为什么要告诉奈杰尔她要去看牙医？

sentence: I crossed the street to avoid meeting him, but he saw me and came running towards me.
sentencecn: 我穿过马路以便避开他，但他看到我并朝我跑过来。

sentence: It was no use pretending that I had not seen him, so I waved to him.
sentencecn: 若再装作没看见他已是没有用了，我只好向他招手。

sentence: I never enjoy meeting Nigel Dykes.
sentencecn: 我就怕遇到奈杰尔.戴克斯。

sentence: He never has anything to do.
sentencecn: 他从来都是无事可做，

sentence: No matter how busy you are, he always insists on coming with you.
sentencecn: 不管你多忙，他总是坚持要跟你去。

sentence: I had to think of a way of preventing him from following me around all morning.
sentencecn: 我得想办法不让他整个上午缠着我。

sentence: Hello, Nigel,' I said. 'Fancy meeting you here!
sentencecn: “你好，奈杰尔，想不到在这儿见到你。”我说。

sentence: Hi, Elizabeth,' Nigel answered.
sentencecn: “你好，伊丽莎白，”奈杰尔回答说，

sentence: I was just wondering how to spend the morning -- until I saw you. You're not busy doing anything, are you?
sentencecn: “我正不知道怎么消磨这一上午呢，正好见到好。你不忙，是吗？”

sentence: No, not at all,' I answered. 'I'm going to...
sentencecn: “不，不忙，我打算去......”我回答。

sentence: Would you mind my coming with you?' he asked, before I had finished speaking.
sentencecn: “我跟你一道去行吗？”没等我说完话他就问道。

sentence: Not at all,' I lied, 'but I'm going to the dentist.
sentencecn: “没关系，但我准备去牙医那里。”我说了个谎。

sentence: Then I'll come with you,' he answered. 'There's always plenty to read in the waiting room!
sentencecn: “那我也跟你去，候诊室里总有很多东西可供阅读！”他回答。

sentence: --- Lesson 74 Out of the limelight
sentencecn: 舞台之外

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: Why was their disguise 'too perfect'?
sentencecn: 为什么他们的伪装“太完美了”？

sentence: An ancient bus stopped by a dry river bed and a party of famous actors and actresses got off.
sentencecn: 一辆古旧的汽车停在一条干涸的河床边，一群著名男女演员下了车。

sentence: Dressed in dark glasses and old clothes, they had taken special precautions so that no one should recognize them.
sentencecn: 他们戴着墨镜，穿着旧衣裳，特别小心以防别人认出他们。

sentence: But as they soon discovered, disguises can sometimes be too perfect.
sentencecn: 但他们很快就发觉，化装的效果有时过分完美了。

sentence: This is a wonderful place for a picnic,' said Gloria Gleam.
sentencecn: “在这个地方野餐简直太妙了，”格格利亚.格利姆说。

sentence: It couldn't be better, Gloria,' Brinksley Meers agreed.
sentencecn: “是再好不过的了，格格利亚。”布林克斯利.米尔斯表示同意，

sentence: No newspaper men, no film fans! Why don't we come more often?
sentencecn: “没有记者，没有影迷！我们为什么不经常来这里呢？”

sentence: Meanwhile, two other actors, Rockwall Slinger and Merlin Greeves, had carried two large food baskets to a shady spot under some trees.
sentencecn: 此时，另外两位演员，罗克沃尔.斯林格和默林.格里夫斯，已经把两个大食品篮子提到了一片树荫下。

sentence: When they had all made themselves comfortable, a stranger appeared.
sentencecn: 当他们都已安排舒适时，一个陌生人出现了。

sentence: He looked very angry.
sentencecn: 他看上去非常气愤。

sentence: Now you get out of here, all of you!' he shouted.
sentencecn: “你们都从这里走开，全都走开！”他大叫着，

sentence: "I'm sheriff here. Do you see that notice? It says "No Camping" -- in case you can't read!"
sentencecn: “我是这里的司法长官。你们看到那个布告牌了吗？上面写着‘禁止野营’－－除非你们不识字！”

sentence: Look, sheriff,' said Rockwall, 'don't be too hard on us.
sentencecn: “好了，好了，司法官，”罗克沃尔说， “别使我们难堪。

sentence: I'm Rockwall Slinger and this is Merlin Greeves.
sentencecn: 我是罗克沃尔.斯林格，这位是默林.格里夫斯。”

sentence: Oh, is it?' said the sheriff with a sneer.
sentencecn: “噢，是吗？”那位司法长官冷笑一声说道，

sentence: Well, I'm Brinksley Meers, and my other name is Gloria Gleam.
sentencecn: “好，我就是布林克斯利.米尔斯。我还有一个名字叫格格利亚.格利姆。

sentence: Now you get out of here fast!
sentencecn: 现在你们赶快滚吧！”

sentence: --- Lesson 80 The Crystal Palace
sentencecn: 水晶宫

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: How many people visited the Great Exhibition of 1851?
sentencecn: 有多少人参观了1851年的世界博览会？

sentence: Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace,
sentencecn: 19世纪最不寻常的建筑也许要数水晶宫了，

sentence: which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851.
sentencecn: 它是为1851年的“世界博览会”而建在海德公园的。

sentence: The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass.
sentencecn: 这座水晶宫不同于世界上所有的其他建筑，因为它是用钢和玻璃建成的。

sentence: It was one of the biggest buildings of all time and a lot of people from many countries came to see it.
sentencecn: 它是有史以来最高大的建筑物之一，因此，人们从各个国家纷纷前来参观。

sentence: A great many goods were sent to the exhibition from various parts of the world.
sentencecn: 大量的商品从世界各地运送到了博览会，

sentence: There was also a great deal of machinery on display.
sentencecn: 参展的还有很多机器，

sentence: The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Nasmyth's steam hammer.
sentencecn: 其中最奇妙的是内史密斯的蒸汽锤。

sentence: Though in those days, travelling was not as easy as it is today, steam boats carried thousands of visitors across the Channel from Europe.
sentencecn: 尽管在当时旅行不像现在这么容易，但汽船还是把成千上万的参观者从欧洲大陆送过了英吉利海峡。

sentence: On arriving in England, they were taken to the Crystal Palace by train.
sentencecn: 一到英国，火车就把他们送到了水晶宫。

sentence: There were six million visitors in all, and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges.
sentencecn: 参观的人数总共是600万。博览会的赢利用来建造博物馆和高等学校。

sentence: Later, the Crystal Palace was moved to South London.
sentencecn: 后来，“水晶宫”被移到了伦敦南部。

sentence: It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936.
sentencecn: 在1936年被焚毁之前，它一直是世界上最著名的建筑物之一。

sentence: --- Lesson 87 A perfect alibi
sentencecn: 极好的不在犯罪现场的证据

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What was wrong with the man's story?
sentencecn: 那个男人说的有问题吗？

sentence: At the time the murder was committed, I was travelling on the 8 o'clock train to London,' said the man.
sentencecn: “在凶杀发生的时候，我正坐在8点钟开往伦敦的火车上。”那人说。

sentence: Do you always catch such an early train?' asked the inspector.
sentencecn: “您总是赶这样早的火车？”探长问。

sentence: Of course I do,' answered the man. 'I must be at work at 10 o'clock. My employer will confirm that I was there on time.
sentencecn: “当然是的，”那人回答。“我必须在10点钟上班，我的雇主会证明我是按时到了那儿的。”

sentence: Would a later train get you to work on time?' asked the inspector.
sentencecn: “晚一点儿的车也能送您按时上班吗？”

sentence: I suppose it would, but I never catch a later train.
sentencecn: “我认为可以，但我从来不乘晚一点儿的车。”

sentence: At what time did you arrive at the station?
sentencecn: “您几点钟到的火车站？”

sentence: At ten to eight. I bought a paper and waited for the train.
sentencecn: “7点50分。我买了张报纸，等着车来。”

sentence: And you didn't notice anything unusual?
sentencecn: “您没有注意到有什么异常情况发生吗？”

sentence: Of course not.
sentencecn: “当然没有。”

sentence: I suggest,' said the inspector,
sentencecn: “我提醒您，”探长说，

sentence: that you are not telling the truth.
sentencecn: “您讲的不是实话。

sentence: I suggest that you did not catch the 8 o'clock train, but that you caught the 8.25 which would still get you to work on time.
sentencecn: 您乘的不是8点钟的火车，而是8点25分的，这次车同样能使您按时上班。

sentence: You see, on the morning of the murder, the 8 o'clock train did not run at all.
sentencecn: 您看，在凶杀发生的那天早晨，8点钟的那次车根本没有发。

sentence: It broke down at Ferngreen station and was taken off the line.
sentencecn: 它在芬格林车站出了故障而被取消了。”

sentence: --- Lesson 94 Future champions
sentencecn: 未来的冠军

sentence: First listen and then answer the question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What kind of race do the children compete in?
sentencecn: 孩子们参加什么样的比赛？

sentence: Experiments have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age.
sentencecn: 实验证明，儿童在很小的时候就可以开始学习游泳。

sentence: At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles,
sentencecn: 在洛杉矶的一个特设的游泳池里，

sentence: children become expert at holding their breath under water even before they can walk.
sentencecn: 孩子们甚至在还没有学会走路时就已经能熟练地在水下屏住呼吸了。

sentence: Babies of two months old do not appear to be reluctant to enter the water.
sentencecn: 两个月的婴儿并未显得不愿意入水。

sentence: It is not long before they are so accustomed to swimming that they can pick up weights from the floor of the pool.
sentencecn: 他们很快便适应了游泳，以致能捡起池底的物品。

sentence: A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race.
sentencecn: 这些幼小的游泳运动员非常喜爱的一种游戏是水下三轮车比赛。

sentence: Tricycles are lined up on the floor of the pool seven feet under water.
sentencecn: 三轮车并排放在7英尺深的游泳池底上。

sentence: The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool.
sentencecn: 孩子们比赛看谁先到达游泳池的另一端。

sentence: Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them.
sentencecn: 很多孩子用脚蹬车，但多数孩子更愿意推或是拉着三轮车。

sentence: Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once.
sentencecn: 有些孩子能够跑完游泳池的全长而不用露出水面换气。

sentence: Whether they will ever become future Olympic champions, only time will tell.
sentencecn: 他们将来是否能成为奥林匹克的冠军，这只能由时间来作出回答。

sentence: Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air.
sentencecn: 与此同时，他们对我们中的那些游不了5码就已喘不过气来的人应该是种鼓舞。

sentence: --- lesson 5 The facts
sentencecn: 确切数字

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What was the consequence of the editor's insistence on facts and statistics?
sentencecn: 编辑坚持事实和统计数字的结果是什么?

sentence: Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics.
sentencecn: 报刊杂志的编辑常常为了向读者提供成立一些关紧要的事实和统计数字而走向极端。

sentence: Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president's palace in a new African republic.
sentencecn: 去年，一位记者受一家有名的杂志的委托写一篇关于非洲某个新成立共和国总统府的文章。

sentence: When the article arrived, the editor read the first Sentence and then refused to publish it.
sentencecn: 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

sentence: The article began: 'Hundreds of steps lead to the high wall which surrounds the president's palace'.
sentencecn: 文章的开头是这样的：“几百级台阶通向环绕总统的高墙。”

sentence: The editor at once sent the journalist a fax instructing him to find out the exact number of steps and the height of the wall.
sentencecn: 编辑立即给那位记者发去传真，要求他核实一下台阶的确切数字和围墙的高度。

sentence: The journalist immediately set out to obtain these important facts,
sentencecn: 记者立即出发去核实这些重要的事实，

sentence: but he took a long time to send them. Meanwhile, the editor was getting impatient, for the magazine would soon go to press.
sentencecn: 但过了好长时间不见他把数字寄来，在此期间，编辑等得不耐烦了，因为杂志马上要付印。

sentence: He sent the journalist two more faxes, but received no reply.
sentencecn: 他给记者先后发去两份传真，但对方毫无反应。

sentence: He sent yet another fax informing the journalist that if he did not reply soon he would be fired.
sentencecn: 于是他又发了一份传真，通知那位记者说，若再不迅速答复，将被解雇。

sentence: When the journalist again failed to reply, the editor reluctantly published the article as it had originally been written.
sentencecn: 但记者还是没有回复。编辑无奈，勉强按原样发稿了。

sentence: A week later, the editor at last received a fax from the journalist.
sentencecn: 一周之后，编辑终于接到了记者的传真。

sentence: Not only had the poor man been arrested, but he had been sent to prison as well.
sentencecn: 那个可怜的记者不仅被捕了，而且还被送进了监狱。

sentence: However, he had at last been allowed to send a fax in which he informed the editor
sentencecn: 不过，他终于获准发回了一份传真。在传真中他告诉编辑，

sentence: that he had been arrested while counting the 1,084 steps leading to the fifteen-foot wall which surrounded the president's palace.
sentencecn: 就在他数通向15英尺高的总统府围墙的1，084级台阶时，被抓了起来。

sentence: --- lesson 13 'It's only me
sentencecn: “是我，别害怕”

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What did the man expect to find under the stairs?
sentencecn: 这个男人想在楼梯下发现什么?

sentence: After her husband had gone to work, Mrs. Richards sent her children to school and went upstairs to her bedroom.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人等丈夫上班走后，把孩子送去上学，然后来到楼上自己的卧室。

sentence: She was too excited to do any housework that morning, for in the evening she would be going to a fancy-dress party with her husband.
sentencecn: 那天上午，她兴奋得什么家务活都不想做，因为晚上她要同丈夫一起参加一个化装舞会。

sentence: She intended to dress up as a ghost and as she had made her costume the night before, she was impatient to try it on.
sentencecn: 她打算装扮成鬼的模样。头天晚上她已把化装服做好，这时她急于想试试。

sentence: Though the costume consisted only of a sheet, it was very effective.
sentencecn: 尽管化装服仅由一个被单制成，却十分逼真。

sentence: After putting it on, Mrs. Richards went downstairs.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人穿上化装服后下了楼，

sentence: She wanted to find out whether it would be comfortable to wear.
sentencecn: 想看穿起来是否舒服。

sentence: Just as Mrs. Richards was entering the dining room, there was a knock on the front door.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人刚刚走进餐厅，前门就传来敲门声。

sentence: She knew that it must be the baker.
sentencecn: 她知道来人一定是面包师。

sentence: She had told him to come straight in if ever she failed to open the door and to leave the bread on the kitchen table.
sentencecn: 她曾告诉过面包师，如果她不去开门，他可直接进门，把面包放在厨房的桌上。

sentence: Not wanting to frighten the poor man, Mrs. Richards quickly hid in the small storeroom under the stairs.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人不想吓唬这个可怜人，便赶紧躲到了楼梯下的小储藏室里。

sentence: She heard the front door open and heavy footsteps in the hall.
sentencecn: 她听见前门被打开，走廊里响起了重重的脚步声。

sentence: Suddenly the door of the storeroom was opened and a man entered.
sentencecn: 突然贮藏室门开了，一个男人走了进来。

sentence: Mrs. Richards realized that it must be the man from the Electricity Board who had come to read the meter.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人这才想到一定是供电局来人查电表了。

sentence: She tried to explain the situation, saying 'It's only me, but it was too late.
sentencecn: 她说了声“是我，别怕！”然后想进行一番解释，但已来不及了。

sentence: The man let out a cry and jumped back several paces.
sentencecn: 那人大叫了一声，惊退了几步。

sentence: When Mrs. Richards walked towards him, he fled, slamming the door behind him.
sentencecn: 理查兹夫人朝他走去，只见他“砰”的一声关上门逃走了。

sentence: --- lesson 15 Fifty pence worth of trouble
sentencecn: 五十便士的麻烦

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Did George get anything for his fifty pence? What?
sentencecn: 乔治五十便士买到东西了吗?买到了什么?

sentence: Children always appreciate small gifts of money.
sentencecn: 孩子们总是喜欢得到一些零花钱。

sentence: Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income.
sentencecn: 爸爸妈妈当然经常会给孩子零花钱，但是，叔舅婶姨也是孩子们额外收入的来源。

sentence: With some children, small sums go a long way.
sentencecn: 对于有些孩子来说，少量的钱可以花很长一段时间。

sentence: If fifty pence pieces are not exchanged for sweets, they rattle for months inside money boxes.
sentencecn: 如果50便士不拿来换糖吃，则可以放在储蓄罐里叮当响上好几月。

sentence: Only very thrifty children manage to fill up a money box.
sentencecn: 但是能把储蓄罐装满的只有屈指可数的几个特别节俭的孩子。

sentence: For most of them, fifty pence is a small price to pay for a nice big bar of chocolate.
sentencecn: 对大部分孩子来说，用50便士来买一大块好的巧克力，是算不了什么的。

sentence: My nephew, George, has a money box but it is always empty.
sentencecn: 我的外甥乔治有一个储蓄罐，但总是空空的。

sentence: Very few of the fifty pence pieces and pound coins I have given him have found their way there.
sentencecn: 我给了他不少50便士的硬币，但没有几个存到储蓄罐里。

sentence: I gave him fifty pence yesterday and advised him to save it.
sentencecn: 昨天，我给了他50便士让他存起来，

sentence: Instead he bought himself fifty pence worth of trouble.
sentencecn: 他却拿这钱给自己买了50便士的麻烦。

sentence: On his way to the sweet shop, he dropped his fifty pence and it bounced along the pavement and then disappeared down a drain.
sentencecn: 在他去糖果店的路上，50便士掉在地上，在人行道上跳了几下，掉进了阴沟里。

sentence: George took off his jacket, rolled up his sleeves and pushed his right arm through the drain cover.
sentencecn: 乔治脱掉外套，卷起袖子，将右胳膊伸进了阴沟盖。

sentence: He could not find his fifty pence piece anywhere, and what is more, he could not get his arm out.
sentencecn: 但他摸了半天也没找到那50便士硬币，他的胳膊反倒退不出来了。

sentence: A crowd of people gathered round him and a lady rubbed his arm with soap and butter, but George was firmly stuck.
sentencecn: 这时在他周围围上了许多人，一位女士在乔治胳膊上抹了肥皂、黄油，但乔治的胳膊仍然卡得紧紧的。

sentence: The fire brigade was called and two fire fighters freed George using a special type of grease.
sentencecn: 有人打电话叫来消防队，两位消防队员使用了一种特殊的润滑剂才使乔治得以解脱。

sentence: George was not too upset by his experience
sentencecn: 不过，此事并没使乔治过于伤心，

sentence: because the lady who owns the sweet shop heard about his troubles and rewarded him with a large box of chocolates.
sentencecn: 因为糖果店老板娘听说了他遇到的麻烦后，赏给他一大盒巧克力。

sentence: --- lesson 22 By heart
sentencecn: 熟记台词

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Which actor read the letter in the end, the aristocrat or the gaoler?
sentencecn: 哪个演员最后读了这封信，贵族还是狱卒?

sentence: Some plays are so successful that they run for years on end.
sentencecn: 有些剧目十分成功，以致连续上演好几年。

sentence: In many ways, this is unfortunate for the poor actors who are required to go on repeating the same lines night after night.
sentencecn: 这样一来，可怜的演员们可倒霉了。因为他们需要一夜连着一夜地重复同样的台词。

sentence: One would expect them to know their parts by heart and never have cause to falter.
sentencecn: 人们以为，这些演员一定会把台词背得烂熟，绝不会临场结巴的，

sentence: Yet this is not always the case.
sentencecn: 但情况却并不总是这样。
