sentence: A famous actor in a highly successful play was once cast in the role of an aristocrat who had been imprisoned in the Bastille for twenty years.
sentencecn: 有一位名演员曾在一出极为成功的剧目中扮演一个贵族角色，这个贵族已在巴士底狱被关押了20年。

sentence: In the last act, a gaoler would always come on to the stage with a letter which he would hand to the prisoner.
sentencecn: 在最后一幕中，狱卒手持一封信上场，然后将信交给狱中那位贵族。

sentence: Even though the noble was expected to read the letter at each performance,
sentencecn: 尽管那个贵族每场戏都得念一遍那封信。

sentence: he always insisted that it should be written out in full.
sentencecn: 但他还是坚持要求将信的全文写在信纸上。

sentence: One night, the gaoler decided to play a joke on his colleague to find out if,
sentencecn: 一天晚上，狱卒决定与他的同事开一个玩笑，

sentence: after so many performances, he had managed to learn the contents of the letter by heart.
sentencecn: 看看他反复演出这么多场之后，是否已将信的内容记熟了。

sentence: The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell.
sentencecn: 大幕拉开，最后一幕戏开演，贵族独自一人坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房里。

sentence: Just then, the gaoler appeared with the precious letter in his bands.
sentencecn: 这时狱卒上场，手里拿着那封珍贵的信。

sentence: He entered the cell and presented the letter to the aristocrat.
sentencecn: 狱卒走进牢房，将信交给贵族。

sentence: But the copy he gave him had not been written out in full as usual.
sentencecn: 但这回狱卒给贵族的信没有像往常那样把全文写全，

sentence: It was simply a blank sheet of paper.
sentencecn: 而是一张白纸。

sentence: The gaoler looked on eagerly, anxious to see if his fellow actor had at last learnt his lines.
sentencecn: 狱卒热切地观察着，急于想了解他的同事是否记熟了台词。

sentence: The noble stared at the blank sheet of paper for a few seconds.
sentencecn: 贵族盯着纸看了几秒钟，

sentence: Then, squinting his eyes, he said: 'The light is dim. Read the letter to me.
sentencecn: 然后，眼珠一转，说道：“光线太暗，请给我读一下这封信。”

sentence: And he promptly handed the sheet of paper to the gaoler.
sentencecn: 说完，他一下子把信递给狱卒。

sentence: Finding that he could not remember a word of the letter either,
sentencecn: 狱卒发现自己连一个字也记不住，

sentence: the gaoler replied: 'The light is indeed dim, sire. I must get my glasses.
sentencecn: 于是便说：“陛下，这儿光线的确太暗了，我得去把眼镜拿来。”

sentence: With this, he hurried off the stage.
sentencecn: 他一边说着，一边匆匆下台。

sentence: Much to the aristocrat's amusement,
sentencecn: 贵族感到非常好笑的是：

sentence: the gaoler returned a few moments later with a pair of glasses and the usual copy of the letter which he proceeded to read to the prisoner.
sentencecn: 一会儿工夫，狱卒重新登台，拿来一副眼镜以及平时使用的那封信，然后为那囚犯念了起来。

sentence: --- lesson 25 The Cutty Sark
sentencecn: “卡蒂萨克”号帆船

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What piece of bad luck prevented the Cutty Sark from winning the race?
sentencecn: 是什么坏运气使卡蒂萨克号没有赢得比赛?

sentence: One of the most famous sailing ships of the nineteenth century, the Cutty Sark, can still be seen at Greenwich.
sentencecn: 人们在格林威治仍可看到19世纪最有名的帆船之一“卡蒂萨克”号。

sentence: She stands on dry land and is visited by thousands of people each year.
sentencecn: 它停在陆地上，每年接待成千上万的参观者。

sentence: She serves as an impressive reminder of the great ships of the past.
sentencecn: 它给人们留下深刻的印象，使人们回忆起历史上的巨型帆船，

sentence: Before they were replaced by steamships, sailing vessels like the Cutty Sark were used to carry tea from China and wool from Australia.
sentencecn: 在蒸汽船取代帆船之前。“卡蒂萨克”号之类的帆船被用来从中国运回茶叶，从澳大利亚运回羊毛。

sentence: The Cutty Sark was one of the fastest sailing ships that has ever been built.
sentencecn: “卡蒂萨克”号是帆船制造史上建造的最快的一艘帆船。

sentence: The only other ship to match her was the Thermopylae.
sentencecn: 唯一可以与之一比高低的是“塞姆皮雷”号帆船。

sentence: Both these ships set out from Shanghai on June 18th, 1872 on an exciting race to England.
sentencecn: 两船于1872年6月18日同时从上海启航驶往英国，途中展开了一场激烈的比赛。

sentence: This race, which went on for exactly four months, was the last of its kind.
sentencecn: 这场比赛持续了整整4个月，是这类比赛中的最后一次，

sentence: It marked the end of the great tradition of ships with sails and the beginning of a new era.
sentencecn: 它标志着帆船伟大传统的结束与一个新纪元的开始。

sentence: The first of the two ships to reach Java after the race had begun was the Thermopylae, but on the Indian Ocean, the Cutty Sark took the lead.
sentencecn: 比赛开始后，“赛姆皮雷”号率先抵达爪哇岛。但在印度洋上，“卡萨萨克”号驶到了前面。

sentence: It seemed certain that she would be the first ship home, but during the race she had a lot of bad luck.
sentencecn: 看来，它首先返抵英国是确信无疑的了，但它却在比赛中连遭厄运。

sentence: In August, she was struck by a very heavy storm during which her rudder was torn away.
sentencecn: 8月份“卡蒂萨克”号遭到一场特大风暴的袭击，失去了一只舵。

sentence: The Cutty Sark rolled from side to side and it became impossible to steer her.
sentencecn: 船身左右摇晃，无法操纵。

sentence: A temporary rudder was made on board from spare planks and it was fitted with great difficulty.
sentencecn: 船员用备用的木板在船上赶制了一只应急用的舵，并克服重重困难将舵安装就位，

sentence: This greatly reduced the speed of the ship,
sentencecn: 这样一来，大大降低了船的航速。

sentence: for there was a danger that if she travelled too quickly, this rudder would be torn away as well.
sentencecn: 因为船不能开得太快，否则就有危险，应急舵也会被刮走。

sentence: Because of this, the Cutty Sark lost her lead.
sentencecn: 因为这个缘故，“卡蒂萨克”号落到了后面。

sentence: After crossing the Equator, the captain called in at a port to have a new rudder fitted,
sentencecn: 跨越赤道后，船长将船停靠在一个港口，在那儿换了一只舵。

sentence: but by now the Thermopylae was over five hundred miles ahead.
sentencecn: 但此时，“赛姆皮雷”号早已在500多英里之遥了。

sentence: Though the new rudder was fitted at tremendous speed, it was impossible for the Cutty Sark to win.
sentencecn: 尽管换装新舵时分秒必争，但“卡蒂萨克”号已经不可能取胜了，

sentence: She arrived in England a week after the Thermopylae.
sentencecn: 它抵达英国时比“塞姆皮雷”号晚了1个星期。

sentence: Even this was remarkable, considering that she had had so many delays.
sentencecn: 但考虑到路上的多次耽搁，

sentence: There is no doubt that if she had not lost her rudder she would have won the race easily.
sentencecn: 这个成绩也已很不容易了。毫无疑问，如果中途没有失去舵， “卡帝萨克”号肯定能在比赛中轻易夺冠。

sentence: --- lesson 28 Five pounds too dear
sentencecn: 五磅也太贵

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Why was even five pounds 'too dear'?
sentencecn: 为什么五英镑“太贵了”?

sentence: Small boats loaded with wares sped to the great liner as she was entering the harbour.
sentencecn: 当一艘大型班船进港的时候，许多小船载着各种杂货快速向客轮驶来。

sentence: Before she had anchored, the men from the boats had climbed on board
sentencecn: 大船还未下锚。小船上的人就纷纷爬上客轮。

sentence: and the decks were soon covered with colourful rugs from Persia, silks from India, copper coffee pots, and beautiful handmade silverware.
sentencecn: 一会儿工夫，甲板上就摆满了色彩斑斓的波斯地毯。印度丝绸。铜咖啡壶以及手工制作的漂亮的银器。

sentence: It was difficult not to be tempted.
sentencecn: 要想不为这些东西所动心是很困难的。

sentence: Many of the tourists on board had begun bargaining with the tradesmen,
sentencecn: 船上的许多游客开始同商贩讨价还价起来，

sentence: but I decide not to buy anything until I had disembarked.
sentencecn: 但我打定主意上岸之前什么也不买。

sentence: I had no sooner got off the ship than I was assailed by a man who wanted to sell me a diamond ring.
sentencecn: 我刚下船，就被一个人截住，他向我兜售一枚钻石戒指。

sentence: I had no intention of buying one, but I could not conceal the fact that I was impressed by the size of the diamonds.
sentencecn: 我根本不想买，但我不能掩饰这样一个事实：其钻石之大给我留下了深刻的印象。

sentence: Some of them were as big as marbles.
sentencecn: 有的钻石像玻璃球那么大。

sentence: The man went to great lengths to prove that the diamonds were real.
sentencecn: 那人竭力想证明那钻石是真货。

sentence: As we were walking past a shop, he held a diamond firmly against the window and made a deep impression in the glass.
sentencecn: 我们路过一家商店时，他将一颗钻石使劲地往橱窗上一按，在玻璃上留下一道深痕。

sentence: It took me over half an hour to get rid of him.
sentencecn: 我花了半个多小时才摆脱了他的纠缠。

sentence: The next man to approach me was selling expensive pens and watches.
sentencecn: 向我兜售的第二个人是卖名贵钢笔和手表的。

sentence: I examined one of the pens closely.
sentencecn: 我仔细察看了一枝钢笔，

sentence: It certainly looked genuine.
sentencecn: 那看上去确实不假，

sentence: At the base of the gold cap, the words 'made in the U.S.A' had been neatly inscribed.
sentencecn: 金笔帽下方整齐地刻有“美国制造”字样。

sentence: The man said that the pen was worth $50, but as a special favour, he would let me have it for $30.
sentencecn: 那人说那支笔值50英镑，作为特别优惠，他愿意让我出30英镑成交。

sentence: I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay $5.
sentencecn: 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我只愿出5镑钱。

sentence: Gesticulating wildly, the man acted as if he found my offer outrageous, but he eventually reduced the price to $10.
sentencecn: 那人激动地打着手势，仿佛我的出价使他不能容忍。但他终于把价钱降到了10英镑。

sentence: Shrugging my shoulders, I began to walk away when, a moment later, he ran after me and thrust the pen into my hands.
sentencecn: 我耸耸肩膀掉头走开了。一会儿，他突然从后追了上来，把笔塞到我手里。

sentence: Though he kept throwing up his arms in despair, he readily accepted the $5 I give him.
sentencecn: 虽然他绝望地举起双手，但他毫不迟疑地收下了我付给他的5镑钱。

sentence: I felt especially pleased with my wonderful bargain -- until I got back to the ship.
sentencecn: 在回到船上之前，我一直为我的绝妙的讨价还价而洋洋得意。

sentence: No matter how hard I tried, it was impossible to fill this beautiful pen with ink and to this day it has never written a single world!
sentencecn: 然而不管我如何摆弄，那枝漂亮的钢笔就是吸不进墨水来。直到今天，那枝笔连一个字也没写过！

sentence: --- lesson 33 A day to remember
sentencecn: 难忘的一天

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What incident began the series of traffic accidents?
sentencecn: 什么事件引发了一系列的交通事故?

sentence: We have all experienced days when everything goes wrong.
sentencecn: 我们大家都有过事事不顺心的日子。

sentence: A day may begin well enough, but suddenly everything seems to get out of control.
sentencecn: 一天开始时，可能还不错，但突然间似乎一切都失去了控制。

sentence: What invariably happens is that a great number of things choose to go wrong at precisely the same moment.
sentencecn: 情况经常是这样的，许许多多的事情都偏偏赶在同一时刻出问题，

sentence: It is as if a single unimportant event set up a chain of reactions.
sentencecn: 好像是一件无关紧要的小事引起了一连串的连锁反应。

sentence: Let us suppose that you are preparing a meal and keeping an eye on the baby at the same time.
sentencecn: 假设你在做饭，同时又在照看孩子。

sentence: The telephone rings and this marks the prelude to an unforeseen series of catastrophes.
sentencecn: 这时电话铃响了。它预示着一连串意想不到的灾难的来临。

sentence: While you are on the phone, the baby pulls the tablecloth off the table,
sentencecn: 就在你接电话时，孩子把桌布从桌子上扯下来，

sentence: smashing half your best crockery and cutting himself in the process.
sentencecn: 将家中最好的陶瓷餐具半数摔碎，同时也弄伤了他自己。

sentence: You hang up hurriedly and attend to baby, crockery, etc.
sentencecn: 你急急忙忙挂上电话，赶去照看孩子和餐具。

sentence: Meanwhile, the meal gets burnt.
sentencecn: 这时，饭又烧糊了。

sentence: As if this were not enough to reduce you to tears, your husband arrives, unexpectedly bringing three guests to dinner.
sentencecn: 好像这一切还不足以使你急得掉泪，你的丈夫接着回来了，事先没打招呼就带来3个客人吃饭。

sentence: Things can go wrong on a big scale, as a number of people recently discovered in Parramatta, a suburb of Sydney.
sentencecn: 就像许多人最近在悉尼郊区帕拉马塔所发现的那样，有时乱子会闹得很大。

sentence: During the rush hour one evening two cars collided and both drivers began to argue.
sentencecn: 一天傍晚交通最拥挤时，一辆汽车撞上前面一辆汽车，两个司机争吵起来。

sentence: The woman immediately behind the two cars happened to be a learner.
sentencecn: 紧跟其后的一辆车上的司机碰巧是个初学者，

sentence: She suddenly got into a panic and stopped her car.
sentencecn: 她一惊之下突然把车停了下来。

sentence: This made the driver following her brake hard.
sentencecn: 她这一停使得跟在后头的司机也来个急刹车。

sentence: His wife was sitting beside him holding a large cake.
sentencecn: 司机妻子正坐在他身边，手里托着块大蛋糕。

sentence: As she was thrown forward, the cake went right through the windscreen and landed on the road.
sentencecn: 她往前一冲，蛋糕从挡风玻璃飞了出去掉到马路上。此时，一辆卡车正好从后边开到那辆汽车边上，

sentence: Seeing a cake flying through the air, a lorry driver who was drawing up alongside the car, pulled up all of a sudden.
sentencecn: 司机看见一块蛋糕从天而降，紧急刹车。

sentence: The lorry was loaded with empty beer bottles and hundreds of them slid off the back of the vehicle and on to the road.
sentencecn: 卡车上装着空啤酒瓶。成百只瓶子顺势从卡车后面滑出车外落在马路上。

sentence: This led to yet another angry argument.
sentencecn: 这又引起了一场唇枪舌剑的争吵。

sentence: Meanwhile, the traffic piled up behind.
sentencecn: 与此同时，后面的车辆排成了长龙，

sentence: It took the police nearly an hour to get the traffic on the move again.
sentencecn: 警察花了将近一个小时才使车辆又开起来。

sentence: In the meantime, the lorry driver had to sweep up hundreds of broken bottles.
sentencecn: 在这段时间里，卡车司机不得不清扫那几百只破瓶子。

sentence: Only two stray dogs benefited from all this confusion, for they greedily devoured what was left of the cake.
sentencecn: 只有两只野狗从这一片混乱中得到了好处，它们贪婪地吃掉了剩下的蛋糕。

sentence: It was just one of those days!
sentencecn: 这就是事事不顺心的那么一天！

sentence: --- lesson 37 The westhaven Express
sentencecn: 开往威斯特海温的快车

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What was the mistake the author made?
sentencecn: 作者犯了什么错误?

sentence: We have learnt to expect that trains will be punctual.
sentencecn: 我们已经习惯于相信火车总是准点的。

sentence: After years of conditioning, most of us have developed an unshakable faith in railway timetables.
sentencecn: 经过多年的适应，大多数人对火车时刻表产生了一种不可动摇的信念。

sentence: Ships may be delayed by storms;
sentencecn: 轮船船期可能因风暴而推延，

sentence: flights may be cancelled because of bad weather, but trains must be on time.
sentencecn: 飞机航班可能因恶劣天气而取消，唯有火车必然是准点的。

sentence: Only an exceptionally heavy snowfall might temporarily dislocate railway services.
sentencecn: 只有非同寻常的大雪才可能暂时打乱铁路运行。

sentence: It is all too easy to blame the railway authorities when something does go wrong.
sentencecn: 因此，一旦铁路上真出了问题，人们便不加思索地责备铁路当局。

sentence: The truth is that when mistakes occur, they are more likely to be ours than theirs.
sentencecn: 事实上，差错很可能是我们自己，而不是铁路当局的。

sentence: After consulting my railway timetable, I noted with satisfaction that there was an express train to Westhaven.
sentencecn: 我查看了列车时刻表，满意地了解到有一趟去威斯特海温的快车。

sentence: It went direct from my local station and the journey lasted a mere hour and seventeen minutes.
sentencecn: 这是趟直达车，旅途总共才需1小时17分钟。

sentence: When I boarded the train, I could not help noticing that a great many local people got on as well.
sentencecn: 上车后，我不禁注意到许多当地人也上了车。

sentence: At the time, this did not strike me as odd.
sentencecn: 一开始，我并不感到奇怪，

sentence: I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service.
sentencecn: 我想除我之外，想利用快车之便的也一定大有人在。

sentence: Neither was I surprised when the train stopped at Widley, a tiny station a few miles along the line.
sentencecn: 火车开出几英里即在一个小站威德里停了下来。对此，我不觉得奇怪，

sentence: Even a mighty express train can be held up by signals.
sentencecn: 因为即便是特别快车也可能被信号拦住。

sentence: But when the train dawdled at station after station, I began to wonder.
sentencecn: 但是，当火车一站接着一站往前蠕动时，我便产生了怀疑。

sentence: It suddenly dawned on me that this express was not roaring down the line at ninety miles an hour, but barely chugging along at thirty.
sentencecn: 我突然感到这趟快车并没以时速90英里的速度呼啸前进，而是卟哧卟哧地向前爬行，时速仅30英里。

sentence: One hour and seventeen minutes passed and we had not even covered half the distance.
sentencecn: 1小时17分过去了，走了还不到一半路程。

sentence: I asked a passenger if this was the Westhaven Express, but he had not even heard of it.
sentencecn: 我问一位乘客，这是不是开往威斯特海温的那趟快车，他说从未听说过有这么一趟快车。

sentence: I determined to lodge a complaint as soon as we arrived.
sentencecn: 我决定一到目的地就给铁路部门提意见。

sentence: Two hours later, I was talking angrily to the station master at Westhaven.
sentencecn: 两小时后，我气呼呼地同威斯特海温站站长说起此事。

sentence: When he denied the train's existence, I borrowed his copy of the timetable.
sentencecn: 他说根本没有这趟车。于是我借他本人的列车时刻表，

sentence: There was a note of triumph in my voice when I told him that it was there in black and white.
sentencecn: 我带着一种胜利者的调子告诉他那趟车白纸黑字、明明白白印在时刻表上。

sentence: Glancing at it briefly, he told me to look again.
sentencecn: 他迅速地扫视了一眼，让我再看一遍。

sentence: A tiny asterisk conducted me to a footnote at the bottom of the page.
sentencecn: 一个小小的星形符号把我的目光引到了那页底部一个说明上。

sentence: It said: 'This service has been suspended.
sentencecn: 上面写着：“此趟列车暂停运行。”

sentence: --- lesson 42 Modern caveman
sentencecn: 现代洞穴人

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: With what does the writer compare the Gouffre Berger?
sentencecn: 作者用什么来类比高弗.伯杰洞呢?

sentence: Cave exploration, or pot-holing, as it has come to be known, is a relatively new sport.
sentencecn: 洞穴勘查--或洞穴勘探--是一项比较新的体育活动。

sentence: Perhaps it is the desire for solitude or the chance of making an unexpected discovery that lures people down to the depths of the earth.
sentencecn: 寻求独居独处的愿望或寻求意外发现机会的欲望吸引人们来到地下深处。

sentence: It is impossible to give a satisfactory explanation for a pot-holer's motives.
sentencecn: 要想对洞穴探险者的动机作出满意的解释是不可能的。

sentence: For him, caves have the same peculiar fascination which high mountains have for the climber.
sentencecn: 对洞穴探险者来说，洞穴有一种特殊的魅力，就像高山对登山者有特殊的魅力一样。

sentence: They arouse instincts which can only be dimly understood.
sentencecn: 为什么洞空能引发人的那种探险本能，人们对此只能有一种模模糊糊的理解。

sentence: Exploring really deep caves is not a task for the Sunday afternoon rambler.
sentencecn: 探测非常深的洞穴不是那些在星期日下午漫步的人所能胜任的。

sentence: Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations.
sentencecn: 这种活动需要有军事行动般的周密布署和预见能力。

sentence: It can take as long as eight days to rig up rope ladders and to establish supply bases before a descent can be made into a very deep cave.
sentencecn: 有时需要花费整整8天时间来搭起绳梯，建立供应基地，然后才能下到一个很深的洞穴里。

sentence: Precautions of this sort are necessary,
sentencecn: 作出这样的准备是必要的，

sentence: for it is impossible to foretell the exact nature of the difficulties which will confront the pot-holer.
sentencecn: 因为无法预见到洞穴探险者究竟会遇到什么性质的困难。

sentence: The deepest known cave in the world is the Gouffre Berger near Grenoble.
sentencecn: 世界上最深的洞穴是格里诺布尔附近的高弗.伯杰洞，

sentence: It extends to a depth of 3,723 feet.
sentencecn: 深达3,723英尺。

sentence: This immense chasm has been formed by an underground stream which has tunnelled a course through a flaw in the rocks.
sentencecn: 这个深邃的洞穴是由一条地下暗泉冲刷岩石中的缝隙并使之慢慢变大而形成的。

sentence: The entrance to the cave is on a plateau in the Dauphine Alps.
sentencecn: 此洞的洞口在丹芬阿尔卑斯山的高原上，

sentence: As it is only six feet across, it is barely noticeable.
sentencecn: 仅6英尺宽，很难被人发现。

sentence: The cave might never have been discovered has not the entrance been spotted by the distinguished French pot-holer, Berger.
sentencecn: 若不是法国著名洞穴探险家伯杰由于偶然的机会发现了这个洞口的话，这个洞也许不会为人所知。

sentence: Since its discovery, it has become a sort of potholers' Everest.
sentencecn: 自从被发现以后，这个洞成了洞穴探险者的珠穆朗玛峰，

sentence: Though a number of descents have been made, much of it still remains to be explored.
sentencecn: 人们多次进入洞内探险，但至今尚有不少东西有待勘探。

sentence: A team of pot-holers recently went down the Gouffre Berger.
sentencecn: 最近，一队洞穴探险者下到了高弗.伯杰洞里。

sentence: After entering the narrow gap on the plateau, they climbed down the steep sides of the cave until they came to a narrow corridor.
sentencecn: 他们从高原上的窄缝进去，顺着笔直陡峭的洞壁往下爬。

sentence: They had to edge their way along this, sometimes wading across shallow streams, or swimming across deep pools.
sentencecn: 来到一条狭窄的走廊上。他们不得不侧着身子往前走，有时过浅溪，有时游过深潭。

sentence: Suddenly they came to a waterfall which dropped into an underground lake at the bottom of the cave.
sentencecn: 突然，他们来到一道瀑布前，那瀑布奔泻而下，注入洞底一处地下湖里。

sentence: They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side.
sentencecn: 他们跳入湖中，把各种器具装上一只充气的橡皮艇，听任水流将他们带往对岸。

sentence: To protect themselves from the icy water, they had to wear special rubber suits.
sentencecn: 湖水冰冷刺骨，他们必须穿上一种特制的橡皮服以保护自己。

sentence: At the far end of the lake, they came to huge piles of rubble which had been washed up by the water.
sentencecn: 在湖的尽头，他们见到一大堆一大堆由湖水冲刷上岸的碎石。

sentence: In this part of the cave, they could hear an insistent booming sound
sentencecn: 在这儿，他们可以听见一种连续不断的轰鸣声。

sentence: which they found was caused by a small waterspout shooting down into a pool from the roof of the cave.
sentencecn: 后来他们发现这是由山洞顶部的一个小孔里喷出的水柱跌落到水潭中发出的声音。

sentence: Squeezing through a cleft in the rocks, the pot-holers arrived at an enormous cavern, the size of a huge concert hall.
sentencecn: 洞穴探险者从岩石缝里挤身过去，来到一个巨大的洞里，其大小相当于一个音乐厅。

sentence: After switching on powerful arc lights, they saw great stalagmites -- some of them over forty feet high -- rising up like tree-trunks to meet the stalactites suspended from the roof.
sentencecn: 他们打开强力弧光灯，看见一株株巨大的石笋，有的高达40英尺，象树干似的向上长着，与洞顶悬挂下来的钟乳石相接。

sentence: Round about, piles of limestone glistened in all the colours of the rainbow.
sentencecn: 周围是一堆堆石灰石，像彩虹一样闪闪发光。

sentence: In the eerie silence of the cavern,
sentencecn: 洞里有一种可怕的寂静，

sentence: the only sound that could be heard was made by water which dripped continuously from the high dome above them.
sentencecn: 唯一可以听见的声响是高高的圆顶上不间断地滴水的嘀嗒声。

sentence: --- lesson 44 Speed and comfort
sentencecn: 又快捷又舒适

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Which type of transport does the writer prefer, do you think?
sentencecn: 你认为作者更喜欢哪种交通工具?

sentence: People travelling long distances frequently have to decide whether they would prefer to go by land, sea, or air.
sentencecn: 出远门的人常常需要决定是走旱路、水路，还是坐飞机。

sentence: Hardly anyone can positively enjoy sitting in a train for more than a few hours.
sentencecn: 很少有人能够真正喜欢坐几个小时以上的火车。

sentence: Train compartments soon get cramped and stuffy.
sentencecn: 车厢很快就变得拥挤、闷热，

sentence: It is almost impossible to take your mind off the journey.
sentencecn: 想摆脱开旅途的困扰是很难的。

sentence: Reading is only a partial solution, for the monotonous rhythm of the wheels clicking on the rails soon lulls you to sleep.
sentencecn: 看书只能解决部分问题。车轮与铁轨间单调的嘎喳声很快就会送你进入梦乡。

sentence: During the day, sleep comes in snatches.
sentencecn: 白天是忽睡忽醒，

sentence: At night, when you really wish to go to sleep, you rarely manage to do so.
sentencecn: 到了夜晚，你真想睡了，却很难入睡。

sentence: If you are lucky enough to get a sleeper, you spend half the night staring at the small blue light in the ceiling,
sentencecn: 即使你走运弄到一个卧铺，夜间有一半时间你会盯着车顶那盏小蓝灯而睡不着觉；

sentence: or fumbling to find your ticket for inspection.
sentencecn: 要不然就为查票摸索你的车票。

sentence: Inevitably you arrive at your destination almost exhausted.
sentencecn: 一旦抵达目的地，你总是疲惫不堪。

sentence: Long car journeys are even less pleasant, for it is quite impossible even to read.
sentencecn: 乘汽车作长途旅行则更加不舒服，因为连看书都几乎不可能。

sentence: On motorways you can, at least, travel fairly safely at high speeds,
sentencecn: 在公路上还好，你至少能以相当快的速度安全地向前行。

sentence: but more often than not, the greater part of the journey is spent on roads with few service stations and too much traffic.
sentencecn: 但旅行的大部分时间都花在路上，而且只有很少的服务设施，交通也很拥挤。

sentence: By comparison, ferry trips or cruises offer a great variety of civilized comforts.
sentencecn: 相比之下，坐船旅行或环游可以得到文明世界的各种享受。

sentence: You can stretch your legs on the spacious decks, play games, meet interesting people and enjoy good food -- always assuming,of course, that the sea is calm.
sentencecn: 你可以在甲板上伸展四肢、做游戏，还能见到各种有趣的人，能享用各种美味佳肴-当然，这一切只有在大海风平浪静的情况下才有可能。

sentence: If it is not, and you are likely to get seasick, no form of transport could be worse.
sentencecn: 如果大海肆虐起来，你就可能晕船，那种难受劲儿是任何一种别的旅行的方式都不会带来的。

sentence: Even if you travel in ideal weather, sea journeys take a long time.
sentencecn: 即使风平浪静，坐船旅行也要占用很长时间。

sentence: Relatively few people are prepared to sacrifice holiday time for the pleasure of travlling by sea.
sentencecn: 没有多少人会为享受坐船旅行的乐趣而牺牲假期的时间。

sentence: Aeroplanes have the reputation of being dangerous and even hardened travellers are intimidated by them.
sentencecn: 飞机以危险而著称，连老资格的旅行者也怕飞机。

sentence: They also have the disadvantage of being an expensive form of transport.
sentencecn: 飞机的另一个缺点是昂贵。

sentence: But nothing can match them for speed and comfort.
sentencecn: 但就速度与舒适而言，飞机是无与伦比的。

sentence: Travelling at a height of 30,000 feet, far above the clouds, and at over 500 miles an hour is an exhilarating experience.
sentencecn: 腾云驾雾，在30，000 英尺高空以500英里的时速旅行，这种经历令人心旷神怡。

sentence: You do not have to devise ways of taking your mind off the journey, for an aeroplane gets you to your destination rapidly.
sentencecn: 你不必想办法去摆脱旅途的困扰，因为飞机会迅速地把你送到目的地。

sentence: For a few hours, you settle back in a deep armchair to enjoy the flight.
sentencecn: 几小时之内，你躺在扶手椅上，享受着旅途的欢乐。

sentence: The real escapist can watch a film and sip champagne on some services.
sentencecn: 真正会享受的人还可以在某些航班上看一场电影和喝香槟。

sentence: But even when such refinements are not available, there is plenty to keep you occupied.
sentencecn: 即使没有这些消遣条件，也总是有事可做。

sentence: An aeroplane offers you an unusual and breathtaking view of the world.
sentencecn: 飞机上，你可以观察世界上非同寻常的奇妙的美景。

sentence: You soar effortlessly over high mountains and deep valleys.
sentencecn: 你毫不费劲地飞越高山幽谷，

sentence: You really see the shape of the land.
sentencecn: 你确能饱览大地的风貌。

sentence: If the landscape is hidden from view,
sentencecn: 如果这种景色被遮住了，

sentence: you can enjoy the extraordinary sight of unbroken cloud plains that stretch out for miles before you, while the sun shines brilliantly in a clear sky.
sentencecn: 你便可以观赏一下展现在你面前的、一望数英里的、连绵不断的云海，同时阳光灿烂，天空清澈明朗。

sentence: The journey is so smooth that there is nothing to prevent you from reading or sleeping.
sentencecn: 旅途平稳，丝毫不妨碍你阅读或睡眠。

sentence: However you decide to spend your time, one thing is certain: you will arrive at your destination fresh and uncrumpled.
sentencecn: 不管你打算如何消磨时间，有件事是可以肯定的，即当你抵达目的地时，你感到精神焕发，毫无倦意，

sentence: You will not have to spend the next few days recovering from a long and arduous journey.
sentencecn: 用不着因为漫长旅途的辛苦而花几天时间休息来恢复精神。

sentence: --- lesson 47 Too high a price?
sentencecn: 代价太高?

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What does the writer describe as an 'amusing old-fashioned source of noise'?
sentencecn: 作者将什么描述为“有趣的老式噪音源”?

sentence: Pollution is the price we pay for an overpopulated, over industrialized planet.
sentencecn: 污染就是我们为这个人口过密，过度工业化的星球所付出的代价。

sentence: When you come to think about it, there are only four ways you can deal with rubbish:
sentencecn: 当我们开始考虑垃圾问题时，我们只有4种对付垃圾的方法：

sentence: dump it, burn it, turn it into something you can use again, attempt to produce less of it.
sentencecn: 倾倒、焚烧、把垃圾变成再生材料或试图少产生一些垃圾。

sentence: We keep trying all four methods, but he sheer volume of rubbish we produce worldwide threatens to overwhelm us.
sentencecn: 我们一直在试这4种方式，但是，我们在世界范围内仅产生的垃圾的量就有把我们覆盖的危险。

sentence: Rubbish, however, is only part of the problem of polluting our planet.
sentencecn: 然而，垃圾只是我们这个星球的污染问题的一个方面。

sentence: The need to produce ever-increasing quantities of cheap food leads to a different kind of pollution.
sentencecn: 日益增长的对廉价食物的需求导致了另一种形式的污染。

sentence: Industrialized farming methods produce cheap meat products: beef, pork and chicken.
sentencecn: 工业化的农作方式生产出廉价的肉类制品--牛肉、猪肉和鸡肉。

sentence: The use of pesticides and fertilizers produces cheap grain and vegetables.
sentencecn: 使用杀虫剂和化肥生产出了廉价的谷物和蔬菜。

sentence: The price we pay for cheap food may be already too high:
sentencecn: 为了廉价食物我们付出的代价已经太高了：

sentence: Mad Cow Disease (BSE) in cattle, salmonella in chicken and eggs, and listeria in dairy products.
sentencecn: 牛肉中的疯牛病，鸡肉和鸡蛋中的沙门氏菌，奶制品中的利斯特杆菌。

sentence: And if you think you'll abandon meat and become a vegetarian,
sentencecn: 如果你想放弃肉类而变成一位素食者，

sentence: you have the choice of very expensive organically-grown vegetables
sentencecn: 那么你可以两者择一：或是选用价格昂贵、有机培植的蔬菜，

sentence: or a steady diet of pesticides every time you think you're eating fresh salads and vegetables, or just having an innocent glass of water!
sentencecn: 或是当你认为在享用新鲜色拉和新鲜蔬菜或饮用一杯无害的水的时候，实际上每次都不断吃进杀虫剂。

sentence: However, there is an even more insidious kind of pollution that particularly affects urban areas and invades our daily lives, and that is noise.
sentencecn: 但是，还有一种更加隐蔽有害的污染，它专门影响城镇地区，侵袭我们的日常生活，那就是噪音。

sentence: Burglar alarms going off at any time of the day or night serve only to annoy passers-by and actually assist burglars to burgle.
sentencecn: 防盗警报器在白天和黑夜的任何时候都会响起来，它的作用只是骚扰过路行人，而实际上却帮助窃贼入室行窃。

sentence: Car alarms constantly scream at us in the street and are a source of profound irritation.
sentencecn: 在街上，汽车的防盗警报不断对我们吼叫，这是人们极度烦燥的一个原因，

sentence: A recent survey of the effects of noise revealed (surprisingly?) that dogs barking incessantly in the night rated the highest form of noise pollution on a scale ranging from 1 to 7.
sentencecn: 最近一个有关噪音的作用的调查（令人吃惊地）指出，夜间连续不断的狗叫声，在一个从1级至7级刻度表上应列为最严重的噪间污染。

sentence: The survey revealed a large number of sources of noise that we really dislike. Lawn mowers whining on a summer's day, late-night parties in apartment blocks,
sentencecn: 这个调查揭示了我们所不喜欢的大量的噪间的来源：夏天呜呜作响的割草机，公寓楼里深夜聚会的喧哗声，

sentence: noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds,especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead,
sentencecn: 大声吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是穿越寂静的村庄的集装箱卡车，从头顶飞过的飞机和直升机，

sentence: large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume.
sentencecn: 被带到公共场所、音量开到最大的大功率收音机。

sentence: New technology has also made its own contribution to noise.
sentencecn: 新技术也为噪音作了它的贡献。

sentence: A lot of people object to mobile phones, especially when they are used in public places like restaurants or on public transport.
sentencecn: 许多人都反对移动式电话，特别是在如饭店，公共交通车等公共场所使用移动电话。

sentence: Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat.
sentencecn: 用移动电话大声交谈干扰我们的思路，破坏我们和朋友在一起轻声聊天所得到的乐趣。

sentence: The noise pollution survey revealed a rather surprising and possibly amusing old fashioned source of noise.
sentencecn: 这个有关噪音的污染调查还揭示了一种出人意外同时可能会引人发笑的老式噪音源。

sentence: It turned out to be snoring!
sentencecn: 它竟然是鼾声。

sentence: Men were found to be the worst offenders.
sentencecn: 人类是这方面的罪魁祸首。

sentence: It was revealed that 20% of men in their mid-thirties snore.
sentencecn: 调查指出，20%的35岁左右的男人打鼾；

sentence: This figure rises to a staggering 60% of men in their sixties.
sentencecn: 而到60岁这个年龄段，这个数字上升到令人惊愕的60%。

sentence: Against these figures, it was found that only 5% of women snore regularly,
sentencecn: 与这些数字相比，只有5% 的女性经常打鼾，

sentence: while the rest are constantly woken or kept awake by their trumpeting partners.
sentencecn: 而其余的则经常被与她们同睡、像吹号似地打着呼噜的男人吵醒或弄得睡不着。

sentence: Whatever the source of noise, one thing is certain: silence, it seems, has become a golden memory.
sentencecn: 不管噪声来自何方，有一点是肯定的：看来寂静已变成一种珍贵的回忆。

sentence: --- lesson 49 The ideal servant
sentencecn: 理想的仆人

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What is Bessie's little weakness?
sentencecn: 贝西的小弱点是什么？

sentence: It is a good thing my aunt Harriet died years ago.
sentencecn: 我的姑妈哈丽特好多年前就去世了，这倒是件好事。

sentence: If she were alive today she would not be able to air her views on her favourite topic of conversation: domestic servants.
sentencecn: 如果她活到今天，她将不能就她热衷的话题“佣人”发表意见了。

sentence: Aunt Harriet lived in that leisurely age when servants were employed to do housework.
sentencecn: 哈丽特生活在一个悠闲的年代，家务事都由雇来的佣人代劳。

sentence: She had a huge, rambling country house called 'The Gables'.
sentencecn: 她在乡下有一幢巨大杂乱的房子，叫作“山墙庄园”。

sentence: She was sentimentally attached to this house, for even though it was far too big for her needs,
sentencecn: 她对这幢房子在感情上难舍难分。房子实在太大了，

sentence: she persisted in living there long after her husband's death.
sentencecn: 但在丈夫去世多年后，她仍然执意长年住在那儿。

sentence: Before she grew old, Aunt Harriet used to entertain lavishly.
sentencecn: 哈丽特姑妈年轻时，喜欢大摆宴席，招待宾客。

sentence: I often visited The Gables when I was boy.
sentencecn: 我小时候常去“山墙庄园”作客。

sentence: No matter how many guests were present, the great house was always immaculate.
sentencecn: 不管去多少宾客，大房子里总是收拾得干干净净。

sentence: The parquet floors shone like mirrors;
sentencecn: 镶木地板洁如明镜，

sentence: highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets;
sentencecn: 擦得发亮的银器陈列在明亮的玻璃柜里，

sentence: even my uncle's huge collection of books was kept miraculously free from dust.
sentencecn: 连姑夫的大量藏书也保存得很好，奇迹般地一尘不染。

sentence: Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished.
sentencecn: 哈丽特姑妈统率着一支看不见的佣人大军，他们不停地擦拭、清扫、刷洗。

sentence: She always referred to them as 'the shifting population',
sentencecn: 她称这些佣人叫“流动人口”，

sentence: for they came and went with such frequency that I never even got a chance to learn their names.
sentencecn: 因为他们来去匆匆，所以我甚至都没有机会知道他们的姓名。

sentence: Though my aunt pursued what was, in those days, an enlightened policy, in that she never allowed her domestic staff to work more than eight hours a day, she was extremely difficult to please.
sentencecn: 姑妈待佣人在当时算是开明的，从来不让佣人每天工作超过8小时，但他们很难使她称心如意。

sentence: While she always criticized the fickleness of human nature,
sentencecn: 她一方面总是批评人的本性朝三暮四，

sentence: she carried on an unrelenting search for the ideal servant to the end of her days,even after she had been sadly disillusioned by Bessie.
sentencecn: 另一方面她又持之以恒地寻找一个理想的佣人。即使在贝西大大地伤她的心之后，她还在找，一直到她死去。

sentence: Bessie worked for Aunt Harriet for three years.
sentencecn: 贝西在哈丽特家干了3年。

sentence: During that time she so gained my aunt's confidence, that she was put in charge of the domestic staff.
sentencecn: 在此期间，她赢得了姑母的赏识，甚至当上了大管家。

sentence: Aunt Harriet could not find words to praise Bessie's industriousness and efficiency.
sentencecn: 哈丽特不知该用什么言辞来赞扬贝西的勤奋与高效。

sentence: In addition to all her other qualifications, Bessie was an expert cook.
sentencecn: 贝西除了有各种本领以外，还是一个烹饪大师。

sentence: She acted the role of the perfect servant for three years before Aunt Harriet discovered her 'little weakness'.
sentencecn: 她担任“理想仆人”角色3年之后，哈丽特终于发现她有“小小的弱点”。

sentence: After being absent from The Gables for a week,
sentencecn: 一次，姑妈有一个星期没在“山墙庄园”住。

sentence: my aunt unexpectedly returned one afternoon with a party of guests and instructed Bessie to prepare dinner.
sentencecn: 一天下午，她出其不意地回来了，带来一大批客人，吩咐贝西准备晚饭。

sentence: Not only was the meal well below the usual standard, but Bessie seemed unable to walk steadily.
sentencecn: 结果，不仅饭菜远不如平时做得好，而且贝西走起路来似乎东倒西歪。

sentence: She bumped into the furniture and kept mumbling about the guests.
sentencecn: 她撞到了家具上，嘴里还不断咕咕哝哝议论客人。

sentence: When she came in with the last course -- a huge pudding -- she tripped on the carpet
sentencecn: 当她端着最后一道菜--一大盘布丁--走进屋来时，在地毯上绊了一跤。

sentence: and the pudding went flying through the air, narrowly missed my aunt, and crashed on the dining table with considerable force.
sentencecn: 布丁飞到半空，从姑母身边擦过，然后狠狠地砸在餐桌上。

sentence: Though this caused great mirth among the guests, Aunt Harriet was horrified.
sentencecn: 这件事引起了客人们的欢笑，但哈丽特却着实吓了一跳。

sentence: She reluctantly came to the conclusion that Bessie was drunk.
sentencecn: 她不得不认定贝西是喝醉了。

sentence: The guests had, of course, realized this from the moment Bessie opened the door for them and,long before the final catastrophe, had had a difficult time trying to conceal their amusement.
sentencecn: 客人们自然从贝西为他们开门那一刻起就看出来了，在好长一段时间里，即最后这个乱子发生前，他们努力克制才没笑出声来。

sentence: The poor girl was dismissed instantly.
sentencecn: 贝西当即被解雇了。

sentence: After her departure, Aunt Harriet discovered that there were piles of empty wine bottles of all shapes and sizes neatly stacked in what had once been Bessie's wardrobe.
sentencecn: 贝西走后，哈丽特姑妈发现在贝西以前用过的衣柜里整整齐齐地放着一堆堆形状各异、大小不一的酒瓶子。

sentence: They had mysteriously found their way there from the wine cellar!
sentencecn: 这些酒瓶神不知鬼不觉地从酒窖来到了这里。

sentence: --- lesson 53 In the Public interest
sentencecn: 为了公众的利益

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What could not be reported in the official files?
sentencecn: 什么不能在官方文件中报道?

sentence: The Scandinavian countries are much admired all over the world for their enlightened social policies.
sentencecn: 斯堪的纳维亚半岛各国实行的开明的社会政策，受到全世界的推崇。

sentence: Sweden has evolved an excellent system for protecting the individual citizen from high-handed or incompetent public officers.
sentencecn: 在瑞典，已逐渐形成了一种完善的制度以保护每个公民不受专横的和不称职的政府官员的欺压。

sentence: The system has worked so well, that it has been adopted in other countries too.
sentencecn: 由于这种制度行之有效，已被其他国家采纳。

sentence: The Swedes were the first to recognize that public officials like civil servants, police officers, health inspectors or tax-collectors can make mistakes or act over-zealously in the belief that they are serving the public.
sentencecn: 是瑞典人首先认识到政府工作人员如文职人员、警官、卫生稽查员、税务人员等等也会犯错误或者自以为在为公众服务而把事情做过了头。

sentence: As long ago as 1809, the Swedish Parliament introduced a scheme to safeguard the interest of the individual.
sentencecn: 早在1809年，瑞典议会就建立了一个保护公民利益的制度。

sentence: A parliamentary committee representing all political parties appoints a person who is suitably qualified to investigate private grievances against the State.
sentencecn: 议会内有一个代表各政党利益的委员会，由它委派一位称职的人选专门调查个人对国家的意见。

sentence: The official title of the person is 'Justiteombudsman', but the Swedes commonly refer to him as the 'J.O.' or 'Ombudsman'.
sentencecn: 此人官衔为“司法特派员”，但瑞典人一般管他叫“J.O.”，即“司法特派员”。

sentence: The Ombudsman is not subject to political pressure.
sentencecn: 司法特派员不受任何政治压力的制约。

sentence: He investigates complaints large and small that come to him from all levels of society.
sentencecn: 他听取社会各阶层的各种大小意见，并进行调查。

sentence: As complaints must be made in writing, the Ombudsman receives an average of 1,200 letters a year.
sentencecn: 由于意见均需用书面形式提出，司法特派员每年平均收到1,200封信。

sentence: He has eight lawyer assistants to help him and he examines every single letter in detail.
sentencecn: 他有8位律师作他的助手协助工作，每封信都详细批阅。

sentence: There is nothing secretive about the Ombudsman's work, for his correspondence is open to public inspection.
sentencecn: 司法特派员的工作没有什么秘密可言，他的信件是公开的，供公众监督。

sentence: If a citizen's complaint is justified, the Ombudsman will act on his behalf.
sentencecn: 如果公民的意见正确，司法特派员便为他伸张正义。

sentence: The action he takes varies according to the nature of the complaint.
sentencecn: 司法特员采取的行动因意见的性质不同而有所不同。

sentence: He may gently reprimand an official or even suggest to parliament that a law be altered.
sentencecn: 他可以善意地批评某位官员，也可以甚至向议会提议修改某项法律。

sentence: The following case is a typical example of the Ombudsman's work.
sentencecn: 下述事件是司法特派员工作的一个典型例子。

sentence: A foreigner living in a Swedish village wrote to the Ombudsman complaining that he had been ill-treated by the police,
sentencecn: 一个住在瑞典乡村的外国人写信给司法特派员，抱怨说他受到警察虐待，

sentence: simply because he was a foreigner.
sentencecn: 原因就是因为他是个外国人。

sentence: The Ombudsman immediately wrote to the Chief of Police in the district asking him to send a record of the case.
sentencecn: 司法特派员立即写信给当地的警察局长，请他寄送与此事有关的材料。

sentence: There was nothing in the record to show that the foreigner's complaint was justified and the Chief of Police strongly denied the accusation.
sentencecn: 材料中没有任何文字记载证明外国人所说的情况符合事实，警察局长矢口否认这一指控。

sentence: It was impossible for the Ombudsman to take action,
sentencecn: 司法特派员难以处理。

sentence: but when he received a similar complaint from another foreigner in the same village,
sentencecn: 但是，当他又收到住在同一村庄的另一个外国人写的一封内容类似的投诉信时，

sentence: he immediately sent one of his layers to investigate the matter.
sentencecn: 他立即派出一位律师前去调查。

sentence: The lawyer ascertained that a policeman had indeed dealt roughly with foreigners on several occasions.
sentencecn: 律师证实有个警察确实多次粗鲁地对待外国人。

sentence: The fact that the policeman was prejudiced against foreigners could not be recorded in the official files.
sentencecn: 警察歧视外国人的事在官方档案中不可能加以记载，

sentence: It was only possible for the Ombudsman to find this out by sending one of his representatives to check the facts.
sentencecn: 司法特派员只有派他的代表去核对事实才能了解真相。

sentence: The policeman in question was severely reprimanded and was informed that if any further complaints were lodged against him, he would be prosecuted.
sentencecn: 当事的警察受到严厉的斥责，并被告知，如果再有人投诉他，他将受到起诉。

sentence: The Ombudsman's prompt action at once put an end to an unpleasant practice which might have gone unnoticed.
sentencecn: 司法特派员及时采取的行动，迅速制止了这一起不愉快的事件，不然这件事可能因未得到人们注意而不了了之。

sentence: --- lesson 57 Back in the old country
sentencecn: 重返故里

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: Did the narrator find is mother's grave?
sentencecn: 叙述者找到妈妈的坟墓了吗?

sentence: I stopped to let the car cool off and to study the map.
sentencecn: 我停下车，让汽车发动机冷却一下，同时查看一下地图。

sentence: I had expected to be near my objective by now, but everything still seemed alien to me.
sentencecn: 我本想离目的地已经不远，但周围一切对我仍很陌生。

sentence: I was only five when my father had taken me abroad, and that was eighteen years ago.
sentencecn: 我5岁那年，父亲就带我出了国，那是18年前的事了。

sentence: When my mother had died after a tragic accident, he did not quickly recover from the shock and loneliness.
sentencecn: 当时我母亲在一次事故中惨死，父亲未能很快从悲痛与孤独中恢复过来。

sentence: Everything around him was full of her presence, continually reopening the wound.
sentencecn: 他身边的一切都有母亲的影子不断地勾起他的伤感。

sentence: So he decided to emigrate.
sentencecn: 于是他决定移居他国。

sentence: In the new country he became absorbed in making a new life for the two of us, so that he gradually ceased to grieve.
sentencecn: 在这个新的国家里，父亲专心致志地为我们俩开创一种新的生活，慢慢地不伤心了。

sentence: He did not marry again and I was brought up without a woman's care;
sentencecn: 父亲没有再娶，因此，我在没有母亲的环境里长大成人。

sentence: but I lacked for nothing, for he was both father and mother to me.
sentencecn: 但我却什么都不缺，他既当父亲又当母亲。

sentence: He always meant to go back one day, but not to stay.
sentencecn: 他总想将来回国看看，但却不愿长期住下去，

sentence: His roots and mine had become too firmly embedded in the new land.
sentencecn: 因为他与我一样已经把根深深地扎在了异国的土地上。

sentence: But he wanted to see the old folk again and to visit my mother's grave.
sentencecn: 但是，他想看一看家乡父老乡亲，为我的母亲扫墓。

sentence: He became mortally ill a few months before we had planned to go and, when he knew that he was dying, he made me promise to go on my own.
sentencecn: 就在他计划回国的前几个月，他突然身患绝症。他知道自己已奄奄一息，于是他要我答应一定单独回故乡一趟。

sentence: I hired a car the day after landing and bought a comprehensive book of maps,
sentencecn: 我下飞机后租了一辆车，并买了一本详尽的地图册。

sentence: which I found most helpful on the cross-country journey, but which I did not think I should need on the last stage.
sentencecn: 在乡间行车途中，我觉得它非常有用，但快到家了，我倒觉得它没什么用了。

sentence: It was not that I actually remembered anything at all.
sentencecn: 这倒并非是我背熟了地图，

sentence: But my father had described over and over again what we should see at every milestone, after leaving the nearest town,
sentencecn: 而是父亲曾详细给我讲了，在过了离故乡最近的那个小镇后，在每一个路标处可见到些什么。

sentence: so that I was positive I should recognize it as familiar territory.
sentencecn: 因此，我相信这段路对我来说会是很熟悉的。

sentence: Well, I had been wrong, for I was now lost.
sentencecn: 唉，实际我错了，我现在迷路了。

sentence: I looked at the map and then at the milometer.
sentencecn: 我看了看地图，又查了一下里程表。

sentence: I had come ten miles since leaving the town,
sentencecn: 从小镇出来，我走了10英里。

sentence: and at this point, according to my father, I should be looking at farms and cottages in a valley,
sentencecn: 照父亲的说法，我面前应是一个山谷，有农场与村舍，

sentence: with the spire of the church of our village showing in the far distance.
sentencecn: 还可远远望见老家村子里的教堂的尖顶。

sentence: I could see no valley, no farms, no cottages and no church spire -- only a lake.
sentencecn: 可现在我却看不出山谷，看不见农舍，也看不见教学尖顶，看见只是一片湖泊。

sentence: I decided that I must have taken a wrong turning somewhere.
sentencecn: 我想一定是什么地方拐错了弯儿。

sentence: So I drove back to the town and began to retrace the route, taking frequent glances at the map.
sentencecn: 于是我驾车返回小镇，重新按路线行驶。

sentence: I landed up at the same corner.
sentencecn: 结果又来到刚才那个拐弯处。

sentence: The curious thing was that the lake was not marked on the map.
sentencecn: 奇怪的是那个湖没有在地图上标出。

sentence: I felt as if I had stumbled into a nightmare country, as you sometimes do in dreams.
sentencecn: 我感到自己就像平时作梦那样迷迷糊糊地闯进了恶梦境地。

sentence: And, as in a nightmare, there was nobody in sight to help me.
sentencecn: 就像在恶梦里一样，见不到一个人可以帮助我。

sentence: Fortunately for me, as I was wondering what to do next, there appeared on the horizon a man on horseback, riding in my direction.
sentencecn: 不过，我是幸运的，正当我走投无路之时，从天边出现一个骑马的人向我骑来。

sentence: I waited till he came near, then I asked him the way to our old village.
sentencecn: 等他走近了，我问他去老家的路。

sentence: He said that there was now no village.
sentencecn: 他说那村子已经没有了。

sentence: I thought he must have misunderstood me, so I repeated its name.
sentencecn: 我想他一定误解了我的意思，于是又说一遍村庄的名字。

sentence: This time he pointed to the lake.
sentencecn: 这次他用手指了一下那个湖。

sentence: The village no longer existed because it had been submerged, and all the valley too.
sentencecn: 村庄已不复存在，因为已经为水所淹，山谷也被水淹没了。

sentence: The lake was not a natural one, but a man-made reservoir.
sentencecn: 这不是一个天然湖泊，是一座人工修建的水库。

sentence: --- lesson 59 Collecting
sentencecn: 收藏

sentence: Listen to the tape then answer the question below.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答问题。

sentence: What in particular does a person gain when he or she becomes a serious collector?
sentencecn: 当一个人成为真正的收藏家，他或她会得到什么特别的收获?

sentence: People tend to amass possessions, sometimes without being aware of doing so.
sentencecn: 人们喜欢收藏东西，有时并没有意识到自己在这样做。

sentence: Indeed they can have a delightful surprise when they find something useful which they did not know they owned.
sentencecn: 确实，一旦无意之中从自己的收藏品中找到某件有用的东西时，可以给人一种惊喜的感觉。

sentence: Those who never have to move house become indiscriminate collectors of what can only be described as clutter.
sentencecn: 那些从来不必搬家的人们成了一种无所不容的收藏家。

sentence: They leave unwanted objects in drawers, cupboards and attics for years, in the belief that they may one day need just those very things.
sentencecn: 他们专门收藏那些只能被称作杂货的东西。他们在抽屉里、碗柜中、阁楼上堆放着一些不用的东西，一放就是好几年，

sentence: As they grow old, people also accumulate belongings for two other reasons,
sentencecn: 相信总有一天需要的正好是那些东西。人们年老之后也喜欢收藏东西，不过是出于两个不同的原因：

sentence: lack of physical and mental energy, both of which are essential in turning out and throwing away, and sentiment.
sentencecn: 一是体力，精力均告不佳，这二者是清除无用的东西必不可少的因素；另一原因是感情因素。

sentence: Things owned for a long time are full associations with the past, perhaps with relatives who are dead,
sentencecn: 东西搁得时间久了，便会充满着与过去岁月的联系，比方说与死去的亲戚有关。

sentence: and so they gradually acquire a value beyond their true worth.
sentencecn: 因此这些东西慢慢获得了一种超出它本身的价值。

sentence: Some things are collected deliberately in the home in an attempt to avoid waste.
sentencecn: 居家度日，有目的地收藏某些东西是为了防止浪费。

sentence: Among these I would list string and brown paper,
sentencecn: 这些东西中我想举出线绳和包装纸为例。

sentence: kept by thrifty people when a parcel has been opened, to save buying these two requisites.
sentencecn: 节俭的人们打开包裹后便把这两样必备的东西收藏起来。省得日后去买。

sentence: Collecting small items can easily become a mania.
sentencecn: 收集小玩艺儿很容易着迷。

sentence: I know someone who always cuts sketches out from newspapers of model clothes that she would like to buy if she had the money.
sentencecn: 我认识一个人，她总喜欢从报纸上剪下流行服装的图样，等以后有钱时去买服装。

sentence: As she is not rich, the chances that she will ever be able to afford such purchases are remote;
sentencecn: 由于她并不富裕，她买得起这些服装的可能性十分渺茫。

sentence: but she is never sufficiently strong-minded to be able to stop the practice.
sentencecn: 但她又缺乏足够坚强的意志把这一收集活动停下来。

sentence: It is a harmless habit, but it litters up her desk to such an extent that every time she opens it, loose bits of paper fall out in every direction.
sentencecn: 这种习惯无害，只把写字台里堆得满满当当，以致每次打开抽屉总能带出许多纸片四处飞扬。

sentence: Collecting as a serious hobby is quite different and has many advantages.
sentencecn: 作为一种严肃的业余爱好的收藏活动完全是另外一回事，

sentence: It provides relaxation for leisure hours, as just looking at one's treasures is always a joy.
sentencecn: 它具有许多益处。它可以使人在闲暇中得到休息，因为欣赏自己收藏的珍品总会充满了乐趣。

sentence: One does not have to go outside for amusement, since the collection is housed at home.
sentencecn: 人们不必走到户外去寻求娱乐，因为收藏品都是存放在家中。

sentence: Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books china,glass,
sentencecn: 不管收藏品是什么，邮票、唱片、头版书籍、瓷器、玻璃杯、

sentence: antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals,
sentencecn: 老式家具、绘画、模型汽车、鸟类标本，还是玩具动物，

sentence: there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books.
sentencecn: 从为新增添的收藏品寻找摆放位置到核对参考书中的事实，总归有事可做。

sentence: This hobby educates one not only in the chosen subject, but also in general matters which have some bearing on it.
sentencecn: 这种爱好不仅能使人从选择的专题中受到教育，而且也能从与之有关的一般事物中获得长进。

sentence: There are also other benefits.
sentencecn: 除此之外，还有其他的益处。

sentence: One wants to meet like-minded collectors, to get advice, to compare notes, to exchange articles, to show off the latest find.
sentencecn: 收藏者要会见情趣相投的收藏者，以获取教益、流经验、交换收藏品、炫耀自己的最新收藏。

sentence: So one's circle of friends grows.
sentencecn: 朋友的圈子就这样不断扩大。

sentence: Soon the hobby leads to travel, perhaps to a meeting in another town, possibly a trip abroad in search of a rare specimen,
sentencecn: 用不了多久，有这种爱好的人便开始旅行，也许是去另一个城市参加会议，也可能是出国寻找一件珍品，

sentence: for collectors are not confined to any one country.
sentencecn: 因为收藏家是不分国籍的。

sentence: Over the years, one may well become an authority on one's hobby and will very probably be asked to give informal talks to little gatherings and then,
sentencecn: 一人积了多年经验会成为自己这种爱好的权威，很可能应邀在小型集会上作非正式的讲话。

sentence: if successful, to larger audiences.
sentencecn: 如果讲得好，可能向更多人发表演说。

sentence: In this way self-confidence grows, first from mastering a subject, then from being able to talk about it.
sentencecn: 这样，你自信心不断增强，先是因为掌握了一门学问，接下来是因为能够就此发表见解。

sentence: Collecting, by occupying spare time so constructively, makes a person contented, with no time for boredom.
sentencecn: 收藏活动通过富有建设性地利用业余时间使人感到心满意足，不再有无聊之日。

sentence: Lesson 4 Seeing hands
sentencecn: 课文4  能看见东西的手

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: How did Vera disover she had this gift of second sight?
sentencecn: 薇拉是怎么发现她有这种超人的视力的?

sentence: Several cases have been reported in Russia recently of people who can read and detect colours with their fingers, and even see through solid doors and walls.
sentencecn: 俄罗斯最近报导了几个事例，有人能用手指看书识字和辨认颜色，甚至能透过厚实的门和墙看到东西。

sentence: One case concerns an 11-year-old schoolgirl Vera Petrova,
sentencecn: 其中有一例谈到有一个名叫维拉.彼托洛娃的11岁学生。

sentence: who has normal vision but who can also perceive things with different parts of her skin, and through solid walls.
sentencecn: 她的视力与常人一样，但她还能用皮肤的不同部位辨认东西，甚至看穿坚实的墙壁。

sentence: This ability was first noticed by her father.
sentencecn: 是她父亲首先发现她这一功能的。

sentence: One day she came into his office and happened to put her hands on the door of a locked safe.
sentencecn: 一天，维拉走进父亲的办公室，偶然把手放在一个锁着的保险柜的门上，

sentence: Suddenly she asked her father why he kept so many old newspapers locked away there,
sentencecn: 她突然问父亲为什么把这么多的旧报纸锁在柜子里，

sentence: and even described the way they were done up in bundles.
sentencecn: 还说了报纸捆扎的情况。

sentence: Vera's curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives,
sentencecn: 维拉的特异功能引起了她家附近乌里扬诺夫斯克城一个科研单位的注意。

sentence: and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic.
sentencecn: 4月里，俄罗斯卫生部一个特别委员会对她进行了一系列的测试。

sentence: During these tests she was able to read a newspaper through an opaque screen and, stranger still,
sentencecn: 在这些测试中，她能隔着不透明的屏幕读报纸，更为奇怪的是，

sentence: by moving her elbow over a child's game of Lotto she was able to describe the figures and colours printed on it;
sentencecn: 她把肘部在儿童玩的“罗托”纸牌上移动一下，便能说出印在纸牌上的数字和颜色。

sentence: and, in another instance, wearing stockings and slippers,
sentencecn: 还有一次，她穿着长筒袜子和拖鞋，

sentence: to make out with her foot the outlines and colours of a picture hidden under a carpet.
sentencecn: 能用脚步识别出藏在地毯下面的一幅画的轮廓和颜色。

sentence: Other experiments showed that her knees and shoulders had a similar sensitivity.
sentencecn: 其他实验表明，她的膝盖和双肩有类似的感觉能力，

sentence: During all these tests Vera was blindfold; and indeed, except when blindfold she lacked the ability to perceive things with her skin.
sentencecn: 在所有这些实验中，维拉的双眼都是蒙着的，如果不蒙上双眼她的皮肤就不再具有识别物体的能力。

sentence: It was also found that although she could perceive things with her fingers this ability ceased the moment her hands were wet.
sentencecn: 这是千真万确的。同时还发现，尽管她能用手指识别东西，但她的手一旦弄湿，这种功能便会立即消失。

sentence: Lesson 10 Silicon valley
sentencecn: 课文10  硅谷

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What does the computer industry thrive on apart from anarchy?
sentencecn: 除了无政府状态，计算机产业繁荣的基础是什么?

sentence: Technology trends may push Silicon Valley back to the future.
sentencecn: 技术的发展趋势有可能把硅谷重新推向未来。

sentence: Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh.
sentencecn: 卡弗.米德 -- 集成电路的一位先驱，加州理工学院的计算机教授，注意到，现在有些计算机工作站使工程技术人员可以在他们的办公桌上设计、试验和生产芯片，就像一位编辑在苹果机上编出一份时事通讯一样。

sentence: As the time and cost of making a chip drop to a few days and a few hundred dollars, engineers may soon be free to let their imaginations soar without being penalized by expensive failures.
sentencecn: 由于制造一块芯片的时间已缩短至几天，费用也只有几百美元，因此，工程技术人员可能很块就可充分发挥他们的想像力，而不会因失败而造成经济上的损失。

sentence: Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office --
sentencecn: 米德预言发明者可以在办公室用一个周末的时间生产了完美的、功能很强的、按客户需求设计的芯片。

sentence: spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U. S. a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast.
sentencecn: 催生新一代车库创业公司，使美国快速将新产品推向市场，并先于外国竞争对手。

sentence: We've got more garages with smart people,' Mead observes. 'We really thrive on anarchy.
sentencecn: “我们有更多的汽车间，那里有许多聪明人，”米德说。“我们确实是靠这种无政府状态发展起来的。”

sentence: And on Asians. Already, orientals and Asian Americans constitute the majority of the engineering staffs at many Valley firms.
sentencecn: 靠的是亚洲人。硅谷许多公司中工程技术人员的大多数是东方人和亚裔美国人。

sentence: And Chinese, Korean, Filipino and Indian engineers are graduating in droves from California's colleges.
sentencecn: 中国、韩国、菲律宾和印度的工程师一批批地从加州的大学毕业。

sentence: As the heads of next-generation start-ups, these Asian innovators can draw on customs and languages to forge tighter links with crucial Pacific Rim markets.
sentencecn: 作为新掘起一代的带头人，亚裔发明家可以凭借他们在习惯和语言上的优势，与关键的太平洋沿岸市场建立起更加牢固的联系。

sentence: For instance, Alex Au, a Stanford Ph. D. from Hong Kong, has set up a Taiwan factory to challenge Japan's near lock on the memory-chip market.
sentencecn: 比如说，亚历克斯.奥，一位来自香港的斯坦福大学博士，已经在台湾建厂，对日本在内存条市场上近似垄断的局面提出了挑战。

sentence: India-born N. Damodar Reddy's tiny California company reopened an AT&T chip plant in Kansas City last spring with financing from the state of Missouri.
sentencecn: 印度出生的N.达莫达.雷迪经营的小小的加州公司在堪萨斯城重新启用了美国电话电报公司的一家芯片工厂，并从密苏里州获取了财政上的支持。

sentence: Before it becomes a retirement village, Silicon Valley may prove a classroom for building a global business.
sentencecn: 在硅谷变成一个退休村之前，它很可能成为建立全球商业的一个教学场地。

sentence: Lesson 16 The modern city
sentencecn: 课文16  现代城市

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What is the author's main argument about the modern city?
sentencecn: 作者关于现代城市的主要论点是什么?

sentence: In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected.
sentencecn: 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人的生理和精神状态的影响完全被忽视了。

sentence: Modern industry is based on the conception of the maximum production at lowest cost,
sentencecn: 现代工业的基本概念是：以最低成本获取最多产品，

sentence: in order that an individual or a group of individuals may earn as much money as possible.
sentencecn: 为的是让某个个人或某一部分人尽可能多地赚钱。

sentence: It has expanded without any idea of the true nature of the human beings who run the machines,
sentencecn: 现代工业发展起来了，却根本没想到操作机器的人的本质。

sentence: and without giving any consideration to the effects produced on the individuals and on their descendants by the artificial mode of existence imposed by the factory.
sentencecn: 工厂把一种人为的生存方式强加给工人，却不顾及这种生存方式给工人及其后代带来的影响。

sentence: The great cities have been built with no regard for us.
sentencecn: 大城市的建设毫不关心我们。

sentence: The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground,
sentencecn: 摩天大楼完全是按这样的需要修建的：每平方英尺地皮取得最大收入

sentence: and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them.
sentencecn: 和向租房人提供使他满意的办公室和住房。

sentence: This caused the construction of gigantic buildings where too large masses of human beings are crowded together.
sentencecn: 这样就导致了许多摩天大厦拔地而起，大厦内众多的人挤地一起。

sentence: Civilized men like such a way of living.
sentencecn: 文明人喜欢这样一种生活方式。

sentence: While they enjoy the comfort and banal luxury of their dwelling, they do not realize that they are deprived of the necessities of life.
sentencecn: 在享受自己住宅的舒适和庸俗的豪华时，却没有意识到被剥夺了生活所必需的东西。

sentence: The modern city consists of monstrous edifices and of dark, narrow streets full of petrol fumes and toxic gases,
sentencecn: 大得吓人的高楼和阴暗狭窄的街道组成了今日现代化的城市。街道上充斥着汽油味和有毒气体，

sentence: torn by the noise of the taxicabs, lorries and buses, and thronged ceaselessly by great crowds.
sentencecn: 出租汽车、卡车、公共汽车的噪音刺耳难忍，络绎不绝的人群挤来挤去。

sentence: Obviously, it has not been planned for the good of its inhabitants.
sentencecn: 显然，现代化的城市不是这居民的利益而规划的。

sentence: Lesson 22 Knowledge and progress
sentencecn: 课文22  知识和进步

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: In what two areas have people made no 'progress' at all?
sentencecn: 在哪两个领域人们没有取得任何“进步”?

sentence: Why does the idea of progress loom so large in the modern world?
sentencecn: 为什么进步这个概念在现代世界显得如此突出？

sentence: Surely because progress of a particular kind is actually taking place around us
sentencecn: 无疑是因为有一种特殊的进步实际上正在我们周围发生，而且变得越来越明显。

sentence: and is becoming more and more manifest.
sentencecn: 而且变得越来越明显。

sentence: Although mankind has undergone no general improvement in intelligence or morality,
sentencecn: 虽然人类有智力和道德上没有得到普遍提高，

sentence: it has made extraordinary progress in the accumulation of knowledge.
sentencecn: 但在知识积累方面却取得了巨大的进步。

sentence: Knowledge began to increase as soon as the thoughts of one individual
sentencecn: 知识的积累便开始了，一旦人能用

sentence: could be communicated to another by means of speech.
sentencecn: 语言同别人交流思想。

sentence: With the invention of writing, a great advance was made,
sentencecn: 随着书写的发明，又迈进了一大步，

sentence: for knowledge could then be not only communicated but also stored.
sentencecn: 因为这样一来，知识不仅能交流，而且能储存了。

sentence: Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries:
sentencecn: 藏书使教育成为可能，而教育反过来又丰富了藏书，

sentence: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law,
sentencecn: 因为知识的增长遵循着一种“滚雪球”的规律。

sentence: which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing.
sentencecn: 印刷术的发明又大大提高了知识增长的速度。

sentence: All this was comparatively slow until, with the coming of science,
sentencecn: 所有这些发展都比较缓慢，而随着科学的到来，

sentence: the tempo was suddenly raised.
sentencecn: 增长的速度才突然加快。

sentence: Then knowledge began to be accumulated according to a systematic plan.
sentencecn: 于是，知识便开始有系统有计划地积累起来。

sentence: The trickle became a stream: the stream has now become a torrent.
sentencecn: 涓涓细流汇成小溪，小溪现已变成了奔腾的江河。

sentence: Moreover, as soon as new knowledge is acquired, it is now turned to practical account.
sentencecn: 而且，新知识一旦获得，便得到实际应用。

sentence: What is called 'modern civilization
sentencecn: 所谓“现代文明”

sentence: is not the result of a balanced development of all man's nature,
sentencecn: 并不是人的天性平衡发展的结果，

sentence: but of accumulated knowledge applied to practical life.
sentencecn: 而是积累起来的知识应用到实际生活中的结果。

sentence: The problem now facing humanity is:
sentencecn: 现在人类面临的问题是：

sentence: What is going to be done with all this knowledge?
sentencecn: 用这些知识去做什么？

sentence: As is so often pointed out, knowledge is a two-edged weapon
sentencecn: 正像人们常常指出的，知识是一把双刃刀，

sentence: which can be used equally for good or evil.
sentencecn: 可以用于造福，也可以用来为害。

sentence: It is now being used indifferently for both.
sentencecn: 人们现在正漫不经心地把知识用于这两个方面，

sentence: Could any spectacle, for instance, be more grimly whimsical
sentencecn: 例如：炮兵利用科学毁坏人的身体、

sentence: than that of gunners using science to shatter men's bodies
sentencecn: 而外科医生就在附近用科学抢救被炮兵毁坏的人体，

sentence: while, close at hand, surgeons use it to restore them?
sentencecn: 还有什么情景比这更可怕、更怪诞的吗？

sentence: We have to ask ourselves very seriously
sentencecn: 我们不得不严肃地问问我们自己：

sentence: what will happen if this twofold use of knowledge,
sentencecn: 如果我们继续利用知识的这种双重性，

sentence: with its ever-increasing power, continues.
sentencecn: 将会发生什么样的情况呢？

sentence: Lesson 25 Non-auditory effects of noise
sentencecn: 课文25  噪音的非听觉效应

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What conclusion does the author draw about noise and health in this piece?
sentencecn: 关于噪音和健康，作者得出了什么结论?

sentence: Many people in industry and the Services,
sentencecn: 在工业部门工作和在军队中服役的许多人

sentence: who have practical experience of noise,
sentencecn: 对噪声音有切身的体会，

sentence: regard any investigation of this question as a waste of time;
sentencecn: 他们认为对这个问题进行调查中浪费时间，

sentence: they are not prepared even to admit the possibility that noise affects people.
sentencecn: 甚至不愿承认噪音可能对人有影响。

sentence: On the other hand,
sentencecn: 另一方面，

sentence: those who dislike noise will sometimes use most inadequate evidence
sentencecn: 那些讨厌噪音的人有时会用不充分的证据

sentence: to support their pleas for a quieter society.
sentencecn: 来支持他们希望有一个较为安静的社会环境的要求。

sentence: This is a pity, because noise abatement really is a good cause,
sentencecn: 要求减少噪音是件好事，

sentence: and it is likely to be discredited if it gets to be associated with bad science.
sentencecn: 但是如果与拙劣的科学掺杂在一起的话，就不会被人们所信任，这是很遗憾的。

sentence: One allegation often made is that noise produces mental illness.
sentencecn: 常见的一种指责是，噪音能引起精神病。

sentence: A recent article in a weekly newspaper, for instance,
sentencecn: 例如，最近一家周报刊登了一篇文章，

sentence: was headed with a striking illustration of a lady in a state of considerable distress,
sentencecn: 文章上方有一幅引人注目的插图，是一位表情沮丧的女子。

sentence: with the caption 'She was yet another victim, reduced to a screaming wreck'.
sentencecn: 图的文字说明：“她是又一个受害者，成了只会尖叫的可怜虫。”

sentence: On turning eagerly to the text, one learns that the lady was a typist
sentencecn: 当人们急切地看完正文后，便知道这女子是个打字员，

sentence: who found the sound of office typewriters worried her more and more
sentencecn: 办公室打字机的声音使她越来越烦，

sentence: until eventually she had to go into a mental hospital.
sentencecn: 最终住进了精神病医院。

sentence: Now the snag in this sort of anecdote is of course that one cannot distinguish cause and effect.
sentencecn: 这类奇闻的疑难之处是无法区别因果关系。

sentence: Was the noise a cause of the illness,
sentencecn: 是噪音引起了（精神）病呢，

sentence: or were the complaints about noise merely a symptom?
sentencecn: 还是（精神）病的症状之一是对噪音的抱怨？

sentence: Another patient might equally well complain
sentencecn: 另有一位病人可能同样有理由抱怨说，

sentence: that her neighbours were combining to slander her and persecute her,
sentencecn: 她的邻居们正在联合起来对她进行诽谤和迫害，

sentence: and yet one might be cautious about believing this statement.
sentencecn: 不过，人们不会轻信她的抱怨。

sentence: What is needed in the case of noise is a study of large numbers of people living under noisy conditions,
sentencecn: 对于噪音问题，需要对大量生活在噪音中的人进行研究，

sentence: to discover whether they are mentally ill more often than other people are.
sentencecn: 看一看他们是否比其他人更易患精神病。

sentence: Some time ago the United States Navy, for instance,
sentencecn: 例如，美国海军前些时候

sentence: examined a very large number of men working on aircraft carriers:
sentencecn: 调查了许多在航空母航上工作的人，

sentence: the study was known as Project Anehin.
sentencecn: 这次调查被称之为：“安内英工程”。

sentence: It can be unpleasant to live even several miles from an aerodrome;
sentencecn: 即使住在离机场几英里以外的地方，机场的噪音也会使人难受。

sentence: if you think what it must be like to share the deck of a ship with several squadrons of jet aircraft,
sentencecn: 因此，如果你能想像出和几个中队的喷气机同在一个甲板上是什么滋味儿的话，

sentence: you will realize that a modern navy is a good place to study noise.
sentencecn: 你就会认识到现代海军是研究噪音的好地方。

sentence: But neither psychiatric interviews nor objective tests
sentencecn: 但是，不管进行精神病学的调查访问，还是进行客观的测试，

sentence: were able to show any effects upon these American sailors.
sentencecn: 都不能显示噪音对这些美国水兵有任何影响。

sentence: This result merely confirms earlier American and British studies:
sentencecn: 这个结果只不过证实了美国和英国早些时候的研究结论：

sentence: if there is any effect of noise upon mental health,
sentencecn: 如果噪音对精神健康有影响的话，

sentence: it must be so small that present methods of psychiatric diagnosis cannot find it.
sentencecn: 那也一定是微乎其微，以致现代的精神病诊断方法还发现不了。

sentence: That does not prove that it does not exist; but it does mean
sentencecn: 这并不是证实不存在噪音对健康的影响。但它确实说明，

sentence: that noise is less dangerous than, say being brought up in an orphanage
sentencecn: 噪音的危险性 -- 比如说 -- 比在孤儿院长大所受的危害要小一些，

sentence: --which really is a mental health hazard.
sentencecn: 孤儿院才是真正危害精神健康的地方。

sentence: Lesson 27 The 'Vasa
sentencecn: 课文27  “瓦萨”号

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What happened to the 'Vasa' almost immediately after she was launched?
sentencecn: “瓦萨”号下水后几乎立即发生了什么?

sentence: From the seventeenth-century empire of Sweden,
the story of a galleon that sank at the start of her maiden voyage in 1628 must be one of the strangest tales of the sea.
sentencecn: 一艘大帆船在处女航时就沉没了，这个从容不迫7世纪瑞典帝国流传至今的故事无疑是航海史上最离奇的事件之一。

sentence: For nearly three and a half centuries she lay at the bottom of Stockholm harbour until her discovery in 1956.
sentencecn: 这艘大船在斯德哥尔摩港口的海底躺了将近几年来个世纪之后，直到1956年才被发现。

sentence: This was the Vasa, royal flagship of the great imperial fleet.
sentencecn: 这就是“瓦萨”号，帝国大舰的皇家旗舰。

sentence: King Gustavus Adolphus 'The Northern Hurricane',
sentencecn: 当时号称“北方飓风”的国王古斯夫斯.阿道尔弗

sentence: then at the height of his military success in the 'Thirty Years' War,
sentencecn: 正处在“三十年战争”的军事鼎盛阶段，

sentence: had dictated her measurements and armament.
sentencecn: 他亲自规定了这艘船的规模和武器配备。

sentence: Triple gun-decks mounted sixty-four bronze cannon.
sentencecn: 3层的火炮甲板上装着眼点4门青铜加农炮，

sentence: She was intended to play a leading role in the growing might of Sweden.
sentencecn: 目的就是要在不断增长的瑞典势力中起主导作用。

sentence: As she was prepared for her maiden voyage on August 10, 1628, Stockholm was in a ferment.
sentencecn: 1628年8月10日，“瓦萨”号准备首航时，斯德哥尔摩一片欢腾。

sentence: From the Skeppsbron and surrounding islands
sentencecn: 从斯开波斯布朗和周围的岛屿

sentence: the people watched this thing of beauty begin to spread her sails and catch the wind.
sentencecn: 前来的人们观看着这艘美丽的战船扬帆起航，乘风前进。

sentence: They had laboured for three years to produce this floating work of art;
sentencecn: 瑞典人辛辛苦苦干了3年才建成这件水上艺术品，

sentence: she was more richly carved and ornamented than any previous ship.
sentencecn: 它比以往任何船只雕刻得都更加精美，装饰得都更加华丽。

sentence: The high stern castle was a riot of carved gods, demons, knights, kings, warriors,
sentencecn: 高耸的船楼上雕刻了令人眼花缭乱的神仙、妖魔、骑士、国王、武士、

sentence: mermaids, cherubs; and zoomorphic animal shapes ablaze with red and gold and blue,
sentencecn: 美人鱼和小天使，还有用红色、金黄色、蓝色绘制的光彩夺目的兽形图案，

sentence: symbols of courage, power, and cruelty,
sentencecn: 象征着勇敢、力量和残暴，

sentence: were portrayed to stir the imaginations of the superstitious sailors of the day.
sentencecn: 以激起汉时崇尚迷信的水手们的想像。

sentence: Then the cannons of the anchored warships thundered a salute to which the Vasa fired in reply.
sentencecn: 这时，停泊在港口的其他战船向“瓦萨”号鸣炮致礼，“瓦萨”号也鸣炮回礼。

sentence: As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow,
sentencecn: 当“瓦萨”号从弥漫的礼炮烟云中出现时，船头下浪花加溅，

sentence: her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze,
sentencecn: 舰旗迎风招展，三角旗随风飘动，微风鼓起风帆，

sentence: and the red and gold or her superstructure ablaze with colour,
sentencecn: 金碧辉煌的船楼闪耀着灿烂的色彩。

sentence: she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before.
sentencecn: “瓦萨”号展现的壮观景象是斯德哥尔摩人从未见过的。

sentence: All gun-ports were open and the muzzles peeped wickedly from them.
sentencecn: 船上的炮眼开着，炮口虎视眈眈地向外窥视着。

sentence: As the wind freshened there came a sudden squall and the ship made a strange movement, listing to port.
sentencecn: 当风力增强时，突然刮来一阵大风，“瓦萨”号奇怪地摇晃了一下，便向左舷倾斜。

sentence: The Ordnance officer ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard
sentencecn: 炮长命令把左舷上所有大炮搬到右舷上来

sentence: to counteract the list but the steepening angle of the decks increased.
sentencecn: 以抵消船的倾斜，但甲板的倾斜度仍在增加。

sentence: Then the sound of rumbling thunder reached the watchers on the shore,
sentencecn: 岸上的观众听到了雷鸣般的轰响，

sentence: as cargo, ballast, ammunition and 400 people went sliding and crashing down to the port side of the steeply listing ship.
sentencecn: 此时物口、压舱物、弹药和400个人轰地一声滑向陡斜的左舷时。

sentence: The lower gun-ports were now below water and the inrush sealed the ship's fate.
sentencecn: 下层炮眼已淹没在水里，涌进船舱的水给“瓦萨”号带来了难以逃脱的厄运。

sentence: In that first glorious hour, the mighty Vasa, which was intended to rule the Baltic,
sentencecn: 就这样，想要统治波罗的海的大型战舰“瓦萨”号，

sentence: sank with all flags flying -- in the harbour of her birth.
sentencecn: 在它壮丽的起航时刻，带着全身飘扬的彩旗，沉没在了它诞生的港口。

sentence: Lesson 31 The sculptor speaks
sentencecn: 课文31  雕塑家的语言

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What do you have to be able to do to appreciate sculpture?
sentencecn: 你必须具备什么才能欣赏雕塑?

sentence: Appreciation of sculpture depends upon the ability to respond to form in 3 dimensions.
sentencecn: 对雕塑的鉴赏力取决于对立体的反应能力。

sentence: That is perhaps why sculpture has been described as the most difficult of all arts;
sentencecn: 雕塑被说成是所有艺术中最难的艺术，可能就是这个道理。

sentence: certainly it is more difficult than the arts which involve appreciation of flat forms, shape in only two dimensions.
sentencecn: 欣赏雕塑品当然比欣赏平面的艺术品要难。

sentence: Many more people are 'form-blind' than colour-blind.
sentencecn: 形盲”的人数比“色盲”的人数要多得多。

sentence: The child learning to see, first distinguishes only two-dimensional shape; it cannot judge distances, depths.
sentencecn: 正在学看东西的儿童起初只会分辨二维形态，不会判断距离和深度。

sentence: Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly 3-dimensonal distances.
sentencecn: 慢慢地，由于自身安全和实际需要，儿童必须发展（部分通过触觉）粗略判断三维空间距离的能力。

sentence: But having satisfied the requirements of practical necessity, most people go no further.
sentencecn: 但是。大部分人在满足了实际需要后，就不再继续发展这种能力了。

sentence: Though they may attain considerable accuracy in the perception of flat form,
sentencecn: 虽然他们对平面形的感觉能达到相当准确的程度，

sentence: they do not make the further intellectual and emotional effort needed to comprehend form in its full spatial existence.
sentencecn: 但他们没有在智力和感情上进一步努力去理解存在于空间的整个形态。

sentence: This is what the sculptor must do.
sentencecn: 而雕塑家就必须做到这一点。

sentence: He must strive continually to think of and use, form in its full spatial completeness.
sentencecn: 他必须勤于想像并且利用形体在空间中的完整性。

sentence: He gets the solid shape as it were, inside his head -- he thinks of it, whatever its size, as if he were holding it completely enclosed in the hollow of his hand.
sentencecn: 可以说，当他想像一个物体时，不管其大小如何，他脑子里得到的是一个立体的概念，就好像完全握在自己手心里一样。

sentence: He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself;
sentencecn: 他的大脑能从物体周围的各个角度勾画出其复杂的形象，

sentence: he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight;
sentencecn: 他看物体的一边时，便知道另一边是个什么样子。他把自身和物体重心、质量、重量融为一体。

sentence: he realizes its volume as the space that the shape displaces in the air.
sentencecn: 他能意识到物体的体积，那就是它的形状有空气中所占的空间。

sentence: And the sensitive observer of sculpture must also learn to feel shape simply as shape, not as description or reminiscence.
sentencecn: 因此，敏锐的雕塑观赏者也必须学会把形体作为形体来感觉，不要靠描述和印象去想象。

sentence: He must, for example, perceive an egg as a simple single solid shape quite apart from its significance as food,
sentencecn: 以鸟蛋为例。观赏者必须感觉到它是一个单一的实体形态，而完全不靠它的食用意义

sentence: or from the literary idea that it will become a bird.
sentencecn: 或它会变成鸟这样的文字概念来感觉。

sentence: And so with solids such as a shell, a nut, a plum, a pear, a tadpole, a mushroom,
sentencecn: 对于其他实体，如，贝壳、核桃、李子、梨子、蝌蚪、蘑菇、

sentence: a mountain peak, a kidney, a carrot, a tree-trunk, a bird, a bud, a lark, a ladybird, a bulrush, a bone.
sentencecn: 山峰、肾脏、胡萝卜、树干、鸟儿、花蕾、云雀、瓢虫、芦苇以及骨头也应这样来感觉。

sentence: From these he can go on to appreciate more complex forms or combinations of several forms.
sentencecn: 从这些形体出发，观赏者可进一步观察更为复杂的形体或若干形体的组合。

sentence: Lesson 35 Space odyssey
sentencecn: 课文35  太空探索

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: When will it be possible for us to think seriously about colonising Mars?
sentencecn: 我们什么时候才能认真考虑殖民火星?

sentence: The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System supplying the rocket fuels for its ships,
sentencecn: 月球很可能成为太阳系的工业中心。从月球上的岩石中可以获得航天飞船的燃料，

sentence: easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen.
sentencecn: 很容易从中提炼出液态氧。

sentence: The reason lies in its gravity.
sentencecn: 其原因在于月球的重力。

sentence: Because the Moon has only an eightieth of the Earth's mass,
sentencecn: 因为月球的重只有地球的1/8，

sentence: it requires 97% less energy
sentencecn: 它需要耗的能量少97%，

sentence: to travel the quarter of a million miles from the Moon to Earth-orbit than the 200 mile-journey from Earth's surface into orbit!
sentencecn: 对比从月球到地球的25万英里所消耗的能量要以及地球表面进入地球轨道的200英里。

sentence: This may sound fantastic, but it is easily calculated.
sentencecn: 这点听起来令人难以置信，但却很容易计算出来。

sentence: To escape from the Earth in a rocket, one must travel at seven miles per second.
sentencecn: 要乘坐一枚火箭飞离地球，火箭的速度要达到每秒7英里，

sentence: The comparable speed from the Moon is only 1.5 miles per second.
sentencecn: 而从月球出发的相应速度史是每秒1.5英里。

sentence: Because the gravity on the Moon's surface is only a sixth of Earth's (remember how easily the Apollo astronauts bounded along),
sentencecn: 由于月球表面的重力仅是地球表面的1/6 -- 还记得阿波罗飞船中的宇航员累松地跳跃 --

sentence: it takes much less energy to accelerate to that 1.5mps than it does on Earth.
sentencecn: 在月球上加速到每秒1.5英里比在地球上所用能源要少得多。

sentence: Moon dwellers will be able to fly in space at only three percent of the cost of similar journeys by their terrestrial cousins.
sentencecn: 月球居民在太空遨游的费用仅是地球上朋友飞越同样路所需费用的3%。

sentence: Arthur C.Clark once suggested a revolutionary idea passes through three phases:
sentencecn: 亚瑟.C.克拉克曾提议，一种创新的想法要经过以下3个阶段：

sentence: 1. 'It's impossible -- don't waste my time.
sentencecn: 1 “根本不可能，不要浪费我的时间。”

sentence: 2. 'It's possible, but not worth doing.
sentencecn: 2 “可能，但不值得做。”

sentence: 3. 'I said it was a good idea all along.
sentencecn: 3 “我一直说这是个好想法。”

sentence: The idea of colonising Mars -- a world 160 times more distant than the Moon -- will move decisively from the second phase to the third,
sentencecn: 征服火星的计划 -- 一个比月球远160倍的星球 -- 就可以明确地从第2阶段进入第3阶段，

sentence: when a significant number of people are living permanently in space.
sentencecn: 如果有相当数量的人永久性地住在太空。

sentence: Mars has an extraordinary fascination for would-be voyagers.
sentencecn: 火星对未来的星际旅客说有着特殊的魅力。

sentence: America, Russia and Europe are filled with enthusiasts -- many of them serious and senior scientists who dream of sending people to it.
sentencecn: 美国、俄罗斯和欧洲都有许多热心此项事业的人 -- 其中的不少是认真和资深的科学家，他们一直梦想着把人送上火星。

sentence: Their aim is understandable.
sentencecn: 他们的目标是可以理解的。

sentence: It is the one world in the Solar System that is most like the Earth.
sentencecn: 火星是太阳系里与地球最接近的一颗行星。

sentence: It is a world of red sandy deserts (hence its name -- the Red Planet),
sentencecn: 这是一个红色沙漠的世界（因而得名：红色行星），

sentence: cloudless skies, savage sandstorms, chasms wider than the Grand Canyon and at least one mountain more than twice as tall as Everest.
sentencecn: 无云的天空，凶猛的沙暴，比大峡谷还宽的裂缝，起码有一座山有珠穆朗玛峰的近两倍高。

sentence: It seems ideal for settlement.
sentencecn: 看起来，它很合适居住。

sentence: Lesson 41 Training elephants
sentencecn: 课文41  训练大象

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: At what point does the training of a captive wild elephant begin?
sentencecn: 圈养野象的训练从什么时候开始?

sentence: Two main techniques have been used for training elephants, which we may call respectively the tough and the gentle.
sentencecn: 驯象有两种主要的方法，我们分别称之为强硬法和温柔法。

sentence: The former method simply consists of setting an elephant to work and beating him until he does what is expected of him.
sentencecn: 强硬法就是驱象去干活，把它打顺从为止。

sentence: Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training,
sentencecn: 且不说道义问题，这本身就是一种愚蠢的训练方法，

sentence: for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer.
sentencecn: 因为这种方法训练会使动物反感，在以后某个时期可能会变成伤人的动物。

sentence: The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages,
sentencecn: 温柔法要求在最初阶段保持较大的耐心，

sentence: but produce a cheerful good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service.
sentencecn: 但这种方法可以训练出性情愉快、脾气温顺，能忠实为人服务多年的大象。

sentence: The first essential in elephant training is to assign to the animal a single mahout who will be entirely responsible for the job.
sentencecn: 驯象中至关生要的是指派一名专门的驯象员，全面负责这项工作。

sentence: Elephants like to have one master just as dogs do, and are capable of a considerable degree of personal affection.
sentencecn: 大象和狗一样，喜欢有一个专一的主人，而且会对主人产生相当深厚的私人感情。

sentence: There are even stories of half-trained elephant calves who have refused to feed and pined to death
sentencecn: 甚至有这样的故事：训练了一半的小象，竟拒绝吃食，消瘦至死，

sentence: when by some unavoidable circumstance they have been deprived of their own trainer.
sentencecn: 在由于不可避免的情况与他们的主人分离后。

sentence: Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt,
sentencecn: 这种极端的事例虽不可全信，

sentence: but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training.
sentencecn: 但强调了一项基本原则，象和驯象员之间的关系是驯象成功与否的关健。

sentence: The most economical age to capture an elephant for training is between 15 and 20 years,
sentencecn: 捕捉15至20岁之间年龄的大象进行驯象最为经济。

sentence: for it is then almost ready to undertake heavy work and can begin to earn its keep straight away.
sentencecn: 这个年龄的象差不多已能干重活，可以很快挣回饲养它的开支。

sentence: But animals of this age do not easily become subservient to man, and a very firm hand must be employed in the early stages.
sentencecn: 但这个年龄的象不易驯服，因此开始阶段需要有一位强有力的老手。

sentence: The captive elephant, still roped to a tree,
sentencecn: 捕来拴在树上的大象，

sentence: plunges and screams every time a man approaches, and for several days will probably refuse all food through anger and fear.
sentencecn: 每当有人走近它时，就会向前猛冲并发出尖叫，甚至一连几于都由于愤怒和恐惧而拒绝进食。

sentence: Sometimes a tame elephant is tethered nearby to give the wild one confidence,
sentencecn: 有时，把一头已驯服的象拴在旁边能给野象以信心。

sentence: and in most cases the captive gradually quietens down and begins to accept its food.
sentencecn: 在大多数情况下，刚博来的象会慢慢静下来，接着开始吃食。

sentence: The next stage is to get the elephant to the training establishment,
sentencecn: 下一步就是把象带到训练场所，

sentence: a ticklish business which is achieved with the aid of two tame elephants roped to the captive on either side.
sentencecn: 这是一件棘手的事，需要在它两侧拴上两头驯服的大象才能完成。

sentence: When several elephants are being trained at one time,
sentencecn: 几只象同时训练时，

sentence: it is customary for the new arrival to be placed between the stalls of two captives whose training is already well advanced.
sentencecn: 通常是把新到的安置在两头训练得很好的大象的象厩中间，

sentence: It is then left completely undisturbed with plenty of food and water
sentencecn: 然后给它以充足的食物和水，

sentence: so that it can absorb the atmosphere of its new home and see that nothing particularly alarming is happening to its companions.
sentencecn: 一定不要惊扰它，以便让他能适应新居的气氛，并且看到自己的同伴身上没有发生让自己担惊受怕的事。
