sentence: When it is eating normally, its own training begins.
sentencecn: 当它进食正常了，训练就开始。

sentence: The trainer stands in front of the elephant holding a long stick with a sharp metal point.
sentencecn: 驯练员手持一根有锋利金属尖头的长棒，站在象前。

sentence: Two assistants, mounted on tame elephants, control the captive from either side,
sentencecn: 两位助手骑在驯服的象的背上，从两侧控制新捕的象，

sentence: while others rub their hands over his skin to the accompaniment of a monotonous and soothing chant.
sentencecn: 其他人唱着单调的歌声用手抚摸象的皮肤。

sentence: This is supposed to induce pleasurable sensations in the elephant,
sentencecn: 据说这是为了使象产生愉快的感觉，

sentence: and its effects are reinforced by the use of endearing epithets,
sentencecn: 为了加强这种效果，人闪还按象的年龄性别，给以亲切的外号，

sentence: such as 'ho! my son', or 'ho! my father' or 'my mother according to the age and sex of the captive.
sentencecn: 如“嗬！我的孩子”、“嗬！我的爸爸”、“嗬！我的妈妈”。

sentence: The elephant is not immediately susceptible to such blandishments, however, and usually lashes fiercely with its trunk in all directions.
sentencecn: 然而大象不会立刻被这些讨好的括感动，而往往是用鼻子朝各个方向猛烈地甩动。

sentence: These movements are controlled by the trainer with the metal-pointed stick,
sentencecn: 训练员要用有锋利金属尖的长棒控制它的这种举动，

sentence: and the trunk eventually becomes so sore that the elephant curls it up and seldom afterwards uses it for offensive purposes.
sentencecn: 象鼻子最后疼得卷了起来，以后它就很少用鼻子去进攻了。

sentence: Lesson 43 Are there strangers in space?
sentencecn: 课文43  宇宙中有外星人吗？

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What does the 'uniquely rational way' for us to communicate with other intelligent beings in space depend on?
sentencecn: 我们与太空中其他智能生物交流的“唯一理性方式”依赖于什么?

sentence: We must conclude from the work of those who have studied the origin of life,
sentencecn: 根据研究生命起源的人们所作的工作，我们必然会得出这样的结论：

sentence: that given a planet only approximately like our own, life is almost certain to start.
sentencecn: 如果设想有一颗行星和我们地球的情况基本相似，那几乎肯定会产生生命。

sentence: Of all the planets in our solar system, we are now pretty certain the Earth is the only one on which life can survive.
sentencecn: 我们目前可以肯定的是，在我们太阳系的所有行星中，地球是生命能存在的唯一行星。

sentence: Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen, Venus far too hot, and so is Mercury,
sentencecn: 火星太干燥又缺氧，金星太热，水星也一样。

sentence: and the outer planets have temperatures near absolute zero and hydrogen-dominated atmospheres.
sentencecn: 除此之外，太阳系的其他行星的温度都接近绝对零度，并围绕着以氢气为主的大气层。

sentence: But other suns, start as the astronomers call them, are bound to have planets like our own, and as is the number of stars in the universe is so vast,
sentencecn: 但是，其他的太阳，既天文学家所说的恒星，肯定会有像我们地球一样的行星。因为宇宙中恒星的数目极其庞大，

sentence: this possibility becomes virtual certainty.
sentencecn: 所以存在着产生生命星球的这种可能性是肯定无疑的。

sentence: There are one hundred thousand million starts in our own Milky Way alone,
sentencecn: 仅我们的银河系就有1000亿颗星，

sentence: and then there are three thousand million other milky ways or galaxies, in the universe.
sentencecn: 况且在宇宙中还有30亿个天河，即银河系。

sentence: so the number of stars that we know exist is now estimated at about 300 million million million.
sentencecn: 因此，我们所知道的现有恒星数目估计约有30亿X1000亿颗。

sentence: Although perhaps only 1 percent of the life that has started somewhere will develop into highly complex and intelligent patterns,
sentencecn: 虽然在已经产生生命的某个地方，可能只有1%会发展成高度复杂有智力的生命形态，

sentence: so vast is the number of planets, that intelligent life is bound to be a natural part of the universe.
sentencecn: 但是行星的数目是那么庞大，有智力的生命必然是宇宙的自然组成道听部分。

sentence: If then we are so certain that other intelligent life exists in the universe, why have we had no visitors from outer space yet?
sentencecn: 既然我们如此坚信宇宙中存在着其他有智力的生命，那么我们为什么还未见到外层空间来访的客人呢？

sentence: First of all, they may have come to this planet of ours thousands or millions of years ago,
sentencecn: 首先，他们可能在几千年前或几百年前已来过我们地球，

sentence: and found our then prevailing primitive state completely uninteresting to their own advanced knowledge.
sentencecn: 并且发现我们地球汉时普遍存在着的原始状态同他们的先进的知识相比是索然无味的。

sentence: Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer,
sentencecn: 美国一位重要的射电天文学家罗纳德.布雷斯韦尔教授

sentence: argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system,
sentencecn: 在《自然》杂志上提出了这样的观点：假如有如此高级文明生命访问了我们的太阳系，

sentence: may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization.
sentencecn: 很可能会在离开太阳系时留下自动化信号装置，等待先进文明的觉醒。

sentence: Such a messenger, receiving our radio and television signals,
sentencecn: 这种自动化信息装置，在接收到我们的无线电和电视信号后，

sentence: might well re-transmit them back to its home-planet,
sentencecn: 完全有可能把这些信号发回到原来的行星。

sentence: although what impression any other civilization would thus get from us is best left unsaid.
sentencecn: 至于其他文明行星对我们地球会有什么印象，还是不说为好。

sentence: But here we come up against the most difficult of all obstacles to contact with people on other planets
sentencecn: 然而，在和外星人联系中我们遇到的最大困难

sentence: -- the astronomical distances which separate us.
sentencecn: 是分隔我们的天文距离。

sentence: As a reasonable guess, they might, on an average, be 100 light years away.
sentencecn: 据合理推算，外星人离我们平均距离也有100光年之远

sentence: (A light year is the distance which light travels at 186,000 miles per second in one year, namely 6 million million miles.)
sentencecn: （1光年是光以每秒186,000英里的速度在一年内走的距离，即6万亿英里）。

sentence: Radio waves also travel at the speed of light,
sentencecn: 无线电波也是以光速传播的。

sentence: and assuming such an automatic messenger picked up our first broadcasts of the 1920's,
sentencecn: 假定外星人的这种自动化信息装置接收了我们二十世纪二十年代的第一次广播信号，

sentence: the message to its home planet is barely halfway there.
sentencecn: 那么这个信号在发回到原来的行星途中刚刚走了一半路程。

sentence: Similarly, our own present primitive chemical rockets,
sentencecn: 同样，我们目前使用的原始化学火箭，

sentence: though good enough to orbit men, have no chance of transporting us to the nearest other star,
sentencecn: 虽然把人送入轨道，但尚不能把我们送到离我们最近、

sentence: four light years away, let alone distances of tens or hundreds of light years.
sentencecn: 相距4光年的其他星球上去，更不用说几十光年或几百光年远的地方了。

sentence: Fortunately, there is a 'uniquely rational way' for us to communicate with other intelligent beings,
sentencecn: 幸运的是，有一种我们可以和其他智力生命通迅联系的“唯一合理的方法”，

sentence: as Walter Sullivan has put it in his excellent book,
sentencecn: 正如活尔特.沙利方在其杰作中阐述的，

sentence: We Are not Alone.
sentencecn: 《我们并不孤独》。

sentence: This depends on the precise radio frequency of the 21-cm wavelength, or 1420 megacycles per second.
sentencecn: 这种通迅联系要靠21厘料波段，即每秒1420兆周的精确无线电频率。

sentence: It is the natural frequency of emission of the hydrogen atoms in space and was discovered by us in 1951;
sentencecn: 这个频率是空间氢原子释放的自然频率，是在1951年被人类发现的。

sentence: it must be known to any kind of radio astronomer in the universe.
sentencecn: 这个频率是宇宙中任何射电天文学家都应该熟悉的。

sentence: Once the existence of this wave-length had been discovered,
sentencecn: 一旦这种波长的实际存在被发现，

sentence: it was not long before its use as the uniquely recognizable broadcasting frequency for interstellar communication was suggested.
sentencecn: 提出把它作为星际间唯一可辨认的广播频率就为期不远了。

sentence: Without something of this kind,
sentencecn: 没有这手段，

sentence: searching for intelligences on other planets would be like trying to meet a friend in London without a pre-arranged rendezvous
sentencecn: 要想寻觅其他星球上的智力生命，就如同去伦敦见一位朋友，事先未约定地点，

sentence: and absurdly wandering the streets in the hope of a chance encounter.
sentencecn: 而荒唐地在街上游逛，以期待碰巧遇上一样。

sentence: Lesson 45 Of men and galaxies
sentencecn: 课文45  人和星系

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What is the most influential factor in any human society?
sentencecn: 人类社会中最具影响力的因素是什么?

sentence: In man's early days, competition with other creatures must have been critical.
sentencecn: 在人类早期，人类与其他生物的竞争一定是必不可少的。

sentence: But this phase of our development is now finished.
sentencecn: 但这个发展阶段已经结束。

sentence: Indeed, we lack practice and experience nowadays in dealing with primitive conditions.
sentencecn: 确实，我们今天缺乏对付原始环境的实践和经验。

sentence: I am sure that, without modern weapons,
sentencecn: 我断定，如果没有现代化的武器，

sentence: I would make a very poor show of disputing the ownership of a cave with a bear, and in this I do not think that I stand alone.
sentencecn: 要我和一只熊去争洞穴，我会出洋相的；我也相信，出洋相者并非我一人。

sentence: The last creature to compete with man was the mosquito.
sentencecn: 能与竞争的生物最后只有蚊子，

sentence: But even the mosquito has been subdued by attention to drainage and by chemical sprays.
sentencecn: 然而即使蚊子，也由于我们注意清理污水和喷洒化学药品就被制服了。

sentence: Competition between ourselves, person against person,
sentencecn: 然而人类之间的战争，人与人，

sentence: community against community, still persists, however; and it is as fierce as it ever was.
sentencecn: 团体与团体，依然在进行着，而且和以前一样激烈。

sentence: But the competition of man against man is not the simple process envisioned in biology.
sentencecn: 但是，人与人的竞争并不像生物生物学中想像的那样是一个简单过程。

sentence: It is not a simple competition for a fixed amount of food determined by the physical environment,
sentencecn: 它已不是为了争得物质环境所决定的有限食物而进行的简单竞争了，

sentence: because the environment that determines our evolution is no longer essentially physical.
sentencecn: 因为决定我们进化环境的主要方面已不再是物质。

sentence: Our environment is chiefly conditoned by the things we believe.
sentencecn: 我们的环境主要是由我们所相信的东西所决定。

sentence: Morocco and California are bits of the Earth in very similar latitudes,
sentencecn: 摩洛哥和加利福尼亚是地球上纬度极其相似的两个地方，

sentence: both on the west coasts of continents with similar climates, and probably with rather similar natural resources.
sentencecn: 都在各自大陆的西海岸，气候相似，自然资源也可能相似。

sentence: Yet their present development is wholly different,
sentencecn: 但是，这两个地方目前的发展程度完全不一样。

sentence: not so much because of different people even,
sentencecn: 这倒不是因为人民不同，

sentence: but because of the different thoughts that exist in the minds of their inhabitants.
sentencecn: 而是由于居民头脑中的思想不同。

sentence: This is the point I wish to emphasize.
sentencecn: 这是我要强调的论点。

sentence: The most important factor in our environment is the state of our own minds.
sentencecn: 我们环境中最重要的因素就是我们的思想状况。

sentence: It is well known that where the white man has invaded a primitive culture,
sentencecn: 众所周知，凡是白人侵入原始文化的地方，

sentence: the most destructive effects have come not from physical weapons but from ideas.
sentencecn: 破坏作用最大的不是杀人的武器，而是思想。

sentence: Ideas are dangerous.
sentencecn: 思想是危险的。

sentence: The Holy Office knew this full well when it caused heretics to be burned in days gone by.
sentencecn: 宗教法庭对此是非常清楚的，因此从前它总是把异教徒烧死。

sentence: Indeed, the concept of free speech only exists in our modern society because when you are inside a community,
sentencecn: 的确，言论自由的概念只存在于我们现代社会中，因为当你生活在一个社团中时，

sentence: you are conditioned by the conventions of the community to such a degree that it is very difficult to conceive of anything really destructive.
sentencecn: 社团的风俗习惯会严格地制约你，使你很难有破坏性的想法。

sentence: It is only someone looking on from outside that can inject the dangerous thoughts.
sentencecn: 只有外部的旁观者才能灌输危险的思想。

sentence: I do not doubt that it would be possible to inject ideas into the modern world that would utterly destroy us.
sentencecn: 向现代世界灌输一种思想以便摧毁我们人类是可能的事，对此我并不怀疑。

sentence: I would like to give you an example, but fortunately I cannot do so.
sentencecn: 我愿为你举个例子，但幸亏我举不出。

sentence: Perhaps it will suffice to mention the nuclear bomb.
sentencecn: 也许提一下核弹就足以证明了。

sentence: Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society,
sentencecn: 对一个沿未拥有核弹、但科技相当发达的社会，

sentence: one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying suffcient details to enable the thing to be constructed.
sentencecn: 如果告诉它制造核弹的可能性，而且向它提供制造核弹的细节，那么可以设想，这将对这个社会产生何等的影响。

sentence: 20 or 30 pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925,
sentencecn: 如果把二三十页的情报交给1952年前后的任何一个世界强国，

sentence: would have been sufficient to change the course of world history.
sentencecn: 就足以改变世界历史的进程。

sentence: It is a strange thought, but I believe a correct one,
sentencecn: 这是个离奇的想法。不过我认为这个想法是正确的。

sentence: that twenty or thirty pages of ideas and information would be capable of turning the present-day world upside down, or even destroying it.
sentencecn: 二三十页材料中的思想和情报会便当今的世界翻天覆地，甚至毁灭这个世界。

sentence: I have often tried to conceive of what those pages might contain,
sentencecn: 我常常试图想像这些纸上所写的东西，

sentence: but of course I cannot do so because I am a prisoner of the present-day world, just as all of you are.
sentencecn: 不过我是做不到的，因为我和你们大家一样，是当今世界上的凡人。

sentence: We cannot think outside the particular patterns that our brains are conditioned to, or,
sentencecn: 我们不能脱离我们大脑所限定的模式去问题，

sentence: to be more accurate we can think only a very little way outside and then only if we are very original.
sentencecn: 我们只能稍微离开一点儿，就这也需要我们独创的思想。

sentence: Lesson 47 The great escape
sentencecn: 课文47  大逃亡

sentence: First listen and then answer the following question.
sentencecn: 听录音，然后回答以下问题。

sentence: What is one of the features of modern camping where nationality is concerned?
sentencecn: 现代露营与民族有关的特点之一是什么?

sentence: Economy is one powerful motive for camping,
sentencecn: 图省钱是露营的一个主要动机，

sentence: since after the initial outlay upon equipment, or through hiring it, the total expense can be far less than the cost of hotels.
sentencecn: 因为除了开始时购置或是租借一套露营装备外，总费用算起来要比住旅馆开支少得多。

sentence: But, contrary to a popular assumption, it is far from being the only one, or even the greatest.
sentencecn: 但是，和一般的看法相反，这决非是仅有的，甚至不是最主要的动机。

sentence: The man who manoeuvres carelessly into his 20 pounds' worth of space at one of Europe's myriad permanent sites may find himself bumping a Bentley.
sentencecn: 如果一位游客漫不经心地驾车驶入欧洲无数常年营地之一，花20镑租用一个空位，那么他可能会碰见一辆本特利汽车，

sentence: More likely, Ford Escort will be hub to hub with Renault or Mercedes, but rarely with bicycles made for two.
sentencecn: 更可能会望见一辆福特.康索尔或一辆雷诺或一辆梅塞迪斯并排停放着，不过双人自行车则不容易看到。

sentence: That the equipment of modern camping becomes yearly more sophisticated is an entertaining paradox for the cynic,
sentencecn: 现代露营装备一年比一年讲究，这对那些厌世嫉俗者来说是一件有趣的自相矛盾的事情。

sentence: a brighter promise for the hopeful traveller who has sworn to get away from it all.
sentencecn: 而对于发誓用露营来摆脱烦恼的人来说，却带来了更光明的前景。

sentence: It also provides -- and some student sociologist might care to base his thesis upon the phenomenon -- an escape of another kind.
sentencecn: 学社会学的大学生来露营是另一种形式的摆脱现实，他们的目的很可能是根据观察到的露营现象去写论文。

sentence: The modern traveller is often a man who dislikes the Splendide and the Bellavista,
sentencecn: 现代露营旅游的人往往讨厌在“斯普兰迪德”和“贝拉维斯塔”这样的大酒店，

sentence: not because he cannot afford, or shuns their material comforts, but because he is afraid of them.
sentencecn: 这并不是因为他们付不起钱，也不是为了躲避物质享受，而是因为他们害怕酒店。

sentence: Affluent he may be, but he is by no means sure what to tip the doorman or the chambermaid.
sentencecn: 他们可能很富有，但给看门人和房间女服务叫多少小费，心中却根本没有数；

sentence: Master in his own house he has little idea of when to say boo to a manager hotel.
sentencecn: 他们在家可能是主人，但不知道什么时候才能对酒店的经理表示不满。

sentence: From all such fears camping releases him.
sentencecn: 露营便人们免除了这些忧虑。

sentence: Granted, a snobbery of camping itself, based upon equipment and techniques, already exists;
sentencecn: 诚然，露营地本身也存在以露营装备和方式取人的势利现象，

sentence: but it is of a kind that, if he meets it, he can readily understand and deal with.
sentencecn: 但如果有这种情况，露营者也容易理解，知道如何对付，

sentence: There is no superior 'they' in the shape of managements and hotel hierarchies to darken his holiday days.
sentencecn: 但在露营地里根本不会有管人的“人上人”和酒店里的等级制度来种露营者的假日过得阴郁低沉。

sentence: To such motives, yet another must be added.
sentencecn: 除上以动机外，还应加上一个。

sentence: The contemporary phenomenon of car worship is to be explained not least by the sense of independence and freedom that ownership entails.
sentencecn: 当前崇拜汽车现象可以用与所有权相伴的独立和自由意识来解释。

sentence: To this pleasure camping gives an exquisite refinement.
sentencecn: 因此开车去露营会给这种快乐意识增加一种优雅意境。

sentence: From one's own front door to home or foreign hills or sands and back again, everything is to hand.
sentencecn: 从自己的家门出发到国内国外的山区或沙滩上露营然后返回，一切都很便利。

sentence: Not only are the means of arriving at the holiday paradise entirely within one's own command and keeping,
sentencecn: 完全在自己掌握之中的私人汽车不仅是到达假日天堂的工具，

sentence: but the means of escape from holiday hell (if the beach proves too crowded, the local weather too inclement)
sentencecn: 而且也是逃离假日地狱（如海滩太挤，当地天气恶劣）方便工具，

sentence: are there, outside -- or, as likely, part of -- the tent.
sentencecn: 因为汽车就停在帐篷外面，或者汽车本身可能就是露营帐篷的一个组成部分。

sentence: Idealists have objected to the practice of camping, as to the package tour,
sentencecn: 理想主义者像反对旅行社安排一切的一揽子旅游一样反对露营的作法，

sentence: that the traveller abroad thereby denies himself the opportunity of getting to know the people of the country visited.
sentencecn: 说这种封闭的作法使到国外旅游者失去了了解所去国家人民的机会。

sentence: Insularity and self-containment, it is argued, go hand in hand.
sentencecn: 他们争论说，心胸狭窄和自我封闭是并存的。

sentence: The opinion does not survive experience of a popular Continental camping place.
sentencecn: 但这种说法在受人欢迎的欧洲露营地是站不住脚的。

sentence: Holiday hotels tend to cater for one nationality of visitors especially, sometimes exclusively.
sentencecn: 假日旅馆有只接待来自一个国家的旅游者的倾向，有时会达到排他的程度。

sentence: Camping sites, by contrast, are highly cosmopolitan.
sentencecn: 而露营驻地则相反，是高度世界性的。

sentence: Granted, a preponderance of Germans is a characteristic that seems common to most Mediterranean sites;
sentencecn: 在大多数地中海露营地里，德国人占优势似乎是个普遍现象，确实如此，

sentence: but as yet there is no overwhelmingly specialized patronage.
sentencecn: 但并没有特别的优待。

sentence: Notices forbidding the open-air drying of clothes,
sentencecn: 禁止露天晒衣服、

sentence: or the use of water points for car washing,
sentencecn: 禁止用水龙头冲洗汽车的布告，

sentence: or those inviting 'our camping friends' to a dance or a boat trip are printed not only in French or Italian or Spanish, but also in English, German and Dutch.
sentencecn: 和邀请露营朋友参加舞会、乘船观光的招贴不仅印志法语、意大利语、西班牙语，而且也印成英语、德语、荷兰语。

sentence: At meal times the odour of sauerkraut vies with that of garlic.
sentencecn: 用饭的时候，德国泡菜味和大蒜味争相散发，

sentence: The Frenchman's breakfast coffee competes with the Englishman's bacon and eggs.
sentencecn: 法国人的早点咖啡和英国人的咸肉煎蛋竞相比美。

sentence: Whether the remarkable growth of organized camping means the eventual death of the more independent kind is hard to say.
sentencecn: 有组织的露营活动的明显发展是否意味着较独立的自我封闭式露营的最终消失，还很难说。

sentence: Municipalities naturally want to secure the campers' site fees and other custom.
sentencecn: 市政当局当然希望获得露营者的场地费和其他光临的好处，

sentence: Police are wary of itinerants who cannot be traced to a recognized camp boundary or to four walls.
sentencecn: 警察则对那些查不出有固定营地或住处的游荡者保持警惕。

sentence: But most probably it will all depend upon campers themselves: how many heath fires they cause; how much litter they leave;
sentencecn: 但最重要的或许是露营者自己，即他们引起了多少场野火，留下了多少垃圾。

sentence: in short, whether or not they wholly alienate landowners and those who live in the countryside.
sentencecn: 总之，他们是否弄得土地的主人和乡间的居民同他们反目。

sentence: Only good scouting is likely to preserve the freedoms so dear to the heart of the eternal Boy Scout.
sentencecn: 只有优良的童子军活动才能保持不朽的童子军所衷心热爱的各项自由。
